◆ bcm_port_control_set()

int bcm_port_control_set ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
bcm_port_control_t  type,
int  value 
)

Get or set various features at the port level.

Control or examine various features at the port level. bcm_port_control_set can be used to enable/disable various features at the port level. The <type> parameter to the API identifies the feature to be controlled. bcm_port_control_get returns the current value of the port feature identified by <type> parameter. The feature types are show in PORT_CONTROL_v :

bcm_port_control_t
bcmPortControlBridge Enable/Disable local port bridging
bcmPortControlTrunkHashSet Select one of the two sets of hash bits selection configuration for trunking (value 0: select config 0 set; value 1: select config 1 set; used in BCM56700/BCM56800/BCM56580). This is also applicable to WLAN ports.
bcmPortControlFabricTrunkHashSet Select one of the two sets of hash bits selection configuration for fabric trunking (value 0: select config 0 set; value 1: select config 1 set; used in BCM56700/BCM56800/BCM56580). This is also applicable to WLAN ports
bcmPortControlECMPHashSet Select one of the two sets of hash bits selection configuration for ECMP (value 0: select config 0 set; value 1: select config 1 set; used in BCM56700/BCM56800/BCM56580). This is also applicable to WLAN ports.
bcmPortControlLoadBalanceHashSet Select one of the two sets of hash bits selection configuration for LBID to be populated in HiGig2 header (value 0: select config 0 set; value 1: select config 1 set; used in BCM56700/BCM56800/BCM56580). This is also applicable to WLAN ports.
bcmPortControlLoadBalancingNumber Assigns the Load Balancing Number of this port for HiGig2 headers (valid values: 0-15). This is also applicable to WLAN ports.
bcmPortControlErrorSymbolDetect Enable or disable XAUI?|E| monitoring feature for port's XAUI lanes (value 0: disable the feature; value 1: enable the feature)
bcmPortControlErrorSymbolCount Get the number of XAUI |E| symbol occurred since last read. Setting any value to the count will set it to zero.
bcmPortControlIP4 Enable or disable L3 routing on IPv4 packets. This is also applicable to WLAN ports.
bcmPortControlIP6 Enable or disable L3 routing on IPv6 packets. This is also applicable to WLAN ports
bcmPortControlIP4Mcast Enable or disable L3 routing on IPv4 IPMC packets. This is also applicable to WLAN ports.
bcmPortControlIP6Mcast Enable or disable L3 routing on IPv6 IPMC packets. This is also applicable to WLAN ports.
bcmPortControlIP4McastL2 Enable or disable L2 switching on IPv4 IPMC packets based on (SG,*G) instead of (DMAC,VLAN). This is also applicable to WLAN ports.
bcmPortControlIP6McastL2 Enable or disable L2 switching on IPv6 IPMC packets based on (SG,*G) instead of (DMAC,VLAN). This is also applicable to WLAN ports
bcmPortControlMpls Enable or disable MPLS forwarding. This is also applicable to WLAN ports.
bcmPortControlPassControlFrames Allow Ethernet MAC control frames (pause and unsupported) to be copied to CPU.
bcmPortControlFilterLookup Enable or disable lookup field processor on the port. This is also applicable to WLAN ports.
bcmPortControlFilterIngress Enable or disable ingress field processor on the port. This is also applicable to WLAN ports. It is disabled by default for CPU port in Field module.
bcmPortControlFilterEgress Enable or disable egress field processor on the port.
bcmPortControlFrameSpacingStretch One byte of inter packet gap is added for specified number of packet data bytes. If the value is 10, one byte of IPG is added for each 10 bytes of packet data. If value is 0, Spacing Stretch function is disabled, and no extra IPG is added.
bcmPortControlPreservePacketPriority Preserves the incoming packet's 802.1P priority (value 1: preserve; value 0: do not preserve) This is also applicable to WLAN ports.
bcmPortControlLearnClassEnable Enable or disable class based learning on the port. This is also applicable to WLAN ports.
bcmPortControlTrustIncomingVlan Use the incoming packet's VLAN tag (value 1: use the incoming packet's tag; value 0: use the default VLAN). This is also applicable to WLAN ports.
bcmPortControlVlanStpCheck Enable or disable spanning tree and VLAN membership checks.
bcmPortControlPrbsMode Selects PRBS mode (value 0: PHY, value 1: MAC).
bcmPortControlPrbsPolynomial Assigns PRBS polynomial. see table BCM_PORT_PRBS_table .
bcmPortControlPrbsTxInvertData Configure inversion of Tx data (value 0: no inversion, value 1: inversion).
bcmPortControlPrbsRxInvertData Configure inversion of Rx data (value 0: no inversion, value 1: inversion).
bcmPortControlPrbsForceTxError Configure insertion of Tx errors (value 0: no error, value 1: error).
bcmPortControlPrbsTxEnable Enable Tx PRBS (value 0: disable, value 1: enable).
bcmPortControlPrbsRxEnable Enable Rx PRBS (value 0: disable, value 1: enable).
bcmPortControlPrbsRxStatus PRBS Rx status (0 indicates success).
bcmPortControlSerdesDriverStrength Assigns Driver Strength (valid values: 0-100).
bcmPortControlSerdesDriverEqualization Assigns Driver Equalization (valid values: 0-100).
bcmPortControlSerdesDriverTune Configure Tuning (value 0: off, value 1: on).
bcmPortControlSerdesDriverEqualizationFarEnd Far End driver Equalization (valid values: 0-100 ).
bcmPortControlSerdesDriverEqualizationTuneStatusFarEnd Far End driver Equalization recommended value (valid values: 0-100 ).
bcmPortControlAbility Assigns Port ability, see table BCM_PORT_ABILITY_table .
bcmPortControlMacInMac Enable/Disable MiM frame processing (value 0: disable, value 1: enable). This is also applicable to WLAN ports. Users are suggested to use finer granularity options bcmPortControlMimUcastTermEnable and bcmPortControlMimMcastTermEnable.
bcmPortControlSrcBmacMissToCpu Enable/Disable send to CPU, when Mac-in-Mac Source BMAC lookup is missed (value 0: disable, value 1: enable).
bcmPortControlFabricQueue Enable/Disable ext header on HiGig ports (value 0: disable, value 1: enable). (For BCM56860, CPU port can be specified to set EHV bit of HiGig2 header - this may be needed for certain scenarios specific to application's requirements.)
bcmPortControlFabricHeaderFormat Modify current header format, see PORT_CONTROL_FABRIC_HEADER_FORMAT_table .
bcmPortControlOamLoopback Enable/Disable 802.3 Clause 57 OA&M Loopback (value 0: disable, value 1: enable).
bcmPortControlPacketFlowMode Configure Packet flow (value 0: normal, value 1: re-queue). In normal mode, the port is configured to not loopback data meant to egress this port. In re-queue mode, the port is configured to loopback data meant to egress this port.
bcmPortControlEgressModifyDscp Enable outer ip header dscp modification.
bcmPortControlEgressModifyECN Enable ip header ECN modification.
bcmPortControlEgressVlanPriUsesPktPri Use the incoming packet's priority to obtain the outgoing priority. Setting this to zero uses the chip's internal priority to obtain the outgoing priority. Setting it to zero also overrides all other egress priority assignment mechanisms like egress DSCP mapping and MPLS EXP to priority mapping. (value 1: use incoming packet's priority, value 0: use chip's internal priority).
bcmPortControlEgressVlanCfiUsesPktPri Use the incoming packet's priority to obtain the outgoing Canonical Format Indicator (CFI). Setting this to zero uses the chip's internal priority to obtain the outgoing Canonical Format Indicator (CFI). (value 1: outgoing packet's cfi will not be remarked, value 0: use chip's internal priority).
bcmPortControlTrain Enable/disable SPI training (value 0: disable, value 1: enable).
bcmPortControlRxEnable Enable/disable SPI receiver (value 0: disable, value 1: enable).
bcmPortControlTxEnable Enable/disable SPI transmitter (value 0: disable, value 1: enable).
bcmPortControlRxLink SPI receiver status (value 0: down, value 1: up).
bcmPortControlTxLink SPI transmitter status (value 0: down, value 1: up).
bcmPortControlIpfixRate Set IPFIX flow rate meter ID.
bcmPortControlOAMEnable Enable reception of OAM messages (value 0: disable, value 1: enable).
bcmPortControlOamDefaultProfile OAM default profile (value: 0-3 [In 2 bit OAM LIF-profile mode or Advanced LIF-profile mode], 0-1 [In 1 bit OAM LIF-profile mode])
bcmPortControlOamDefaultProfileEgress OAM default profile for Egress (value: 0-3 [In 2 bit OAM LIF-profile mode or Advanced LIF-profile mode], 0-1 [In 1 bit OAM LIF-profile mode])
bcmPortControlPadToSize Min packet size in bytes, packets smaller than this value are padded with '0'.
bcmPortControlCustomerQueuing Enable customer domain queuing (value 0: disable, value 1: enable). [NOTE: For BCM5645x devices 0: Enable default cos queueing on the port. 1: Enable subscriber queueing on the port. 2: Enable highgig cos queueing on the port. 3: Enable vlan service queueing on the port.]
bcmPortControlEgressNonUnicastLossless Enable/Disable multicast/non-unicast Lossless operation (value 0: Lossy, value 1: Lossless).
bcmPortControlPFCEthertype Priority Flow Control packet EtherType (valid values: 0-0xffff).
bcmPortControlPFCOpcode Priority Flow Control packet opcode (valid values: 0-0xffff).
bcmPortControlPFCReceive Priority Flow Control packet receive enable (value 0: disable, value 1: enable).
bcmPortControlPFCTransmit Priority Flow Control packet transmit enable (value 0: disable, value 1: enable). [NOTE: For StrataXGS devices, use this flag can switch between PFC and PAUSE. i.e. PAUSE will be disabled when enabling PFC and vice versa.]
bcmPortControlPFCRefreshTime Priority Flow Control refresh timer value (valid values: 0-0xffff).
bcmPortControlPFCXOffTime Priority Flow Control XOff timer value (valid values: 0-0xffff, unit: 512 bit-times).
bcmPortControlPFCClasses Priority Flow Control number of classes (valid values: 8, 16).
bcmPortControlPFCPassFrames Allow Priority Flow Control packets into switch device (value 0: disable, value 1: enable).
bcmPortControlPFCDestMacOui Priority Flow Control packet destination MAC address, upper three bytes (valid values: 0-0xffffff).
bcmPortControlPFCDestMacNonOui Priority Flow Control packet destination MAC address, lower three bytes (valid values: 0-0xffffff).
bcmPortControlLanes Set the number of lanes to be used by the master port for the FlexPort feature. Valid values: 1 (master port is a one-lane port), 2 (master port is a two-lane port), 4 (master port is a four-lane port).
bcmPortControlVrf Enable per-port VRF to override per-VLAN VRF. Valid values: 1-maxVrf.
bcmPortControlL3Ingress Enable per-port L3-IIF for IP traffic. Valid values: 1-4095.
bcmPortControlIngressRateControlDrop Drop mode of packets that over rate control limit (value 0: pause mode, value 1: drop mode).
bcmPortControlL2Learn Configure L2 learning behavior (use values from BCM_PORT_LEARN_table). This is also applicable to WLAN ports.
bcmPortControlL2Move Configure L2 station movement behavior (use values from BCM_PORT_LEARN_table). This is also applicable to WLAN ports.
bcmPortControlForwardStaticL2MovePkt Allow forwarding L2 packet even if L2 movement is detected against an existing static entry in L2 table (value 0: disable, value 1: enable). This is also applicable to WLAN ports.
bcmPortControlLinkFaultLocalEnable Enable/Disable local link failure signaling message processing .
bcmPortControlLinkFaultRemoteEnable Enable/Disable remote link failure signaling message processing .
bcmPortControlLinkFaultLocal Read local link failure signaling message processing status.
bcmPortControlLinkFaultRemote Read local link failure signaling message processing status.
bcmPortControlTCPriority Set the default traffic class priority associated with the port.
bcmPortControlDropPrecedence Set the default drop precedence value associated with the port (valid value: 0, 1, 2, 3).
bcmPortControlLinkdownTransmit Enable the port and MAC for transmit during link down (value 0: disable, value 1: enable).
bcmPortControlTimestampTransmit Read the timestamp value assigned to TX packet.
bcmPortControlTimestampEnable Set the port to be capable of timestamping a TX packet in MAC.
bcmPortControlEEEEnable 0 = disable EEE, 1 = enable EEE for the port.
bcmPortControlEEETransmitIdleTime EEE Transmit Delay Entry time for the port, in microseconds.
bcmPortControlEEETransmitRefreshTime EEE Transmit Refresh time for the port.
bcmPortControlEEETransmitSleepTime EEE Transmit Sleep time for the port.
bcmPortControlEEEReceiveSleepTime EEE Receive Sleep time for the port.
bcmPortControlEEETransmitQuietTime EEE Transmit Quiet time for the port.
bcmPortControlEEEReceiveQuietTime EEE Receive Quiet time for the port.
bcmPortControlEEETransmitWakeTime EEE Transmit Wake time for the port.
bcmPortControlEEEReceiveWakeTime EEE Receive Wake time for the port.
bcmPortControlEEETransmitEventCount Incremented each time MAC Tx enters LP IDLE state.
bcmPortControlEEEReceiveEventCount Incremented each time MAC Rx enters LP IDLE state.
bcmPortControlEEETransmitDuration Duration of Tx LPI state in 10 usec increments.
bcmPortControlEEEReceiveDuration Duration of Rx LPI state in 10 usec increments.
bcmPortControlEEETransmitIdleTimeHund EEE Transmit Delay Entry time for the link speed at 100MB data rate.
bcmPortControlEEETransmitWakeTimeHund EEE Transmit Wake time for the link speed at 100MB data rate.
bcmPortControlEEETransmitMinLPITime Minimum time for the MAC stay in EEE LPI state.
bcmPortControlEEETransmitMinLPITimeHund Minimum time for the MAC stay in EEE LPI state at 100MB date rate.
bcmPortControlEEEEventCountSymmetric EEE counters in symmetric mode, TX and RX increment together. Default is asymmetric mode of independent counting.
bcmPortControlEEELinkActiveDuration EEE Active state transition delay in usec after link comes up. Default 1 second, range 0-0xffffff.
bcmPortControlSerdesTuneMarginMax Read SerDes max tune margin value.
bcmPortControlSerdesTuneMarginMode Enable/Disable SerDes tune margin mode for the port.
bcmPortControlSerdesTuneMarginValue Set the value for SerDes tune margin.
bcmPortControlStatOversize Threshold above which packet will be counted as oversized.
bcmPortControlStatOversizeIsError Oversize Threshold flag to control oversize packets as error counts.
bcmPortControlArbiterActive Indicates if the SCI link is active and its arbiter association. -1 indicates disabled, 0 indicates active and associated with Arbiter 0, 1 indicates active and associated with Arbiter 1.
bcmPortControlArbiterForceDown Status to be indicated to arbiter. TRUE forces Down, FALSE does not force down.
bcmPortControlFilterTcpUdpPktEnable Enable/disable the AutoVoIP function to filter the TCP and UDP packets.
bcmPortControlFabricSourceKnockout If set, disables packet forwarding to a non-trunk port on local device
bcmPortControlTrill 0 = Disable TRILL, 1 = Enable TRILL frame processing for the port.
bcmPortControlTrillAllow Allow TRILL frames (value: 1) for the port.
bcmPortControlNonTrillAllow Allow Non-TRILL frames (value: 1) for the port.
bcmPortControlTrillCoreISISToCPU Enable Core IS-IS frames received to be send to CPU.
bcmPortControlNonTrillAllow Select one of 2 sets of configuration for TRILL ECMP hashing.
bcmPortControlNivAccessVirtualInterfaceId Set source virtual interface ID.
bcmPortControlNivNonVntagDrop Set ingress drop control, if VNTAG is not present.
bcmPortControlNivVntagDrop Set ingress drop control, if VNTAG is present.
bcmPortControlNivNonVntagAdd Set add VNTAG action, when VNTAG is not present.
bcmPortControlNivVntagIngressReplace Set ingress replace VNTAG action, when VNTAG is present.
bcmPortControlNivVntagEgressReplace Set egress replace VNTAG action, when VNTAG is present.
bcmPortControlNivVntagIngressDelete Set ingress delete VNTAG action, when VNTAG is present.
bcmPortControlNivVntagEgressDelete Set egress delete VNTAG action, when VNTAG is present.
bcmPortControlNivRpfCheck Set incoming packet VNTAG.SRC_VIF RPF check control.
bcmPortControlNivSourceKnockout Set outgoing packet NIV pruning check control.
bcmPortControlNivForwardPort Set destination port for upstream forwarding, use -1 to configure port as uplink port.
bcmPortControlNivType Set NIV port type (enumerated values within bcm_port_niv_type_t).
bcmPortControlNivNameSpace Set virtual interface ID namespace value.
bcmPortControlRegexIP4 Enable/Disable Regex feature for IPv4 traffic.
bcmPortControlRegexIP6 Enable/Disable Regex feature for IPv6 traffic.
bcmPortControlRegexIP4Udp Enable/Disable Regex feature for IPv4 UDP traffic.
bcmPortControlRegexIP4Tcp Enable/Disable Regex feature for IPv4 TCP traffic.
bcmPortControlRegexIP6Udp Enable/Disable Regex feature for IPv6 UDP traffic.
bcmPortControlRegexIP6Tcp Enable/Disable Regex feature for IPv6 TCP traffic.
bcmPortControlPonEncryptKeyExpiryTime Set timeout value for encryption keys (unit: s).
bcmPortControlPonHoldoverState Enable/Disable holdover state for EPON port (value 0: disable, value 1: enable).
bcmPortControlPonHoldoverTime Set holdover time (unit: ms).
bcmPortControlPonMultiLlid Set LLID number.
bcmPortControlPonFecMode Set FEC mode on Rx and Tx together (value 0: Rx/Tx off, value 1: Rx on and Tx off, value 2: Rx off and Tx on, value 3: Rx/Tx on, value 4: settable per link).
bcmPortControlPonUserTraffic Enable/Disable user traffic for EPON port (value 0: disable, value 1: enable).
bcmPortControlEthPortAutoNegFailureAlarmState Set alarm state of auto-negotiation failure (value 0: alarm report off, value 1: alarm report on).
bcmPortControlEthPortLosAlarmState Set alarm state of port link los (value 0: alarm report off, value 1: alarm report on).
bcmPortControlEthPortFailureAlarmState Set alarm state of port failure (value 0: alarm report off, value 1: alarm report on).
bcmPortControlEthPortLoopbackAlarmState Set alarm state of port loopback (value 0: alarm report off, value 1: alarm report on).
bcmPortControlEthPortCongestionAlarmState Set alarm state of port congestion (value 0: alarm report off, value 1: alarm report on) .
bcmPortControlMplsEntropyHashSet Select one of 2 sets of configuration for MPLS Entropy hashing (value = 1/0).
bcmPortControlDefaultQueue Set default queue for use with the interface (may also require changes to processing rules to use the default queue).
bcmPortControlL2GreEnable Set per port enable for L2-GRE (Value=TRUE/FALSE).
bcmPortControlL2GreTunnelbasedVpnId Set per port VPNID lookup key (Value=TRUE/FALSE).
bcmPortControlL2GreDefaultTunnelEnable Set per port default-SVP for Tunnel lookup failure(Value=TRUE/FALSE).
bcmPortControlL2SaAuthenticaion to enable SA authentication check on a port.
bcmPortControlUnknownMacDaAction Per port configures set of actions that are taken by the device when an unknown destination address is recognized on an ingressing packet. See BCM_PORT_CONTROL_UNKNOWN_MACDA_flags .
bcmPortControlDiscardMacSaAction Per port configures set of actions that are taken by the device upon SA lookup when L2 entry flag with SA-discard. See BCM_PORT_CONTROL_DISCARD_MACSA_flags .
bcmPortControlManagementPacketIp6Reserved Per port configures management frame classification, frames with IPv6 Reserved packets are classified as Management Frames. The packet processing assigns a user configurable CoS for management frames.
bcmPortControlManagementPacketIp4Reserved Per port configures management frame classification, frames with IPv4 Reserved packets are classified as Management Frames. The packet processing assigns a user configurable CoS for management frames.
bcmPortControlManagementPacketLinkConstrained Per port configures management frame classification, frames with link-constrained multicast are classified as Management Frames. The packet processing assigns a user configurable CoS for management frames.
bcmPortControlManagementPacketGarp Per port configures management frame classification, frames with DA range 0x0180c2000020 through 0x0180c200002flink-constrained multicast packets are classified as Management Frame. The packet processing assigns a user configurable CoS for management frames. .
bcmPortControlManagementPacketCos Per port configures management frame CoS, frames classified as management frames are assigned with the configured CoS.
bcmPortControlManagementPacketColor Per port configures management frame Color, frames classified as management frames are assigned with the configured Drop precedence.
bcmPortControlTaggedL3PacketPktPri Set packet Priority source for tagged L3 packets (enumerated value within bcm_port_cos_remap_t).
bcmPortControlTaggedMPLSPacketPktPri Set packet Priority source for tagged MPLS packets (enumerated value within bcm_port_cos_remap_t).
bcmPortControlTaggedMPLSL3PacketPktPri Set packet Priority source for tagged MPLS L3 packets (enumerated value within bcm_port_cos_remap_t).
bcmPortControlEsmEligibility Enable ESM lookup on the port.
bcmPortControlMplsFRREnable Enable or disable FRR on MPLS packets.
bcmPortControlMplsContextSpecificLabelEnable Enable or disable Upstream assignment label on MPLS packets.
bcmPortControlVxlanEnable Enable or disable VXLAN.
bcmPortControlVxlanTunnelbasedVnId VPN to VN_ID mapping or vice versa based on tunnel (0: not on tunnel; 1: on tunnel).
bcmPortControlVxlanDefaultTunnelEnable Enable default tunnel.
bcmPortControlFieldEgressClassSelect Select Class Id to pass to EFP.
bcmPortControlPonMpcpDiscoveryRate EPON MPCP Discovery Rate.
bcmPortControlPonMpcpDiscoveryGrantLength EPON MPCP Discovery Grant Length.
bcmPortControlPonMpcpOneRegistrationPerGrant Allow only one MPCP Discovery per Discovery Grant.
bcmPortControlPonOamHeartbeatRate EPON port OAM heartbeat rate in seconds.
bcmPortControlPonMaxLinks EPON port maximum number of links.
bcmPortControlPonRamanMitigationMode EPON port Raman Mitigation mode.
bcmPortControlPonLoopTimeMinPropDelay EPON loop timing minimum propagation delay.
bcmPortControlPonLoopTimeMaxPropDelay EPON loop timing maximum propagation delay.
bcmPortControlPonLoopTimeOnuDelay EPON loop timing ONU delay.
bcmPortControlPonLoopTimeNullGrantSize EPON loop timing null grant size.
bcmPortControlPonLoopTimeOltDelay EPON loop timing OLT delay.
bcmPortControlPonSfecAllowedBitErrors EPON SFEC Allowed bit errors.
bcmPortControlPonTfecAllowedBitErrors EPON TFEC Allowed bit errors.
bcmPortControlPonSyncTime EPON Sync Time in 16ns(TQ) unit.
bcmPortControlPonEncryptionMode EPON port/link encryption mode.
bcmPortControlPonEncryptionDirection EPON port/link encryption direction.
bcmPortControlPonOamKeyExchangeMsgBypass Skip processing Key Exchange OAM from Pioneer.
bcmPortControlTunnelIdIngressSource Move outermost VLAN tag to the Tunnel ID on the ingress port, see BCM_PORT_CONTROL_TUNNEL_ID_table .
bcmPortControlTunnelIdEgressAdd Add outermost VLAN on the egress port, see BCM_PORT_CONTROL_TUNNEL_ID_table .
bcmPortControlPonOamHeartbeatTimeout Set PON OAM heartbeat timeout (unit: s).
bcmPortControlPonMpcpReportTimeout Set PON MPCP report timeout (unit: ms).
bcmPortControlPon1GDiscoveryWindow Enable/Disable 1G MPCP discovery window.
bcmPortControlPon10GDiscoveryWindow Enable/Disable 10G MPCP discovery window.
bcmPortControlEgressFilterDisable Enable/ disable Egress Filtering (use values from BCM_PORT_CONTROL_FILTER_DISABLE_flags).
bcmPortPCS The Physical Coding Sub-layer of the port (use values from BCMPortControlPCS_table)
bcmPortControlLLFCReceive Link Level Flow Control packet receive enable [NOTE: See note for bcmPortControlLLFCTransmit]
bcmPortControlLLFCTransmit Link Level Flow Control packet transmit enable [NOTE: For StrataXGS devices, LLFC flags are used for SAFC control other than 802.3x PAUSE. StrataXGS devices use PFC flags for PAUSE control.]
bcmPortControlSAFCReceive Service Aware Flow Control packet receive enable [NOTE: See note for bcmPortControlSAFCTransmit]
bcmPortControlSAFCTransmit Service Aware Flow Control packet transmit enable [NOTE: This feature is not applicable to QSGMII ports. Use bcm_port_pause_set or bcmPortControlLLFCTransmit/bcmPortControlLLFCReceive for Link Level Flow Control settings on QSGMII ports.]
bcmPortControlFecErrorDetectEnable Enables marking of failed error correction on the cells
bcmPortControlLowLatencyLLFCEnable Enables an improvment in latency on the expense of bandwidth
bcmPortControlErspanEnable Enable/Disable ERSPAN mirroring
bcmPortControlVlanVpGroupEgress VP group for egress vlan membership
bcmPortControlVlanVpGroupIngress VP group for Ingress vlan membership
bcmPortControlLinkDownPowerOn 0: The Link is disabled on the MAC level, the SerDes power-state is not changed 1: Activate the link on the MAC level, the SerDes power-state is not changed
bcmPortControlStripCRC If set 8-bit CRC will be added to each data cell, else no cell CRC is calculated. Relevant for VSC256 mode only.
bcmPortControlPrivateVlanIsolate Argument = 1/0 (Enable, disable). System port being port isolate type. By default port will be community.
bcmPortControlPrivateVlanModeSet Argument = 2/1/0. Set system port private vlan mode (0 : community, 1 : isolate, 2 : promiscuous). By default it is community.
bcmPortControlFloodUnknownUcastGroup Override the per-vsi settings.
bcmPortControlFloodUnknownMcastGroup Override the per-vsi settings.
bcmPortControlFloodBroadcastGroup Override the per-vsi settings.
bcmPortControlExtendedPortVid Extended Port VID
bcmPortControlNonEtagDrop Drop if ingress ETAG is not present
bcmPortControlEtagDrop Drop if ingress ETAG is present
bcmPortControlNonEtagAdd Add ETAG if not present
bcmPortControlEtagIngressReplace Replace ingress ETAG if present
bcmPortControlEtagEgressReplace Replace egress ETAG if present
bcmPortControlEtagIngressDelete Delete ingress ETAG if present
bcmPortControlEtagEgressDelete Delete egress ETAG if present
bcmPortControlExtenderRpfCheck Enable ETAG.SVID RPF check
bcmPortControlExtenderSourceKnockout Enable source Extended Port VID pruning
bcmPortControlExtenderForwardPort Destination port for upstream Port Extender forwarding
bcmPortControlExtenderType Port Extension port type (enumerated values within bcm_port_extender_type_t)
bcmPortControlExtenderNameSpace Extended Port VID namespace
bcmPortControlEtagPcpDeSelect Source of PCP and DE fields when adding an ETAG (use values from bcm_extender_pcp_de_select_t)
bcmPortControlEtagPcp Default PCP field when adding an ETAG
bcmPortControlEtagDe Default DE field when adding an ETAG
bcmPortControlUseEtagPri Use ETAG PCP and DE fields to derive internal priority and color
bcmPortControlProhibitedDot1p Prohibited 802.1p values
bcmPortControlMacSwap Enable or Disable Swapping DMAC and SMAC on packets coming into the port
bcmPortControlFloodPktDropTc Set TC(internal Traffic Class) bitmap to force drop on the flooding packet per TC of this port.(e.g. bit7 for TC7)
bcmPortControlIngressTcSelectTable Assign user defined ingress TC(internal Traffic Class) mapping mode on internal TC select Table.
bcmPortControlOverlayRecycle Set port as recycle port for overlay packets second pass
bcmPortControlEvbType Set EVB port type (enumerated value within bcm_port_evb_type_t)
bcmPortControlOamLookupWithDvp Use DVP as one of the keys for OAM lookup.
bcmPortControlSubportTagEnable Enable/Disable SubTag subport channelization over Ethernet. In this mode a third VLAN tag is used to create subports under this port.
bcmPortControlLinkPhyEnable Enable LinkPhy support on a port in port bitmap represented by the config property "pbmp_linkphy" during run time. Disabling LinkPhy support on a port during run time is not supported.
bcmPortControlEgressModifyOuterPktPri Enable/Disable outer tag priority modification
bcmPortControlEgressModifyInnerPktPri Enable/Disable inner tag priority modification
bcmPortControlFcoeRouteEnable Enables FCOE routing
bcmPortControlFcoeVftEnable Controls VFT header expected on port
bcmPortControlFcoeZoneCheckEnable Enables zone check
bcmPortControlFcoeSourceBindCheckEnable Enables source bind check
bcmPortControlFcoeFpmaPrefixCheckEnable Enables FPMA prefix check
bcmPortControlFcoeDoNotLearn Disables learning for packets with FCOE EtherType
bcmPortControlFcoeNetworkPort Sets whether the port is network (uplink) or not (downfacing)
bcmPortControlFcoeFabricSel Selects the source of fabric Id and priority
bcmPortControlFcoeFabricId Sets the port default 12-bit fabric Id
bcmPortControlFcoeFabricPri Sets the port default fabric priority
bcmPortControlFcoeVsanSel Selects the source of VSAN Id and priority
bcmPortControlFcoeVsanId Sets the port default 12-bit VSAN Id
bcmPortControlFcoeVsanPri Sets the port default VSAN priority
bcmPortControlFcoeFcCrcAction Sets the FC CRC action to take
bcmPortControlFcoeFcCrcRecompute Sets the re-compute CRC options
bcmPortControlFcoeFcEofIgnore Sets the control to Ignore EOF
bcmPortControlFcoeTranslateKeyFirst Sets FCOE VSAN translation first key type, use with bcm_fcoe_vsan_translate_key_t types
bcmPortControlFcoeTranslateKeySecond Sets FCOE VSAN translation second key type, use with bcm_fcoe_vsan_translate_key_t types
bcmPortControlMcastGroupRemap Enable IPMC group index remapping
bcmPortControlLocalSwitching to enable Local route switching on a port.
bcmPortControlDoNotCheckVlan Enable/disable spanning tree and Vlan membership checks on ingress Ethernet and higig packets. For CPU port configuration is applied only for higig packets. To configure these settings for Ethernet packets bcmPortControlDoNotCheckVlanFromCpu port control can be used.
bcmPortControlDoNotCheckVlanFromCpu Enable/disable spanning tree and Vlan membership checks on Ethernet packets from CPU port.
bcmPortControlVMac Enable/disable vmac function.
bcmPortControlEEEMode Select Energy Efficient Ethernet mode.
bcmPortControlIPMC4Ucast Enable per port's IPMC-Unicast feature to support IPMCv4 packet with unicast MACDA(value 0: disable, value 1: enable).
bcmPortControlIPMC6Ucast Enable per port's IPMC-Unicast feature to support IPMCv6 packet with unicast MACDA(value 0: disable, value 1: enable).
bcmPortControlProbeSerdesReset Request to reset SerDes on next port probe.
bcmPortControlSubportPktTagDrop Set Ingress drop control, if LLTAG is present (value = TRUE/FALSE)
bcmPortControlNoSubportPktTagDrop Set Ingress drop control, if LLTAG is not present (value = TRUE/FALSE)
bcmPortControlUseSubportPktTagPri Use LLTAG PCP and DE fields to derive internal priority and color
bcmPortControlRxFastLOS Enable/disable accelerated linkscan capability on port.
bcmPortControlStatCollectionEnable Enable/disable the gathering of MIB statistics on the port.
bcmPortControlLlfcCellsCongestionIndEnable Enable/Disable LLFC cells congestion indication
bcmPortControlWredDropCountUpdateEnableQueueMask Set the queue mask to enable the WRED dropped counter increase.
bcmPortControlWredDropCountUpdateEnableColorMask Set the color mask to enable the WRED dropped counter increase.
bcmPortControlMmuDrain Request to drain the cells of the port. (The behavior of this type is changed in BCM56960 family. value 1: return success as this type should be applied with "bcmPortControlMmuTrafficEnable" and disable enqueuing the packets to a port which also drains the cells in MMU. )
bcmPortControlMmuTrafficEnable Request to enable/disable enqueuing the packets to the port. (The behavior of this type is changed in BCM56960 family. value 0: disable enqueuing the packets to a port and MMU cells are drained. value 1: enable enqueuing the packets to a port.) This type should be applied with "bcmPortControlMmuDrain" and the sequence is:
  1. bcm_port_control_set(unit, port, bcmPortControlMmuTrafficEnable, FALSE);
  2. bcm_port_control_set(unit, port, bcmPortControlMmuDrain, TRUE);
  3. bcm_port_control_set(unit, port, bcmPortControlMmuTrafficEnable, TRUE);
bcmPortControlTrunkLoadBalancingRandomizer Assign Port-specific Randomizer-value to bias the random-member selection of Trunk. Use integer-value between 0 and 15.
bcmPortControlECMPLevel1LoadBalancingRandomizer Assign Port-specific Randomizer-value to bias the random-member selection of ECMP(at Level 1 if Hierarchical ECMP Mode is configured). Use integer-value between 0 and 15.
bcmPortControlECMPLevel2LoadBalancingRandomizer Assign Port-specific Randomizer-value to bias the random-member selection of ECMP at Level 2 in Hierarchical ECMP Mode. Not used in Single Level Mode. Use integer-value between 0 and 15.
bcmPortControlMplsExplicitNullEnable Enable or disable Explicit NULL termination database. Use integer-value between 0 and 1.
bcmPortControlExtenderEnable Enable/disable port extender capability on the port. Use integer-value between 0 and 1.
bcmPortControlSubportTagSize Set the egress subport tag size, used for Channelization over Ethernet (CoE) applications. Use integer-value 0 for 4-Byte tag and integer-value 1 for 8-Byte tag.
bcmPortControlSystemPortOverride Overrride the egress vlan translation to use global physical ports instead of port groups. Use integer-value 1 to enable the override and integer-value 0 to disable the override.
bcmPortControlVxlanVpnAssignmentCriteria VxLAN vpn assignment criteria.
bcmPortControlVxlanTerminationMatchCriteria VxLAN termination match criteria.
bcmPortControlVxlanGportAssignmentCriteria VxLAN virtual port assignment criteria.
bcmPortControlOOBFCTxReportIngEnable OOB FC Tx Ingress congestion notification enable/disable per port.
bcmPortControlOOBFCTxReportEgrEnable OOB FC Tx Egress congestion notification enable/disable per port.
bcmPortControlMplsEncapsulateExtendedLabel Encapsulate additional MPLS tunnel on a given outlif.
bcmPortControlSampleIngressDest Set Ingress sFlow sample destination. See BCM_PORT_CONTROL_SAMPLE_DEST_flags .
bcmPortControlSampleFlexDest Set Flex sFlow sample destination. See BCM_PORT_CONTROL_SAMPLE_DEST_flags .
bcmPortControlSampleFlexRate Set Flex sFlow sampling rate per port. Every 1/value ingressing packets will be sampled enabled by FP action (0 indicate no sampling, 1 indicates sampling all packets). Range of values: 0x0-0x10000000.
bcmPortControlExternalBufferEnable Enable/disable External Memory usage on the port. On Enable/Disable Port will be shutdown flushing the intermittent stale packets and then configuring External Buffer for value 1/Internal Buffer for value 0.
bcmPortControlTrustMimlPri Select to trust the packet's priority from MiML header for internal priority mapping.
bcmPortControlPortMacOui Upper 3 bytes of PORT MAC address. Used for OAM PORT MEP packet termination on relevant devices, also used for non-unicast MAC SA replacement during latching loopback reply.
bcmPortControlPortMacNonOui Lower 3 bytes of PORT MAC address. Used for OAM PORT MEP packet termination on relevant devices, also used for non-unicast MAC SA replacement during latching loopback reply.
bcmPortControlOlpEnable Enable/Disable OLP encapsulation/decapsulation on specified BCM device port. Valid values : True/False.
bcmPortControlSatEnable Enable/Disable SAT function on the specified port. Valid values : True/False.
bcmPortControlTrustCustomHeaderPri Enable/Disable internal Priority/color determination based on custom header. Valid values : True/False.
bcmPortControlCustomHeaderEncapEnable Enable/Disable the capability of custom header encapsulation on the port. Valid values : True/False.
bcmPortControl1588P2PDelay Update path delay in 1588 p2p delay mechanism.
bcmPortControlSampleIngressEnable Enable/Disable ingress port-based sflow.
bcmPortControlSampleEgressEnable Enable/Disable egress port-based sflow.
bcmPortControlSampleIngressRate Set Ingress sFlow sample rate.
bcmPortControlSampleEgressRate Set Egress sFlow sample rate.
bcmPortControlMplsSpeculativeParse Enable/Disable the speculative parsing of headers over MPLS. Valid values : True/False.
bcmPortControlFieldHiGigClassSelect Control classid selection into HG header.
bcmPortControlDvpGroupId Configure DVP group value which will be used to compare against SVP for pruning decision.
bcmPortControlDvpGroupKnockoutEnable Enable/Disable DVP group based pruning. Supported values are 0-Disable,1-Enable.
bcmPortControlUntaggedVlanMember Set the VLAN-Membership state per port for packets classified as untagged.
bcmPortControlMPLSEncapsulateAdditionalLabel Set additional label enable on outgoing LIF.
bcmPortControlPreserveDscpIngress Set DSCP preserve enable on incoming LIF.
bcmPortControlPreserveDscpEgress Set DSCP preserve enable on outgoing LIF.
bcmPortControlPWETerminationPortModeEnable Enable PWE termination port mode on a port, if enabled, PWE label termination lookup key will be <port+label>.
bcmPortControlOuterPolicerRemark DP profile to remark outer PCP-DEI.
bcmPortControlInnerPolicerRemark DP profile to remark inner PCP-DEI.
bcmPortControlE2EFCTransmitEnable Enable E2EFC message transmit.
bcmPortControlE2EFCReceiveEnable Enable E2EFC message receive.
bcmPortControlE2EFCCopyToCpuEnable Enable E2EFC message copy-to-CPU.
bcmPortControlE2EFCDestMacOui E2EFC message destination MAC upper 3 bytes, only for E2EFC TX.
bcmPortControlE2EFCDestMacNonOui E2EFC message destination MAC lower 3 bytes, only for E2EFC TX.
bcmPortControlE2EFCSrcMacOui E2EFC message source MAC upper 3 bytes, only for E2EFC TX.
bcmPortControlE2EFCSrcMacNonOui E2EFC message source MAC lower 3 bytes, only for E2EFC TX.
bcmPortControlE2EFCEtherType E2EFC message EtherType/length, only for E2EFC TX.
bcmPortControlE2EFCOpcode E2EFC message opcode, only for E2EFC TX.
bcmPortControlAllowTtlInheritance Enabling Ingress inheritance of TTL per Outgoing Logical interface (consume Out-LIF profile).
bcmPortControlAllowQosInheritance Enabling Ingress inheritance DSCP-EXP per Outgoing Logical interface (consume Out-LIF profile).
bcmPortControlPacketTimeStampInsertRx Insert rx packet timestamp for packet flow arriving on the port.
bcmPortControlPacketTimeStampInsertTx Insert tx packet timestamp for packet flow exiting the port.
bcmPortControlPacketTimeStampSrcPortInsertCancel Cancel/override both rx and tx time stamp insertions for the packet flow arriving on the port, may be overrided by IFP.
bcmPortControlPacketTimeStampDestPortInsertCancel Cancel/override both rx and tx time stamp insertions for the packet flow exiting the port.
bcmPortControlPacketTimeStampRxId Set Source identifier of Rx (Ingress) Packet Time Stamp record header.
bcmPortControlPacketTimeStampTxId Set Source identifier of Tx (Egress) Packet Time Stamp record header.
bcmPortControlPacketTimeStampByteMeterAdjust Set if need to adjust meter for packet timestamp.
bcmPortControlDoNotCheckVlanEgress Enable/Disable egress VLAN checks for VP port.
bcmPortControlIlknRxPathEnable Enable/Disable rx path on Ilkn port. Only use with no linkscan.
bcmPortControlEgressAclTwoPassEditing Enable/Disable egress ACL two pass editing on a port. Available when egress_acl_two_pass_enable SOC property is enabled.
bcmPortControlLLFCAfterFecEnable Enable/Disable FEC on LLFC and congestion indication.
bcmPortControlPONEnable Enable or disable pon capability on the port.
bcmPortControlLogicalInterfaceSameFilter Set or unset Same-interface filtering according to logical-interface ID while incoming and outgoing port-ID will be ignored.
bcmPortControlMimUcastTermEnable Enable/Disable MiM UC Termination Mode.
bcmPortControlMimMcastTermEnable Enable/Disable MiM MC and BC Termination Mode.
bcmPortControlControlCellsFecBypassEnable Determine if FEC is bypassed by two control cells types: credit cells and flow status cells. Enable FEC bypass means to NOT do FEC on these controls cells.Disable FEC bypass means to do FEC on these controls cells.This configuration is relevant for RS FEC types only.
bcmPortControlTpidSrc Used to configure TPID source on VP, see table BCM_PORT_TPID_SRC_table .
PortControlWirelessCosMapSelect Enable traffic to choose wireless cos queues for the traffic on a port, if it is not set traffic will take the wired cos queues.
PortControlHiGigCosSelect Enable traffic to choose higig cos queues for the traffic on a port, if it is not set traffic will take unicast cos queues.
bcmPortControlInternalLoopback Enable or disable the port's internal loopback mode.
bcmPortConrolEgressVlanPortArpPointed Used to configure the index to vlan port per ARP.
bcmPortControlForwardNetworkGroup Enable/Disable Forward network group functionality.
bcmPortControlIngressQosModelRemark Used to configure Ingress remark QOS model
bcmPortControlIngressQosModelPhb Used to configure Ingress PHB QOS model
bcmPortControlIngressQosModelTtl Used to configure Ingress TTL QOS model
bcmPortControlMetadata Used to configure egress port metadata
bcmPortControlFirstHeaderSize Used to configure the size of the first header to skip
bcmPortControlDistributeLearnMessageMode Used to configure distribute learn message mode.
bcmPortControlDiscardEgress enable/disable to discard all traffic on that outgoing port
bcmPortControlngressEnable enable/disable single ingress port.
bcmPortControlObmInterruptTypeDropPreempt enable/disable obm preempt drop interruppt on a port.
bcmPortControlObmInterruptTypeOverflowPreempt enable/disable obm preempt overflow drop interrupt on a port.
bcmPortControlObmInterruptTypeDropExpress enable/disable obm express drop interrupt on a port.
bcmPortControlObmInterruptTypeOverflowExpress enable/disable obm express overflow drop interrupt on a port.
enable/disable single ingress port.
bcmPortControlIP4TunnelTermEnable Enable or disable IPv4 tunnel termination.
bcmPortControlIP6TunnelTermEnable Enable or disable IPv6 tunnel termination.
bcmPortControlQoSRemarkEgressEnable Enable or disable egress port-based QoS remarking.
bcmPortControlBridgeEgress Enable or disable egress port-based bridging.
bcmPortControlLinkFaultLocalClear Clear the sticky local_fault_status bit.
bcmPortControlLinkFaultRemoteClear Clear the sticky remote_fault_status bit.
bcmPortControlIngressSampleProfile Ingress sample profile id.
bcmPortControlPacketTimeStampIngressInsertTx Enable to insert TX timestamp on transmitted packets when they are arriving on the ingress port.
bcmPortControlPacketTimeStampIngressInsertTxCancel Enable to skip TX timestamp insertion on transmitted packets when they are arriving on the ingress port.
bcmPortControlEgressVlanPriSrc Select the source of egress VLAN priority, see table bcm_port_egress_vlan_pri_src_t_table .
bcmPortControlTxStall Stall dequeuing packets.
bcmPortControlTxByteState Enable TX byte state to update TX byte count that would be inserted into IFA metadata.
bcmPortControlEgressPktPriCfiCopyIngressEnable Enable or disable egress packet priority and CFI copy on ingress port.
bcmPortControlEgressTosCopyIngressEnable Enable or disable egress TOS copy on ingress port.
bcmPortControlEgressL2OpaqueTag Set egress L2 opaque tag.

<type> parameter bcmPortControlBridge Enables/Disables the local bridging feature for port specified. Port Bridging allows packets that enter the switch from a port to also be L2 switched out of the same port. Normally, the ingress port is removed from the egress port bitmap for a packet and thus default behavior is not to allow the packets coming on a port to go out on same port during L2 switching. Enabling this feature allows the L2 packet to be switched on the same port. This is also applicable to WLAN ports. <type> parameters bcmPortControlIP4McastL2 and bcmPortControlIP6McastL2 enable/disable L2 switching based on (SG,*G) instead of (DMAC,VLAN). By enabling this, IPMC packets are switched based on lookups in the L3 host and IPMC tables. In this mode, the following header checks are not performed: RPF, IP header options check, and TTL checks (TTL=0, TTL=1). A lookup miss in the L3 host or IPMC table in this mode results in normal L2 switching based on (DMAC, VLAN). The following tables define the values for some type enumerations.

PHY PCS modes
BCM_PORT_PHY_CONTROL_PCS_MODE_IEEE Standard PCS mode as defined by the IEEE
BCM_PORT_PHY_CONTROL_PCS_MODE_BRCM Proprietary PCS mode defined by Broadcom

PRBS Values
BCM_PORT_PRBS_POLYNOMIAL_X7_X6_1 polynomial = x^7 + x^6 + 1
BCM_PORT_PRBS_POLYNOMIAL_X15_X14_1 polynomial = x^15 + x^14 + 1
BCM_PORT_PRBS_POLYNOMIAL_X23_X18_1 polynomial = x^23 + x^18 + 1
BCM_PORT_PRBS_POLYNOMIAL_X31_X28_1 polynomial = x^31 + x^28 + 1
BCM_PORT_PRBS_POLYNOMIAL_X9_X5_1 polynomial = x^9 + x^5 + 1
BCM_PORT_PRBS_POLYNOMIAL_X11_X9_1 polynomial = x^11 + x^9 + 1
BCM_PORT_PRBS_POLYNOMIAL_X58_X31_1 polynomial = x^58 + x^31 + 1

Ability Values
BCM_PORT_ABILITY_SFI non-multiplexed data link
BCM_PORT_ABILITY_DUAL_SFI multiplexed data link
BCM_PORT_ABILITY_SCI non-multiplexed control link
BCM_PORT_ABILITY_SFI_SCI multiplexed control and data link
BCM_PORT_ABILITY_SFI_LOOPBACK one channel is FIC data link, the other is local loopback
BCM_PORT_ABILITY_DUAL_SFI_LOOPBACK both channels are local loopback

Fabric Header Format values
BCM_PORT_CONTROL_FABRIC_HEADER_88230 Default header type for BCM88230 family of devices.
BCM_PORT_CONTROL_FABRIC_HEADER_CUSTOM Custom header type switching location of DP bits in header and using 18 bit OI value.
BCM_PORT_CONTROL_FABRIC_HEADER_88640_TM Default header type for 88640 device.
BCM_PORT_CONTROL_FABRIC_HEADER_88640_RAW This support is only to aid debugging on 88640 device

Port CONTROL DISCARD MACSA Flags
Flag Meaning
BCM_PORT_CONTROL_DISCARD_MACSA_NONE Packets with drop-sa are switched by the device
BCM_PORT_CONTROL_DISCARD_MACSA_DROP Packets with drop-sa are dropped
BCM_PORT_CONTROL_DISCARD_MACSA_TRAP Packets with drop-sa are copied to the CPU

Port CONTROL UNKNOWN MACDA Flags
Flag Meaning
BCM_PORT_CONTROL_UNKNOWN_MACDA_NONE Packets with unknown-da are switched by the device
BCM_PORT_CONTROL_UNKNOWN_MACDA_DROP Packets with unknown-da are dropped
BCM_PORT_CONTROL_UNKNOWN_MACDA_TRAP Packets with unknown-da are copied to the CPU

Port CONTROL SAMPLE DEST Flags
Flag Meaning
BCM_PORT_CONTROL_SAMPLE_DEST_CPU Copy packet samples to CPU
BCM_PORT_CONTROL_SAMPLE_DEST_MIRROR Copy packet samples to all mirror destinations created with BCM_MIRROR_PORT_SFLOW flag

Port CONTROL FILTER DISABLE Flags
Flag Meaning
BCM_PORT_CONTROL_FILTER_DISABLE_UNKNOWN_DA_UC Disable egress filter for unknown Unicast packets
BCM_PORT_CONTROL_FILTER_DISABLE_UNKNOWN_DA_MC Disable egress filter for unknown Multicast packets
BCM_PORT_CONTROL_FILTER_DISABLE_DA_BC Disable egress filter for Broadcast packets
BCM_PORT_CONTROL_FILTER_DISABLE_ALL Disable all egress filters

Port CONTROL TUNNEL ID values
BCM_PORT_TUNNEL_ID_NONE Without Tunnel Id
BCM_PORT_TUNNEL_ID_VLAN Use VLAN tag as Tunnel Id

Port EEE mode values
bcmPortEEENativeMode EEE native mode
bcmPortEEEBurstAndBatchMode EEE burst and batch mode

Port control evb type values
bcmPortEvbTypeNone Without evb type
bcmPortEvbTypeUplinkAccess Uplink access evb type
bcmPortEvbTypeCount Number of port evb types.

Port control Fcoe Fabric Select type values
bcmPortFcoeVsanSelectVft Use VFT header
bcmPortFcoeVsanSelectPort Use Port Table value
bcmPortFcoeVsanSelectInnerVlan Use incoming inner VID/COS
bcmPortFcoeVsanSelectOuterVlan Use incoming outer VID/COS

Port TPID Source Select type values
bcmPortTpidSrcVp Use SVP-based TPIDs
bcmPortTpidSrcVpn Use use VFI-based TPIDs
bcmPortTpidSrcPort Use TPIDs based on SGLP
bcmPortTpidSrcTrillPayload Use TRILL Payload TPIDs
bcmPortTpidSrcCount Number of port TPID source types

bcm_port_pcs_t
Value Description
bcmPortPCS8b9bLFec 8b9bLFec
bcmPortPCS8b10b 8b10b
bcmPortPCS64b66bFec 64b66bFec(KR)
bcmPortPCS64b66bBec 64b66bBec
bcmPortPCS64b66b 64b66b non fec/bec
bcmPortPCS64b66bRsFec 64b66b RsFec
bcmPortPCS64b66bLowLatencyRsFec 64b66bLLRSFec
bcmPortPCS64b66b15TRsFec 64b66b 15T RsFec
bcmPortPCS64b66b15TLowLatencyRsFec 64b66b 15T LLRSFec

bcm_port_niv_type_t
Value Description
BCM_PORT_NIV_TYPE_UPLINK NIV Uplink port
BCM_PORT_NIV_TYPE_DOWNLINK_ACCESS NIV Downlink Access port
BCM_PORT_NIV_TYPE_DOWNLINK_TRANSIT NIV Downlink Transit port
BCM_PORT_NIV_TYPE_SWITCH NIV Switch port

bcm_port_vxlan_vpn_assignment_criteria_t
Value Description
bcmPortVxlanVpnAssignOnVnid use VNID
bcmPortVxlanVpnAssignOnVnidSrcIp use VNID and SIP
bcmPortVxlanVpnAssignOnVnidOuterVlan use VNID and OVID
bcmPortVxlanVpnAssignOnVnidOuterVlanSrcIp use VNID , OVID and SIP

<type> There are four VXLAN VPN assignment criteria listed in bcm_port_vxlan_vpn_assignment_criteria_t table. Changing these criteria after VPNs have been created will make the configuration invalid.

bcm_port_vxlan_termination_match_criteria_t
Value Description
bcmPortVxlanTerminationMatchDstIp Match destination IP.
bcmPortVxlanTerminationMatchOuterVlanDstIp Match outer VLAN ID and destination IP.
bcmPortVxlanTerminationMatchSrcDstIp Match source & destination IP.
bcmPortVxlanTerminationMatchOuterVlanSrcDstIp Match outer VLAN ID and source & destination IP.

<type> There are two VXLAN termination match criteria listed in bcm_port_vxlan_termination_match_criteria_t table. Changing these criteria after Tunnel Terminators have been created will make the configuration invalid.

bcm_port_vxlan_gport_assignment_criteria_t
Value Description
bcmPortVxlanGportAssignOnSrcIp use SIP
bcmPortVxlanGportAssignOnOuterVlanSrcIp use OVID and SIP

<type> There are two VXLAN gport assignment criteria listed in bcm_port_vxlan_gport_assignment_criteria_t table. Changing these criteria after VXLAN GPORTs have been created will make the configuration invalid.

Port CONTROL CPU Port values
BCM_GPORT_LOCAL_CPU_IEEE CPU port only for Ethernet packets
BCM_GPORT_LOCAL_CPU_HIGIG CPU port only for higig packets

Source of Egress VLAN Priority
bcmPortEgressVlanPriSrcIntPri The source is the internal priority map.
bcmPortEgressVlanPriSrcPktPri Keep the packet priority.
bcmPortEgressVlanPriSrcVpn The source is egress VPN or egress VLAN translation by looking up both VPN and port group (higher priority than egress VPN).

The CPU port accepts both regular Ethernet packets and HiGig(2) packets at the same time, so it has has different CPU port number for Ethernet packets and HiGig packets. BCM_GPORT_LOCAL_CPU_IEEE is used for Ethernet packets, and BCM_GPORT_LOCAL_CPU_HIGIG is used for higig packets. For example: Enable IPv4 L3 forwarding for HiGig packets: bcm_port_control_set(unit,BCM_GPORT_LOCAL_CPU_HIGIG,bcmPortControlIP4,enable); Enable IPv4 L3 forwarding for for Ethernet packets: bcm_port_control_set(unit,BCM_GPORT_LOCAL_CPU_IEEE,bcmPortControlIP4,enable);

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port number
[in]typePort feature enumerator
[in]valueValue of the bit field in port table

◆ bcm_port_detach()

int bcm_port_detach ( int  unit,
bcm_pbmp_t  pbmp,
bcm_pbmp_t *  detached 
)

Detach ports from the BCM API.

Detach a port from the port subsystem, configuring it such that the link state and other configuration routines behave as if the link is permanently down. This routine may be used to allow hot swapping of external PHY devices. If the external PHY is being swapped, the port must be detached to ensure BCM API operations that query or change port state operate properly. When a new external PHY is installed, the port must be probed using bcm_port_probe to query the device and install the correct internal drivers for the device. It is the responsibility of the application to make the necessary changes to all other configuration settings such as VLANS, multicast groups, and trunk configuration. For portmod supported devices, such as Tomahawk2, Trident2+, Apache, Firebolt, Maverick, and and these variants, a port needs to be removed from linkscan if linkscan is enabled on the port before detaching it (bcm_port_detach).

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]pbmpPort bit map of ports to be detached
[out]detachedPort bit map of ports successfully detached.

◆ bcm_port_discard_get()

int bcm_port_discard_get ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
int *  mode 
)

Configure port discard mode for packets ingressing tagged and untagged.

Discard mode controls the acceptance of tagged and untagged packets on a port. The valid discard modes are described in BCM_PORT_DISCARD_e . The discard mode is independent of other port states such as the spanning tree state that may cause packets to be dropped for other reasons. The egress discard mode is set by passing a logical port, a GPORT, as the port parameter. The DNX family of switches supports asymmetrical discard mode configuration. To set the discard mode for ingress or egress only, the mode can be ored with BCM_PORT_DISCARD_MODE_INGRESS_ONLY or BCM_PORT_DISCARD_MODE_EGRESS_ONLY respectively.

Port Discard Modes
Mode Meaning
BCM_PORT_DISCARD_NONE No packets are ignored based on their tagged state on ingress.
BCM_PORT_DISCARD_ALL All packets are dropped by the ingress
BCM_PORT_DISCARD_UNTAG All packets arriving at the specified port untagged are dropped.
BCM_PORT_DISCARD_TAG All packets arriving at the specified port tagged are dropped.
BCM_PORT_DISCARD_COUNT
BCM_PORT_DISCARD_INGRESS All packets are dropped by the ingress only.
BCM_PORT_DISCARD_EGRESS All packets are dropped by the egress only.
Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port number
[out]modeDiscard mode to set or retrieved from the port. Valid modes and their description are defined in table BCM_PORT_DISCARD_e .

◆ bcm_port_discard_set()

int bcm_port_discard_set ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
int  mode 
)

Configure port discard mode for packets ingressing tagged and untagged.

Discard mode controls the acceptance of tagged and untagged packets on a port. The valid discard modes are described in BCM_PORT_DISCARD_e . The discard mode is independent of other port states such as the spanning tree state that may cause packets to be dropped for other reasons. The egress discard mode is set by passing a logical port, a GPORT, as the port parameter. The DNX family of switches supports asymmetrical discard mode configuration. To set the discard mode for ingress or egress only, the mode can be ored with BCM_PORT_DISCARD_MODE_INGRESS_ONLY or BCM_PORT_DISCARD_MODE_EGRESS_ONLY respectively.

Port Discard Modes
Mode Meaning
BCM_PORT_DISCARD_NONE No packets are ignored based on their tagged state on ingress.
BCM_PORT_DISCARD_ALL All packets are dropped by the ingress
BCM_PORT_DISCARD_UNTAG All packets arriving at the specified port untagged are dropped.
BCM_PORT_DISCARD_TAG All packets arriving at the specified port tagged are dropped.
BCM_PORT_DISCARD_COUNT

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port number
[in]modeDiscard mode to set or retrieved from the port. Valid modes and their description are defined in table BCM_PORT_DISCARD_e .

◆ bcm_port_dscp_map_get()

int bcm_port_dscp_map_get ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
int  srccp,
int *  mapcp,
int *  prio 
)

Control mapping of Differentiated Services Code Points (DSCP)

Incoming IPv4 format packets have Differentiated Services Code Points in their type of service (ToS) header field. DSCP values are small integers from 0 to 63. Some switch devices have the capability of rewriting incoming code points into other mapped code points for use within the switching domain. Some switch devices also have the capability of setting the internal priority and drop precedence based on the source DSCP. The allowable values for the input parameters may be limited by the device's underlying hardware capabilities. StrataXGS?and StrataSwitch switches allow a limited number of DSCP mapping possibilities: for these devices srccp can be -1 or 0 only. These devices do not perform DSCP-based priority mapping. A port value of -1 or gport type for system configuration will configure all ports. On devices BCM56860 and BCM56970, before flexport operation, port dscp map set must be cleared on the port to be flexed. The DSCP to DSCP, priority, drop precedence mapping enable/disable per port is controlled by bcm_port_dscp_map_mode_set.

DSCP Mapping Parameters
Source DSCP Mapped DSCP Description
-1 0..63 Map all packets to the mapped DSCP value
0..63 0..63 Map packets with source DSCP to mapped DSCP value
Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port number or -1 to setup global mapping table.
[in]srccpSource code point. -1 indicates operation applies to all code points if being configured or a random code point if being retrieved.
[out]mapcpThe new code point to map srccp to if setting the mapping; the currently configured mapping for the port if retrieving settings.
[out]prioPriority of packets mapped for the code point, if available. Priority is 0 to 7 and can have the value (BCM_PRIO_RED/BCM_PRIO_YELLOW/BCM_PRIO_GREEN/BCM_PRIO_PRESERVE) ored in. -1 on get means priority mapping is unavailable.
Return values
BCM_E_NONEOperation completed successfully
BCM_E_PARAMSource or mapped code point values are invalid.
BCM_E_UNAVAILOperation not supported on underlying device, or mapping resources depleted.
BCM_E_XXXOperation failed.

◆ bcm_port_dscp_map_mode_get()

int bcm_port_dscp_map_mode_get ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
int *  mode 
)

Control mapping of Differentiated Services Code Points (DSCP).

DSCP map mode
DSCP map mode Description
BCM_PORT_DSCP_MAP_NONE No DSCP mapping
BCM_PORT_DSCP_MAP_ZERO map only incoming packets with DSCP value = 0.
BCM_PORT_DSCP_MAP_ALL map all packets.
BCM_PORT_DSCP_MAP_UNTAGGED_ONLY Map only when packet is untagged.
BCM_PORT_DSCP_MAP_DEFAULT Map according to default mapping,Not looking at PCP or TOS.
BCM_PORT_DSCP_MAP_IPV4_ONLY Map DSCP only for IPv4 packets.
BCM_PORT_DSCP_MAP_IPV6_ONLY Map DSCP only for IPv6 packets.
BCM_PORT_DSCP_MAP_IPV4_NONE Disable DSCP mapping for IPv4 packets.
BCM_PORT_DSCP_MAP_IPV6_NONE Disable DSCP mapping for IPv6 packets.

Incoming IPV4 format packets have Differentiated Services Code Points in their type of service (ToS) header field. DSCP values are small integers from 0 to 63. Some switch devices have the capability of rewriting incoming code points into other mapped code points for use within the switching domain. Some switch devices also have the capability of setting the internal priority and drop precedence based on the source DSCP. The allowable values for the input parameters may be limited by the device's underlying hardware capabilities. For enabling DSCP mapping for both IPV4 and IPV6, BCM_PORT_DSCP_MAP_ALL should be used. Similarly, BCM_PORT_DSCP_MAP_NONE should be used to disable DSCP mapping for both IPv4 and IPv6. Note that BCM_PORT_DSCP_MAP_IPV4_xxxx and BCM_PORT_DSCP_MAP_IPV6_xxxx should not be used together. Doing so will return error. These flags are only for enabling/disabling DSCP for IPv4/IPv6 independently. Functionality of the existing flags will remain the same. A port value of -1 or gport type for system configuration will configure all ports.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port number
[out]modeDSCP map mode.
Return values
BCM_E_NONEOperation completed successfully
BCM_E_PARAMInvalid mapping mode
BCM_E_UNAVAILOperation not supported on underlying device
BCM_E_XXXOperation failed.

◆ bcm_port_dscp_map_mode_set()

int bcm_port_dscp_map_mode_set ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
int  mode 
)

Control mapping of Differentiated Services Code Points (DSCP).

DSCP map mode
DSCP map mode Description
BCM_PORT_DSCP_MAP_NONE No DSCP mapping
BCM_PORT_DSCP_MAP_ZERO map only incoming packets with DSCP value = 0.
BCM_PORT_DSCP_MAP_ALL map all packets.
BCM_PORT_DSCP_MAP_UNTAGGED_ONLY Map only when packet is untagged.
BCM_PORT_DSCP_MAP_DEFAULT Map according to default mapping,Not looking at PCP or TOS.
BCM_PORT_DSCP_MAP_IPV4_ONLY Map DSCP only for IPv4 packets.
BCM_PORT_DSCP_MAP_IPV6_ONLY Map DSCP only for IPv6 packets.
BCM_PORT_DSCP_MAP_IPV4_NONE Disable DSCP mapping for IPv4 packets.
BCM_PORT_DSCP_MAP_IPV6_NONE Disable DSCP mapping for IPv6 packets.

Incoming IPV4 format packets have Differentiated Services Code Points in their type of service (ToS) header field. DSCP values are small integers from 0 to 63. Some switch devices have the capability of rewriting incoming code points into other mapped code points for use within the switching domain. Some switch devices also have the capability of setting the internal priority and drop precedence based on the source DSCP. The allowable values for the input parameters may be limited by the device's underlying hardware capabilities. For enabling DSCP mapping for both IPV4 and IPV6, BCM_PORT_DSCP_MAP_ALL should be used. Similarly, BCM_PORT_DSCP_MAP_NONE should be used to disable DSCP mapping for both IPv4 and IPv6. Note that BCM_PORT_DSCP_MAP_IPV4_xxxx and BCM_PORT_DSCP_MAP_IPV6_xxxx should not be used together. Doing so will return error. These flags are only for enabling/disabling DSCP for IPv4/IPv6 independently. Functionality of the existing flags will remain the same. A port value of -1 or gport type for system configuration will configure all ports.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port number
[in]modeDSCP map mode.
Return values
BCM_E_NONEOperation completed successfully
BCM_E_PARAMInvalid mapping mode
BCM_E_UNAVAILOperation not supported on underlying device
BCM_E_XXXOperation failed.

◆ bcm_port_dscp_map_set()

int bcm_port_dscp_map_set ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
int  srccp,
int  mapcp,
int  prio 
)

Control mapping of Differentiated Services Code Points (DSCP)

Incoming IPv4 format packets have Differentiated Services Code Points in their type of service (ToS) header field. DSCP values are small integers from 0 to 63. Some switch devices have the capability of rewriting incoming code points into other mapped code points for use within the switching domain. Some switch devices also have the capability of setting the internal priority and drop precedence based on the source DSCP. The allowable values for the input parameters may be limited by the device's underlying hardware capabilities. StrataXGS?and StrataSwitch switches allow a limited number of DSCP mapping possibilities: for these devices srccp can be -1 or 0 only. These devices do not perform DSCP-based priority mapping. A port value of -1 or gport type for system configuration will configure all ports. On devices BCM56860 and BCM56970, before flexport operation, port dscp map set must be cleared on the port to be flexed. The DSCP to DSCP, priority, drop precedence mapping enable/disable per port is controlled by bcm_port_dscp_map_mode_set.

DSCP Mapping Parameters
Source DSCP Mapped DSCP Description
-1 0..63 Map all packets to the mapped DSCP value
0..63 0..63 Map packets with source DSCP to mapped DSCP value
Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port number or -1 to setup global mapping table.
[in]srccpSource code point. -1 indicates operation applies to all code points if being configured or a random code point if being retrieved.
[in]mapcpThe new code point to map srccp to if setting the mapping; the currently configured mapping for the port if retrieving settings.
[in]prioPriority of packets mapped for the code point, if available. Priority is 0 to 7 and can have the value (BCM_PRIO_RED/BCM_PRIO_YELLOW/BCM_PRIO_GREEN/BCM_PRIO_PRESERVE) ored in. -1 on get means priority mapping is unavailable.
Return values
BCM_E_NONEOperation completed successfully
BCM_E_PARAMSource or mapped code point values are invalid.
BCM_E_UNAVAILOperation not supported on underlying device, or mapping resources depleted.
BCM_E_XXXOperation failed.

◆ bcm_port_dscp_unmap_get()

int  internal_pri,
bcm_color_t  color,

◆ bcm_port_dtag_mode_get()

int bcm_port_dtag_mode_get ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
int *  mode 
)

Set or retrieve the current double tagging mode for a port.

Configuring double tagging requires the caller configure the TPID inserted using bcm_port_tpid_set . Depending on the underlying device, double tagging may be enabled on a per port basis or only on a system wide basis. If a specific port is requested and double tagging is only supported on a device basis, then this call will affect all ports. Valid values for double tagging mode are defined in table BCM_PORT_DTAG_MODE_table .

Port Double Tag Modes
Mode Meaning
BCM_PORT_DTAG_MODE_NONE Double tagging disabled. Used in normal .1d bridging.
BCM_PORT_DTAG_MODE_INTERNAL A tag is added if the packet does not already contain a tag with the internal TPID (as set by bcm_port_tpid_set). Used for provider ports in a .1ad network.
BCM_PORT_DTAG_MODE_EXTERNAL The TPID as specified by bcm_port_tpid_set is always added to the packet. Used for customer ports in a .1ad network.
BCM_PORT_DTAG_REMOVE_EXTERNAL_TAG Remove the external tag from outgoing packet
BCM_PORT_DTAG_ADD_EXTERNAL_TAG Add an external tag to the incoming packet. The TPID of the tag is set by bcm_port_tpid_set and the priority, Canonical Format Indicator (CFI) and VLAN are set by bcm_port_vlan_inner_tag_set .
BCM_PORT_DTAG_MODE_TRANSPARENT Transparent, that is, tags are ignored or considered as payload
Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port number
[out]modeDouble tag mode as defined in table BCM_PORT_DTAG_MODE_table

◆ bcm_port_dtag_mode_set()

int bcm_port_dtag_mode_set ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
int  mode 
)

Set or retrieve the current double tagging mode for a port.

Configuring double tagging requires the caller configure the TPID inserted using bcm_port_tpid_set . Depending on the underlying device, double tagging may be enabled on a per port basis or only on a system wide basis. If a specific port is requested and double tagging is only supported on a device basis, then this call will affect all ports. Valid values for double tagging mode are defined in table BCM_PORT_DTAG_MODE_table .

Port Double Tag Modes
Mode Meaning
BCM_PORT_DTAG_MODE_NONE Double tagging disabled. Used in normal .1d bridging.
BCM_PORT_DTAG_MODE_INTERNAL A tag is added if the packet does not already contain a tag with the internal TPID (as set by bcm_port_tpid_set). Used for provider ports in a .1ad network.
BCM_PORT_DTAG_MODE_EXTERNAL The TPID as specified by bcm_port_tpid_set is always added to the packet. Used for customer ports in a .1ad network.
BCM_PORT_DTAG_REMOVE_EXTERNAL_TAG Remove the external tag from outgoing packet
BCM_PORT_DTAG_ADD_EXTERNAL_TAG Add an external tag to the incoming packet. The TPID of the tag is set by bcm_port_tpid_set and the priority, Canonical Format Indicator (CFI) and VLAN are set by bcm_port_vlan_inner_tag_set .
BCM_PORT_DTAG_MODE_TRANSPARENT Transparent, that is, tags are ignored or considered as payload
Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port number
[in]modeDouble tag mode as defined in table BCM_PORT_DTAG_MODE_table

◆ bcm_port_duplex_get()

int bcm_port_duplex_get ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
int *  duplex 
)

Get or set the current duplex mode of a port.

Set or get the duplex of the specified port. bcm_port_duplex_set disables auto-negotiation if it is enabled. When setting duplicity, if an error is returned the PHY and the MAC may not be properly set for operation. For correct operation following an error, a valid duplex and speed must be set. When retrieving the current duplicity of a port, if auto-negotiation is enabled the current negotiated duplicity is returned. If auto-negotiation is in progress or there is no link, duplex is returned as BCM_PORT_DUPLEX_HALF. If auto-negotiation is disabled, the forced speed of the port is returned regardless of the link state.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port number
[out]duplexReturned or requested duplex setting, must be one of BCM_PORT_DUPLEX_HALF or BCM_PORT_DUPLEX_FULL.

◆ bcm_port_duplex_set()

int bcm_port_duplex_set ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
int  duplex 
)

Get or set the current duplex mode of a port.

Set or get the duplex of the specified port. bcm_port_duplex_set disables auto-negotiation if it is enabled. When setting duplicity, if an error is returned the PHY and the MAC may not be properly set for operation. For correct operation following an error, a valid duplex and speed must be set. When retrieving the current duplicity of a port, if auto-negotiation is enabled the current negotiated duplicity is returned. If auto-negotiation is in progress or there is no link, duplex is returned as BCM_PORT_DUPLEX_HALF. If auto-negotiation is disabled, the forced speed of the port is returned regardless of the link state.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port number
[in]duplexReturned or requested duplex setting, must be one of BCM_PORT_DUPLEX_HALF or BCM_PORT_DUPLEX_FULL.

◆ bcm_port_e2efc_remote_module_config_t_init()

void bcm_port_e2efc_remote_module_config_t_init ( bcm_port_e2efc_remote_module_config_t *  e2efc_rmod_cfg)

Initialize a bcm_port_e2efc_remote_module_config_t structure.

Parameters
[in,out]e2efc_rmod_cfgPointer to bcm_port_e2efc_remote_module_config_t.
Return values
NONE.

◆ bcm_port_e2efc_remote_module_enable_get()

int bcm_port_e2efc_remote_module_enable_get ( int  unit,
bcm_module_t  remote_module,
bcm_port_e2efc_mode_t  mode,
int *  enable,
bcm_port_e2efc_remote_module_config_t *  e2efc_rmod_cfg 
)

Set/get the remote module that applies E2EFC mechanism.

For set API, enable and configure the remote module to apply E2EFC mechanism. Or disable it. For get API, get the enable state and configuration of the remote module that applies E2EFC mechanism. The supported E2EFC modes are defined by bcm_port_e2efc_mode_t.

tyepdef enum bcm_port_e2efc_mode_e {
bcmPortE2efcModeTx = 0, // E2EFC frame transmit mode
bcmPortE2efcModeRx = 1, // E2EFC frame receive mode
bcmPortE2efcModeCount = 2, // Must be last, not a usable value
} bcm_port_e2efc_mode_t;

The structure bcm_port_e2efc_remote_module_config_t is used to describte the attributes of a remote module for E2EFC.

typedef struct bcm_port_e2efc_remote_module_config_s {
bcm_gport_t local_port; // Local port for E2EFC message transaction, only for E2EFC TX
int pkt_per_second; // Frequency of sending E2EFC messages, only for E2EFC TX
} bcm_port_e2efc_remote_module_config_t;
Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]remote_moduleremote module id
[in]modeselected mode
[out]enable(INOUT) enable or disable selection
[out]e2efc_rmod_cfg(INOUT) structure containing the configuration. For set API, Ignored when enable = 0. For get API, Only valid if the remote module is enabled.

◆ bcm_port_e2efc_remote_module_enable_set()

int bcm_port_e2efc_remote_module_enable_set ( int  unit,
bcm_module_t  remote_module,
bcm_port_e2efc_mode_t  mode,
int  enable,
bcm_port_e2efc_remote_module_config_t *  e2efc_rmod_cfg 
)

Set/get the remote module that applies E2EFC mechanism.

For set API, enable and configure the remote module to apply E2EFC mechanism. Or disable it. For get API, get the enable state and configuration of the remote module that applies E2EFC mechanism. The supported E2EFC modes are defined by bcm_port_e2efc_mode_t.

tyepdef enum bcm_port_e2efc_mode_e {
bcmPortE2efcModeTx = 0, // E2EFC frame transmit mode
bcmPortE2efcModeRx = 1, // E2EFC frame receive mode
bcmPortE2efcModeCount = 2, // Must be last, not a usable value
} bcm_port_e2efc_mode_t;

The structure bcm_port_e2efc_remote_module_config_t is used to describte the attributes of a remote module for E2EFC.

typedef struct bcm_port_e2efc_remote_module_config_s {
bcm_gport_t local_port; // Local port for E2EFC message transaction, only for E2EFC TX
int pkt_per_second; // Frequency of sending E2EFC messages, only for E2EFC TX
} bcm_port_e2efc_remote_module_config_t;
Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]remote_moduleremote module id
[in]modeselected mode
[in]enable(INOUT) enable or disable selection
[in]e2efc_rmod_cfg(INOUT) structure containing the configuration. For set API, Ignored when enable = 0. For get API, Only valid if the remote module is enabled.

◆ bcm_port_e2efc_remote_module_traverse()

int bcm_port_e2efc_remote_module_traverse ( int  unit,
bcm_port_e2efc_remote_module_traverse_cb  cb,
void *  user_data 
)

Iterate over the E2EFC remote module configuration on a given unit and call user-provided callback for every entry.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]cbCallback function to execute.
[in]user_dataPointer to any user data.

◆ bcm_port_e2efc_remote_port_add()

int bcm_port_e2efc_remote_port_add ( int  unit,
bcm_port_e2efc_remote_port_config_t *  e2efc_rport_cfg,
int *  rport_handle_id 
)

Add remote module-port and set configuration.

Add remote module-port and set configuration. Return a handle id for the bcm_port_e2efc_remote_port_xxx APIs. The API of remote module-port configuration is only for E2EFC transmission. The enumuration bcm_port_e2efc_resource_type_t is used to indicate type of E2EFC resource being configured. Xoff, Xon and drop thresholds of Internal Memory, External Memory and EMA (External Memory Access) are configured using xoff_threshold_bytes, xon_threshold_bytes and drop_threshold_bytes respectively.Xoff, Xon and drop thresholds of Queue Entries and RQE (Replication Queue Engine) entries are configured using xoff_threshold_packets, xon_threshold_packets and drop_threshold_packets respectively.

typedef enum bcm_port_e2efc_resource_type_e {
BCM_E2EFC_RESOURCE_TYPE_NONE = 0, // Resource type not needed
BCM_E2EFC_RESOURCE_TYPE_INT_MEM = 1, // Resource type internal memory configured in number of bytes
BCM_E2EFC_RESOURCE_TYPE_QEN = 2, // Resource type queue entries configured in number of packets
BCM_E2EFC_RESOURCE_TYPE_RQE = 3, // Resource type replication queue engine entries configured in number of packets
BCM_E2EFC_RESOURCE_TYPE_EXT_MEM = 4, // Resource type external memory configured in number of bytes
BCM_E2EFC_RESOURCE_TYPE_EMA = 5, // Resource type external memory access configured in number of bytes
BCM_E2EFC_RESOURCE_TYPE_COUNT = 6 // Number of E2EFC Resource type
} bcm_port_e2efc_resource_type_t;

The structure bcm_port_e2efc_remote_port_config_t is used to describe the attributes of a remote port for E2EFC.

typedef struct bcm_port_e2efc_remote_port_config_s {
bcm_module_t remote_module; // Remote module id that E2EFC applied
bcm_port_t remote_port; // Remote port id to be configured
int xoff_threshold_bytes; // Assert backpressure when number of buffers used is at or above this threshold in bytes
int xoff_threshold_packets; // Assert backpressure when number of buffers used is at or above this threshold in packets
int xon_threshold_bytes; // Remove backpressure when number of buffers used drop below this threshold in bytes
int xon_threshold_packets; // Remove backpressure when number of buffers used drop below this threshold in packets
int drop_threshold_bytes; // Drop packets when number of buffers used hit this threshold in bytes
int drop_threshold_packets; // Drop packets when number of buffers used hit this threshold in packets
bcm_port_e2efc_resource_type_t e2efc_resource_type; // Type of resource being configured. Internal Memory, External Memory and EMA shall be confgured in number of bytes and Queue Entry and RQE shall be configured in number of packets.
} bcm_port_e2efc_remote_port_config_t;
Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]e2efc_rport_cfgstructure containing the configuration.
[out]rport_handle_idremote port handle id, to be used for the rest of bcm_port_e2efc_remote_port_xxx APIs.

◆ bcm_port_e2efc_remote_port_config_t_init()

void bcm_port_e2efc_remote_port_config_t_init ( bcm_port_e2efc_remote_port_config_t *  e2efc_rport_cfg)

Initialize a bcm_port_e2efc_remote_port_config_t structure.

Parameters
[in,out]e2efc_rport_cfgPointer to bcm_port_e2efc_remote_port_config_t.
Return values
NONE.

int  rport_handle_id 
)

◆ bcm_port_e2efc_remote_port_get()

int  rport_handle_id,
bcm_port_e2efc_remote_port_config_t *  e2efc_rport_cfg 
)

Set/get the configuration of the remote port.

For set API, modify the configuration of the remote port. For get API, get configuration of the remote port. Return the remote module, remote port and configuration of the handle id.
