◆ bcm_port_egress_get()

int bcm_port_egress_get ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
int  modid,
bcm_pbmp_t *  pbmp 
)

Configure ports to block or allow packets from a given ingress port.

This API controls the ability of a specific ingress port on a specific module to send packets to a local egress port. The specified modid is derived from the modid of port. For bcm_port_egress_set, if port is -1 or gport type for system configuration, the configuration is applied to all source ports on the specified module.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical source port number.
[in]modidModule ID of the source port.
[out]pbmpPort bitmap indicating all local ports allowed to egress traffic from specified port/modid.

◆ bcm_port_egress_set()

int bcm_port_egress_set ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
int  modid,
bcm_pbmp_t  pbmp 
)

Configure ports to block or allow packets from a given ingress port.

This API controls the ability of a specific ingress port on a specific module to send packets to a local egress port. The specified modid is derived from the modid of port. For bcm_port_egress_set, if port is -1 or gport type for system configuration, the configuration is applied to all source ports on the specified module.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical source port number.
[in]modidModule ID of the source port.
[in]pbmpPort bitmap indicating all local ports allowed to egress traffic from specified port/modid.

◆ bcm_port_enable_get()

int bcm_port_enable_get ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
int *  enable 
)

Enable or disable a port.

Controls whether a port is enabled or disabled for transmission and reception of packets. The chip should not be configured so as to switch any packets to a disabled port because the packets may build up in the MMU.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port number
[out]enableBoolean value indicating enable (1) or disable (0).

◆ bcm_port_enable_set()

int bcm_port_enable_set ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
int  enable 
)

Enable or disable a port.

Controls whether a port is enabled or disabled for transmission and reception of packets. The chip should not be configured so as to switch any packets to a disabled port because the packets may build up in the MMU.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port number
[in]enableBoolean value indicating enable (1) or disable (0).

◆ bcm_port_encap_config_get()

int bcm_port_encap_config_get ( int  unit,
bcm_gport_t  gport,
bcm_port_encap_config_t *  encap_config 
)

Set or get the link level encapsulation configuration.

Starting with BCM56334 devices support not only simply modifying the link layer encapsulation mode but also Embedded HiGig feature to allow them to interoperate. All Ethernet ports now can send and receive HiGig header ID embedded appropriately into regular Ethernet packet. Native HiGig ports should still be programmed as HiGig, but other ports could be BCM_PORT_ENCAP_IEEE-native Ethernet packets or BCM_PORT_ENCAP_HIGI2_L2 and BCM_PORT_ENCAP_HIGIG2_IP_GRE-encapsulated HiGig header in the L2/L3 packet.

Port Encapsulation Modes
Mode Meaning
BCM_PORT_ENCAP_IEEE Standard IEEE link layer encapsulation
BCM_PORT_ENCAP_HIGIG Broadcom Proprietary HiGig encapsulation.
BCM_PORT_ENCAP_HIGIG2 Broadcom Proprietary HiGig2 encapsulation.
BCM_PORT_ENCAP_HIGIG2_LITE Broadcom Proprietary HiGig2 encapsulation compatible with the BCM5621X and BCM5622X chip families.
BCM_PORT_ENCAP_B5632 Broadcom Proprietary encapsulation compatible with the BCM5632.
BCM_PORT_ENCAP_HIGIG2_L2 Broadcom Proprietary HiGig encapsulation embedded into standard IEEE L2 packet.
BCM_PORT_ENCAP_HIGIG2_IP_GRE Broadcom Proprietary HiGig encapsulation embedded into standard L3 packet with GRE tunnel.
BCM_PORT_ENCAP_SBX Broadcom Proprietary encapsulation compatible with XCore (SBX) family of packet processors.
BCM_PORT_ENCAP_PREAMBLE_SOP_ONLY Broadcom Proprietary 1B preamble encapsulation.
BCM_PORT_ENCAP_HIGIG_OVER_ETHERNET Broadcom Proprietary HiGig over Ethernet encapsulation.
BCM_PORT_ENCAP_HIGIG3 Broadcom Proprietary HiGig3 encapsulation.
Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]gportGeneric or logical port number
[out]encap_config(for "_set") Encapsulation configuration structure defined as following
(for "_get", OUT) Encapsulation configuration structure defined as following The struct bcm_port_encap_config_t is used to describe the port encapsulation data.
bcm_port_encap_config_t
Field Type Description
encap bcm_port_encap_t Port encapsulation mode as defined in table BCM_PORT_ENCAP_e
oui_ethertype uint16 Vendor specific ether type in L2 tunnel header
higig_ethertype uint16 HiGig ether type
oui uint8 Vendor specific OUI value
hgoe_reserved uint16 Value for reserved field in HGoE header
dest_mac bcm_mac_t Destination MAC address
src_mac bcm_mac_t Source MAC address
tpid uint16 Outer L2 header TPID
vlan uint16 Outer L2 header VLAN tag
ttl uint8 Hop limit
tos uint8 Traffic class/Tos byte
src_addr bcm_ip_t Tunnel source ip address (IPv4)
dst_addr bcm_ip_t Tunnel destination ip address (IPv4)
typedef struct bcm_port_encap_config_s {
bcm_port_encap_t encap; // Port encapsulation mode as defined in table \ref BCM_PORT_ENCAP_e
uint16 oui_ethertype; // Vendor specific ether type.
uint16 higig_ethertype; // HiGig ether type
uint8 oui[3]; // Vendor specific OUI value
bcm_mac_t dst_mac; // Destination MAC address
bcm_mac_t src_mac; // Source MAC address
uint16 tpid; // Outer L2 header TPID
uint16 vlan; // Outer L2 header VLAN tag
uint8 ttl; // Hop limit.
uint8 tos; // Traffic Class/Tos byte
bcm_ip_t src_addr; // Tunnel source ip address (IPv4)
bcm_ip_t dst_addr; // Tunnel destination ip address (IPv4)
} bcm_port_encap_config_t;

◆ bcm_port_encap_config_set()

int bcm_port_encap_config_set ( int  unit,
bcm_gport_t  gport,
bcm_port_encap_config_t *  encap_config 
)

Set or get the link level encapsulation configuration.

Starting with BCM56334 devices support not only simply modifying the link layer encapsulation mode but also Embedded HiGig feature to allow them to interoperate. All Ethernet ports now can send and receive HiGig header ID embedded appropriately into regular Ethernet packet. Native HiGig ports should still be programmed as HiGig, but other ports could be BCM_PORT_ENCAP_IEEE-native Ethernet packets or BCM_PORT_ENCAP_HIGI2_L2 and BCM_PORT_ENCAP_HIGIG2_IP_GRE-encapsulated HiGig header in the L2/L3 packet.

Port Encapsulation Modes
Mode Meaning
BCM_PORT_ENCAP_IEEE Standard IEEE link layer encapsulation
BCM_PORT_ENCAP_HIGIG Broadcom Proprietary HiGig encapsulation.
BCM_PORT_ENCAP_HIGIG2 Broadcom Proprietary HiGig2 encapsulation.
BCM_PORT_ENCAP_HIGIG2_LITE Broadcom Proprietary HiGig2 encapsulation compatible with the BCM5621X and BCM5622X chip families.
BCM_PORT_ENCAP_B5632 Broadcom Proprietary encapsulation compatible with the BCM5632.
BCM_PORT_ENCAP_HIGIG2_L2 Broadcom Proprietary HiGig encapsulation embedded into standard IEEE L2 packet.
BCM_PORT_ENCAP_HIGIG2_IP_GRE Broadcom Proprietary HiGig encapsulation embedded into standard L3 packet with GRE tunnel.
BCM_PORT_ENCAP_SBX Broadcom Proprietary encapsulation compatible with XCore (SBX) family of packet processors.
BCM_PORT_ENCAP_PREAMBLE_SOP_ONLY Broadcom Proprietary 1B preamble encapsulation.
BCM_PORT_ENCAP_HIGIG_OVER_ETHERNET Broadcom Proprietary HiGig over Ethernet encapsulation.
BCM_PORT_ENCAP_HIGIG3 Broadcom Proprietary HiGig3 encapsulation.
Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]gportGeneric or logical port number
[in]encap_config(for "_set") Encapsulation configuration structure defined as following
(for "_get", OUT) Encapsulation configuration structure defined as following The struct bcm_port_encap_config_t is used to describe the port encapsulation data.
bcm_port_encap_config_t
Field Type Description
encap bcm_port_encap_t Port encapsulation mode as defined in table BCM_PORT_ENCAP_e
oui_ethertype uint16 Vendor specific ether type in L2 tunnel header
higig_ethertype uint16 HiGig ether type
oui uint8 Vendor specific OUI value
hgoe_reserved uint16 Value for reserved field in HGoE header
dest_mac bcm_mac_t Destination MAC address
src_mac bcm_mac_t Source MAC address
tpid uint16 Outer L2 header TPID
vlan uint16 Outer L2 header VLAN tag
ttl uint8 Hop limit
tos uint8 Traffic class/Tos byte
src_addr bcm_ip_t Tunnel source ip address (IPv4)
dst_addr bcm_ip_t Tunnel destination ip address (IPv4)
typedef struct bcm_port_encap_config_s {
bcm_port_encap_t encap; // Port encapsulation mode as defined in table \ref BCM_PORT_ENCAP_e
uint16 oui_ethertype; // Vendor specific ether type.
uint16 higig_ethertype; // HiGig ether type
uint8 oui[3]; // Vendor specific OUI value
bcm_mac_t dst_mac; // Destination MAC address
bcm_mac_t src_mac; // Source MAC address
uint16 tpid; // Outer L2 header TPID
uint16 vlan; // Outer L2 header VLAN tag
uint8 ttl; // Hop limit.
uint8 tos; // Traffic Class/Tos byte
bcm_ip_t src_addr; // Tunnel source ip address (IPv4)
bcm_ip_t dst_addr; // Tunnel destination ip address (IPv4)
} bcm_port_encap_config_t;

◆ bcm_port_encap_config_t_init()

void bcm_port_encap_config_t_init ( bcm_port_encap_config_t *  encap_config)

Initialize a Port Encapsulation Configuration structure.

Initializes a port encapsulation configuration structure to default values. This function should be used to initialize any Port Encapsulation Configuration structure prior to filling it out and passing it to an API function. This ensures that the structure is initialized to correct default values on subsequent API releases that may add new members to the structure.

Parameters
[in,out]encap_configPointer to Port Encapsulation Configuration structure to initialize.
Return values
NONE.

int *  encap_local_id

◆ bcm_port_encap_map_get()

int bcm_port_encap_map_get ( int  unit,
uint32  flags,
bcm_if_t  encap_id,
bcm_gport_t *  port 
)

Get the encapsulation to port mapping from encap_id.

Get the encapsulation to port mapping from encap_id. Currently used only for egress multicast mapping of outlif to local port.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]flagsAPI flags, currently unused
[in]encap_idencapsulation ID mapped from
[out]portport mapped to
Return values
BCM_E_XXX

◆ bcm_port_encap_map_set()

int bcm_port_encap_map_set ( int  unit,
uint32  flags,
bcm_if_t  encap_id,
bcm_gport_t  port 
)

Set the encapsulation to port mapping from encap_id to port.

Set the encapsulation to port mapping from encap_id to port. Currently used only for egress multicast mapping of outlif to local port. By default the API will not allow remapping an encapsulation to a port on a different core, due to hardware limitations. If using the BCM_PORT_ENCAP_MAP_ALLOW_CORE_CHANGE flag this will be allowed, and it would be the user's responsibility to make sure this outlif is not used in any outlif-only replication of any (egress) multicast group. Not adhering will result in wrong behavior by the hardware.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]flagsAPI flags, Supported flags: BCM_PORT_ENCAP_MAP_ALLOW_CORE_CHANGE
[in]encap_idencapsulation ID to map from
[in]portport to map to
Return values
BCM_E_XXX

◆ bcm_port_encap_set()

bcm_port_t  port,
int  mode 
)

Set or get the link level encapsulation mode.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]port
[in]mode

bcm_port_extender_mapping_type_t  type,
bcm_port_extender_mapping_info_t *  mapping_info

Configure/retrieve port extender mapping from different inputs to Local pp port.

Port extender mapping type values
bcmPortExtenderMappingTypePonTunnel Map information includes PON port and Tunnel-ID

Port Extender Mapping flags
Name Description

BCM_PORT_EXTENDER_MAPPING_EGRESS Map information to Outgoing local PP port

bcm_port_extender_mapping_info_t
Field BCM Type Description
pp_port bcm_gport_t Mapped Local PP port
tunnel_id bcm_tunnel_id_t Tunnel-ID
phy_port bcm_gport_t Physical Port connected to interface x channel
vlan bcm_vlan_t VLAN-ID
user_define_value uint32 User define value from header

◆ bcm_port_extender_mapping_info_t_init()

void bcm_port_extender_mapping_info_t_init ( bcm_port_extender_mapping_info_t *  mapping_info)

Initialize a port extender mapping struct.

Initializes a port extender mapping structure to default values. This function should be used to initialize any port extender mapping structure prior to filling it out and passing it to an API function. This ensures that subsequent API releases may add new structure members to the bcm_port_extender_mapping_info_t structure, and bcm_port_extender_mapping_info_t will initialize the new members to correct default values.

Parameters
[in]mapping_infoPointer to the port extender mapping struct.
Return values
NONE.

◆ bcm_port_fast_reboot_traffic_enable()

int bcm_port_fast_reboot_traffic_enable ( int  unit)

Enable traffic after Fast Reboot and reconfiguration has completed.

Sets bits for logical ports in EPC_LINK_BMAP and ING_DEST_PORT_ENABLE to allow traffic to flow to the ports after fast reboot and user reconfiguration has been completed.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.

◆ bcm_port_fault_get()

int bcm_port_fault_get ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
uint32 *  flags 
)

Get link fault type.

Get link fault type of a port. Used for 10G ports to determine when a link is down, it is whether due to local or/and remote fault conditions that the link fault state machine has found.

Port FAULT Flags
Flag Meaning
BCM_PORT_FAULT_LOCAL Local fault occurs.
BCM_PORT_FAULT_REMOTE Remote fault occurs.
Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port number
[out]flagsFlags to indicate fault type, See BCM_PORT_FAULT_flags for details.

◆ bcm_port_fdr_config_get()

int bcm_port_fdr_config_get ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
bcm_port_fdr_config_t *  fdr_config 
)

Get the configuration for Flight Data Recorder (FDR) on a port.

Get the Flight Data Recorder (FDR) Configuration on a given port.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portLogical Port number
[out]fdr_configFDR configuration

◆ bcm_port_fdr_config_set()

◆ bcm_port_flood_block_get()

int bcm_port_flood_block_get ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  ingress_port,
bcm_port_t  egress_port,
uint32 *  flags 
)

Selectively block flooding traffic.

Selectively block VLAN flooding traffic ingressing on ingress_port from egressing on egress_port. The types of flooding traffic that can be selectively blocked are described in table BCM_PORT_FLOOD_BLOCK_f . Current settings can be retrieved using bcm_port_flood_block_get.

Port Flooding Block Flags
Flag Meaning
BCM_PORT_FLOOD_BLOCK_BCAST Block L2 Broadcast packets ingressing on the specified ingress port from egressing on the specified egress port.
BCM_PORT_FLOOD_BLOCK_UNKNOWN_UCAST Block unknown L2 packets ingressing on the specified ingress port from flooding out the specified egress port.
BCM_PORT_FLOOD_BLOCK_UNKNOWN_MCAST Block unknown L2 Multicast packets ingressing on the specified ingress port from egressing on the specified egress port.
BCM_PORT_FLOOD_BLOCK_KNOWN_MCAST Block known L2 Multicast packets ingressing on the specified ingress port from egressing on the specified egress port.
BCM_PORT_FLOOD_BLOCK_KNOWN_UCAST Block known L2 Unicast packets ingressing on the specified ingress port from egressing on the specified egress port.
BCM_PORT_FLOOD_BLOCK_ALL Block all packets ingressing on the specified ingress port from egressing on the specified egress port.
BCM_PORT_FLOOD_BLOCK_UNKNOWN_IP_MCAST Block unknown IP Multicast(DA-MAC prefix with '01-00-5e-xx-xx-xx') packets ingressing on the specified ingress port from egressing on the specified egress port.
BCM_PORT_FLOOD_BLOCK_UNKNOWN_NONIP_MCAST Block unknown Non-IP Multicast(DA-MAC prefix without '01-00-5e-xx-xx-xx') packets ingressing on the specified ingress port from egressing on the specified egress port.

This functionality is not available on all platforms. Packets with known L2 multicast destination addresses must be handled via the L2 Multicast APIs.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]ingress_portDevice or logical port number of the ingress port
[in]egress_portDevice or logical port number of the egress port
[out]flags

◆ bcm_port_flood_block_set()

int bcm_port_flood_block_set ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  ingress_port,
bcm_port_t  egress_port,
uint32  flags 
)

Selectively block flooding traffic.

Selectively block VLAN flooding traffic ingressing on ingress_port from egressing on egress_port. The types of flooding traffic that can be selectively blocked are described in table BCM_PORT_FLOOD_BLOCK_f . Current settings can be retrieved using bcm_port_flood_block_get.

Port Flooding Block Flags
Flag Meaning
BCM_PORT_FLOOD_BLOCK_BCAST Block L2 Broadcast packets ingressing on the specified ingress port from egressing on the specified egress port.
BCM_PORT_FLOOD_BLOCK_UNKNOWN_UCAST Block unknown L2 packets ingressing on the specified ingress port from flooding out the specified egress port.
BCM_PORT_FLOOD_BLOCK_UNKNOWN_MCAST Block unknown L2 Multicast packets ingressing on the specified ingress port from egressing on the specified egress port.
BCM_PORT_FLOOD_BLOCK_KNOWN_MCAST Block known L2 Multicast packets ingressing on the specified ingress port from egressing on the specified egress port.
BCM_PORT_FLOOD_BLOCK_KNOWN_UCAST Block known L2 Unicast packets ingressing on the specified ingress port from egressing on the specified egress port.
BCM_PORT_FLOOD_BLOCK_ALL Block all packets ingressing on the specified ingress port from egressing on the specified egress port.
BCM_PORT_FLOOD_BLOCK_UNKNOWN_IP_MCAST Block unknown IP Multicast(DA-MAC prefix with '01-00-5e-xx-xx-xx') packets ingressing on the specified ingress port from egressing on the specified egress port.
BCM_PORT_FLOOD_BLOCK_UNKNOWN_NONIP_MCAST Block unknown Non-IP Multicast(DA-MAC prefix without '01-00-5e-xx-xx-xx') packets ingressing on the specified ingress port from egressing on the specified egress port.

This functionality is not available on all platforms. Packets with known L2 multicast destination addresses must be handled via the L2 Multicast APIs.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]ingress_portDevice or logical port number of the ingress port
[in]egress_portDevice or logical port number of the egress port
[in]flags

◆ bcm_port_flood_group_get()

int bcm_port_flood_group_get ( int  unit,
bcm_gport_t  port,
uint32  flags,
bcm_port_flood_group_t *  flood_groups 
)

Set/Get the flooding groups for ports or LIFs.

If it is hoped to adjust the flooding destinations per port or inLIF, call this pair of APIs. The flooding groups in <flood_groups> parameter are offsets to the default flooding destinations in VSI.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portgport.
[in]flagsflags.
[out]flood_groups(IN/OUT) Flooding groups represented by gport, including unknown unicast group, unknown multicast group and broadcast group.

◆ bcm_port_flood_group_set()

int bcm_port_flood_group_set ( int  unit,
bcm_gport_t  port,
uint32  flags,
bcm_port_flood_group_t *  flood_groups 
)

Set/Get the flooding groups for ports or LIFs.

If it is hoped to adjust the flooding destinations per port or inLIF, call this pair of APIs. The flooding groups in <flood_groups> parameter are offsets to the default flooding destinations in VSI.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portgport.
[in]flagsflags.
[in]flood_groups(IN/OUT) Flooding groups represented by gport, including unknown unicast group, unknown multicast group and broadcast group.

◆ bcm_port_flood_group_t_init()

void bcm_port_flood_group_t_init ( bcm_port_flood_group_t *  flood_groups)

Initialize a port flooding group structure.

Initializes a flooding group structure. The structure bcm_port_flood_group_t is used to describe the flooding groups.

typedef struct bcm_port_flood_group_s {
bcm_gport_t unknown_unicast_group; // Destination for unknown unicast packets.
bcm_gport_t unknown_multicast_group; // Destination for unknown multicast packets.
bcm_gport_t broadcast_group; // Destination for broadcast packets.
} bcm_port_flood_group_t;
Parameters
[in,out]flood_groups(INOUT) Pointer to bcm_port_flood_group_t.
Return values
NONE.

◆ bcm_port_force_dest_get()

int bcm_port_force_dest_get ( int  unit,
bcm_gport_t  gport,
bcm_port_dest_info_t *  dest_info 
)

Get or set the destination of a packet (recycled-path) for the second pass.

Get or set the destination of a packet (recycled-path) for the second pass.

port destination attributes
flags Future expansion
gport For example, sysport gport, unicast gport ormulticast gport.
priority Traffic class (0-7).
dp Drop precedence (0-3).
Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]gportgport identifying the port on which packet arrives on second pass.
[out]dest_info(IN - for set) configure forwarding attributes for the gport identified above. see table BCM_PORT_DEST_INFO_table
(OUT - for get) retrieve forwarding attributes for the gport identified above. see table BCM_PORT_DEST_INFO_table

◆ bcm_port_force_dest_set()

port destination attributes
flags Future expansion
gport For example, sysport gport, unicast gport ormulticast gport.
priority Traffic class (0-7).
dp Drop precedence (0-3).

◆ bcm_port_force_forward_get()

int bcm_port_force_forward_get ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
bcm_port_t *  egr_port,
int *  enabled 
)

Set or get egress override port.

This function allows packets to bypass the normal forwarding logic and be sent out on a specific port (usually a HiGig port) instead. This is desirable, for example, in environments where all packets must be forwarded to a fabric device for fairness or additional processing, even if the final egress port is on the same switch device as the ingress port. L2/L3 and field processor lookups are still performed, and results passed along in the HiGig header.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portIngress port number
[out]egr_portForced egress port number
[out]enabledIf nonzero, egress override is enabled

◆ bcm_port_force_forward_mode_get()

int bcm_port_force_forward_mode_get ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
bcm_port_t *  egr_port,
uint32 *  flags 
)

Set or get egress override port mode.

This function allows packets to bypass the normal forwarding logic and be sent out on a specific port (usually a HiGig port) instead. This is desirable, for example, in environments where all packets must be forwarded to a fabric device for fairness or additional processing, even if the final egress port is on the same switch device as the ingress port. L2/L3 and field processor lookups are still performed, and results passed along in the HiGig header. The available flags are shown in BCM_PORT_FORCE_FORWARD_MODES_table

Port Force Forward Modes
Mode Meaning
BCM_PORT_FORCE_FORWARD_DISABLE Standard forwarding logic
BCM_PORT_FORCE_FORWARD_ALL Forward all traffic to the specified egress port
BCM_PORT_FORCE_FORWARD_LOCAL Only traffic otherwise destined to local ports is forwarded to the specified egress port
Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portPort number
[out]egr_port(IN for set/OUT for get) Egress port number
[out]flags(IN for set/OUT for get) Flags from BCM_PORT_FORCE_FORWARD_MODES_table

◆ bcm_port_force_forward_mode_set()

int bcm_port_force_forward_mode_set ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
bcm_port_t  egr_port,
uint32  flags 
)

Set or get egress override port mode.

This function allows packets to bypass the normal forwarding logic and be sent out on a specific port (usually a HiGig port) instead. This is desirable, for example, in environments where all packets must be forwarded to a fabric device for fairness or additional processing, even if the final egress port is on the same switch device as the ingress port. L2/L3 and field processor lookups are still performed, and results passed along in the HiGig header. The available flags are shown in BCM_PORT_FORCE_FORWARD_MODES_table

Port Force Forward Modes
Mode Meaning
BCM_PORT_FORCE_FORWARD_DISABLE Standard forwarding logic
BCM_PORT_FORCE_FORWARD_ALL Forward all traffic to the specified egress port
BCM_PORT_FORCE_FORWARD_LOCAL Only traffic otherwise destined to local ports is forwarded to the specified egress port
Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portPort number
[in]egr_port(IN for set/OUT for get) Egress port number
[in]flags(IN for set/OUT for get) Flags from BCM_PORT_FORCE_FORWARD_MODES_table

◆ bcm_port_force_forward_set()

int bcm_port_force_forward_set ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
bcm_port_t  egr_port,
int  enable 
)

Set or get egress override port.

This function allows packets to bypass the normal forwarding logic and be sent out on a specific port (usually a HiGig port) instead. This is desirable, for example, in environments where all packets must be forwarded to a fabric device for fairness or additional processing, even if the final egress port is on the same switch device as the ingress port. L2/L3 and field processor lookups are still performed, and results passed along in the HiGig header.

[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portIngress port number
[in]egr_portForced egress port number
[in]enableIf nonzero, enable egress override

◆ bcm_port_force_vlan_get()

int bcm_port_force_vlan_get ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
bcm_vlan_t *  vlan,
int *  pkt_prio,
uint32 *  flags 
)

Set/Get force VLAN attribute of a port.

Set/Get force VLAN attribute of a port. For tagged packets that are egressing a port, the VLAN ID (and optionally the 802.1p priority bits) in the VLAN tag can be forced to a fixed value using this API. Alternatively, the tagged packets can be forced to go out as untagged. This feature is initially disabled for all ports. For operation on a Virtual Port(VP), this API configures private vlan attributes for the given VP. The parameter pkt_prio should also be ignored in this case.

Force VLAN Flags
Flag Meaning
BCM_PORT_FORCE_VLAN_ENABLE Enable force VLAN on the port
BCM_PORT_FORCE_VLAN_UNTAG Egress packet untagged on the port
BCM_PORT_FORCE_VLAN_PROMISCUOUS_PORT Promiscuous port type, for VP only
BCM_PORT_FORCE_VLAN_ISOLATED_PORT Isolated port type, for VP only
BCM_PORT_FORCE_VLAN_COMMUNITY_PORT Community port type, for VP only
Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port number
[out]vlan(for "_set") VLAN ID used if packets are tagged on egress
(for "_get", OUT) VLAN ID used if packets are tagged on egress
[out]pkt_prio(for "_set") Priority used if packets are tagged on egress (0 to 7) or -1 to disable the priority override on egress
(for "_get", OUT) Priority used if packets are tagged on egress
[out]flags(for "_set") Flags; see BCM_PORT_FORCE_VLAN_flags for detailed information
(for "_get", OUT) Flags

◆ bcm_port_force_vlan_set()

int bcm_port_force_vlan_set ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
bcm_vlan_t  vlan,
int  pkt_prio,
uint32  flags 
)

Set/Get force VLAN attribute of a port.

Set/Get force VLAN attribute of a port. For tagged packets that are egressing a port, the VLAN ID (and optionally the 802.1p priority bits) in the VLAN tag can be forced to a fixed value using this API. Alternatively, the tagged packets can be forced to go out as untagged. This feature is initially disabled for all ports. For operation on a Virtual Port(VP), this API configures private vlan attributes for the given VP. The parameter pkt_prio should also be ignored in this case.

Force VLAN Flags
Flag Meaning
BCM_PORT_FORCE_VLAN_ENABLE Enable force VLAN on the port
BCM_PORT_FORCE_VLAN_UNTAG Egress packet untagged on the port
BCM_PORT_FORCE_VLAN_PROMISCUOUS_PORT Promiscuous port type, for VP only
BCM_PORT_FORCE_VLAN_ISOLATED_PORT Isolated port type, for VP only
BCM_PORT_FORCE_VLAN_COMMUNITY_PORT Community port type, for VP only
Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port number
[in]vlan(for "_set") VLAN ID used if packets are tagged on egress
(for "_get", OUT) VLAN ID used if packets are tagged on egress
[in]pkt_prio(for "_set") Priority used if packets are tagged on egress (0 to 7) or -1 to disable the priority override on egress
(for "_get", OUT) Priority used if packets are tagged on egress
[in]flags(for "_set") Flags; see BCM_PORT_FORCE_VLAN_flags for detailed information
(for "_get", OUT) Flags

◆ bcm_port_frame_max_get()

int bcm_port_frame_max_get ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
int *  size 
)

Set or retrieve the current maximum packet size permitted on a port.

Set or retrieve the current maximum frame size for the specified port. The frame size may be different for ports supporting multiple speeds. For this reason, whenever the speed of a port changes the frame size should be set to the desired length. This API can be used to enable jumbo frames on a port by setting the frame size to a jumbo value. When setting the frame size on a port, it is the callers responsibility to take into account any additional tags or CRC that may be added by the switch device. For example, when configuring HiGig ports or stacking ports on some devices, a HiGig header or stack tag may be added to the packets. For front-panel ports (that is, non-stacking or HiGig ports), setting the maximum frame size to X indicates packets of length X + 4 are permitted.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portPort to set or retrieve maximum frame size on
[out]sizeThe frame size to set (or current frame size returned) in bytes.

◆ bcm_port_frame_max_set()

int bcm_port_frame_max_set ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
int  size 
)

Set or retrieve the current maximum packet size permitted on a port.

Set or retrieve the current maximum frame size for the specified port. The frame size may be different for ports supporting multiple speeds. For this reason, whenever the speed of a port changes the frame size should be set to the desired length. This API can be used to enable jumbo frames on a port by setting the frame size to a jumbo value. When setting the frame size on a port, it is the callers responsibility to take into account any additional tags or CRC that may be added by the switch device. For example, when configuring HiGig ports or stacking ports on some devices, a HiGig header or stack tag may be added to the packets. For front-panel ports (that is, non-stacking or HiGig ports), setting the maximum frame size to X indicates packets of length X + 4 are permitted.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portPort to set or retrieve maximum frame size on
[in]sizeThe frame size to set (or current frame size returned) in bytes.

◆ bcm_port_get()

int bcm_port_get ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
uint32 *  flags,
bcm_port_interface_info_t *  interface_info,
bcm_port_mapping_info_t *  mapping_info 
)

add/remove/get port

Allows for dynamic NIF port configuration changes. Calling bcm_petra_port_add must be done on detached ports.

bcm_port_interface_config_t
Field Type Description
phy_port uint32 related physical port (first physical port for multi-lane interfaces)
interface bcm_port_if_t interface of port (See BCM_PORT_IF_types table for supported interface types)
num_lanes uint32 number of lanes the interface occupies
phy_pbmp bcm_pbmp_t bitmap of phy lanes occupied by the interface(relevant only for ILKN interface)
interface_id uint32 interface id(relevant only for ILKN interface)
max_speed int The supported port max speed via legacy flex port operations, i.e. the max speed provisioned through soc property port_map.

bcm_port_mapping_info_t
Field Type Description
channel uint32 related port channel
core int related port core id
tm_port uint32 corresponding tm port
base_q_pair uint32 corresponding base queue pair (relevant in case BCM_PORT_ADD_BASE_Q_PAIR_WITH_ID flag is set)
num_priorities uint32 ports number of priorities
base_uc_queue uint32 base of unicast queue
num_uc_queue uint32 number of unicast queue
base_mc_queue uint32 base of mcast queue
num_mc_queue uint32 number of mcast queue

Port add Flags
Flag Meaning
BCM_PORT_ADD_BASE_Q_PAIR_WITH_ID The id of base queue pair is given in bcm_port_mapping_info_t strcuture.
BCM_PORT_ADD_CONFIG_CHANNELIZED The added port if part of an channelized interface (relevant for non-Interlaken interfaces).
BCM_PORT_ADD_CGM_AUTO_ADJUST_DISABLE disable CGM default adjustments, if set the user is responsible for CGM configuration.
BCM_PORT_ADD_HIGH_GIG Indicate a high gig port.
BCM_PORT_ADD_DONT_PROBE Don't probe(initialize SerDes and MAC) the new physical interface.
BCM_PORT_ADD_USE_PHY_PBMP Use phy_pbmp parameter to indicate interface lanes.
BCM_PORT_ADD_TDM_QUEUING_ON TDM queuing is on for this port, it's handled as a TDM interleaved port.
BCM_PORT_ADD_TDM_PORT Indicate a new TDM port.
BCM_PORT_ADD_IF_TDM_ONLY Indicate if the interface will have only TDM ports
BCM_PORT_ADD_IF_TDM_HYBRID Indicate if the interface will have ome TDM ports and some NON-TDM ports
BCM_PORT_ADD_KBP_PORT Inidicate that port is allocated for KBP
BCM_PORT_ADD_STIF_PORT Inidicate that port is allocated for Statistic Interface
BCM_PORT_ADD_RCY_MIRROR_PRIORITY_HIGH Inidicate that the high proirty contex will be allocated for the port
BCM_PORT_ADD_RCY_MIRROR_PRIORITY_NORMAL Inidicate that the normal proirty contex will be allocated for the port
BCM_PORT_ADD_ILKN_OVER_FABRIC_PORT Indicate it is an over fabric port
BCM_PORT_ADD_CROSS_CONNECT Indicate it is a cross connect port

Port interfaces
Flag Meaning
BCM_PORT_IF_SGMII SGMII interface.
BCM_PORT_IF_CAUI CAUI interface.
BCM_PORT_IF_RXAUI RXAUI interface.
BCM_PORT_IF_XFI XFI interface.
BCM_PORT_IF_XLAUI XLAUI interface.
BCM_PORT_IF_ILKN INTERLAKEN interface.
BCM_PORT_IF_XAUI XAUI interface.
BCM_PORT_IF_CPU CPU interface (phy port must be 0).
BCM_PORT_IF_EVENTOR Eventor interface (phy port must be 0).
BCM_PORT_IF_RCY_MIRROR Recycle mirror interface (phy port must be 0).
BCM_PORT_IF_SCH SCH interface.
Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port number.
[out]flags(for "_set") See BCM_PORT_ADD_flags for details.
(for "_get") See BCM_PORT_ADD_flags for details.
[out]interface_info(for "_set") The requested interface configuration.
(for "_get") The requested interface configuration.
[out]mapping_info(for "_set") The requested port mapping configuration.
(for "_get") The requested port mapping configuration.

◆ bcm_port_gport_add()

int bcm_port_gport_add ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  local_port,
bcm_gport_t  modport 
)

Add a GPORT ID for the specified physical port.

This API can be used to add a GPORT ID corresponding to a local port number. The supplied port number should return FALSE on a BCM_GPORT_IS_SET(port) test. The GPORT ID returned in this API is a MODPORT type. Therefore this call will fail on devices without a module ID.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]local_portLocal front panel port number
[in]modportGPORT ID

◆ bcm_port_gport_delete()

int bcm_port_gport_delete ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  local_port,
bcm_gport_t  modport 
)

Del the GPORT ID for the specified physical port.

This API can be used to delete the GPORT ID corresponding to a local port number. The supplied port number should return FALSE on a BCM_GPORT_IS_SET(port) test. The GPORT ID returned in this API is a MODPORT type. Therefore this call will fail on devices without a module ID.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]local_portLocal port number
[in]modportGPORT ID

◆ bcm_port_gport_delete_all()

int bcm_port_gport_delete_all ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  local_port 
)

Delete all the GPORT IDs for the specified physical port.

This API can be used to delete all the GPORT IDs corresponding to a local port number. The supplied port number should return FALSE on a BCM_GPORT_IS_SET(port) test.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]local_portLocal port number

◆ bcm_port_gport_free_range_get()

int bcm_port_gport_free_range_get ( int  unit,
uint32  gport_type,
bcm_gport_t *  gport_min,
bcm_gport_t *  gport_max 
)

Retrieve the minimum and maximum unallocated gport values for a given gport type.

The minimum and maximum unused gports of the requested virtual port type are returned. The full range may have allocated ports within it. Before using any given gport value, bcm_port_gport_is_free must be used to verify that the particular value is available. Supports the same virtual port gport types as bcm_port_gport_is_free .

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]gport_typeOne of BCM_GPORT_TYPE_* or BCM_GPORT_*_PORT values.
[out]gport_minMinimum available gport value of type gport_type
[out]gport_maxMaximum available gport value of type gport_type

◆ bcm_port_gport_get()

int bcm_port_gport_get ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
bcm_gport_t *  gport 
)

Get the GPORT ID for the specified local port number.

This API can be used to get the GPORT ID corresponding to a local port number. The supplied port number should return FALSE on a BCM_GPORT_IS_SET(port) test. The GPORT ID returned in this API is a MODPORT type. Therefore this call will fail on devices without a module ID.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portPort number
[out]gportGPORT ID

◆ bcm_port_gport_get_all()

int bcm_port_gport_get_all ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  local_port,
int  size,
bcm_gport_t *  gport_array,
int *  count 
)

Get all the GPORT ID for the specified physical port.

This API can be used to get all the GPORT IDs corresponding to a local port number. The supplied port number should return FALSE on a BCM_GPORT_IS_SET(port) test. The GPORT IDs returned in this API are all MODPORT type. Therefore this call will fail on devices without a module ID.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]local_portLocal front panel port number
[in]sizeMax size of gport array
[out]gport_arrayGPORT array
[out]countGPORT count

◆ bcm_port_gport_is_free()

int bcm_port_gport_is_free ( int  unit,
bcm_gport_t  gport 
)

Request if the given virtual port gport value is available on the device.

Determine if a specified bcm_gport_t value for a virtual port is currently unused on the device. This allows an application to specify a gport id via the BCM_*_WITH_ID flag while omitting the initial call without the flag. May be used in multi-device systems with variously-sized virtual port capabilities to manage the system gport ids. Virtual port gport types include subport, MPLS, MIM, L2GRE, VXLAN, WLAN, TRILL, VLAN, and NIV on devices which support the specific port type.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]gportGPORT ID.

◆ bcm_port_group_range_get()

int bcm_port_group_range_get ( int  unit,
bcm_port_group_type_t  type,
bcm_port_group_range_t *  range 
)

Get port group range based on port group type.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]typePort group type.
[out]rangePort group range.

◆ bcm_port_ifg_get()

int bcm_port_ifg_get ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
int  speed,
bcm_port_duplex_t  duplex,
int *  bit_times 
)

Get or set the interframe gap settings for the specified port.

By default the device is configured to operate with the appropriate inter-frame gap bit times for all support speeds and duplicities. However, the application may override these values. This will cause the device to operate in a non-standard manner. This routine ensures that the underlying device is able to support the requested inter-frame gap. If the device is unable to support the request, the nearest supported value is selected. bcm_port_ifg_get should be called to retrieve the actual set value.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port number
[in]speedSpeed in Mbps to configure or retrieve the setting for.
[in]duplexDuplex mode to configure or retrieve the settings on; must be one of BCM_PORT_DUPLEX_HALF or BCM_PORT_DUPLEX_FULL
[out]bit_timesThe requested or returned ifg value in bit_times.

◆ bcm_port_ifg_set()

int bcm_port_ifg_set ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
int  speed,
bcm_port_duplex_t  duplex,
int  bit_times 
)

Get or set the interframe gap settings for the specified port.

By default the device is configured to operate with the appropriate inter-frame gap bit times for all support speeds and duplicities. However, the application may override these values. This will cause the device to operate in a non-standard manner. This routine ensures that the underlying device is able to support the requested inter-frame gap. If the device is unable to support the request, the nearest supported value is selected. bcm_port_ifg_get should be called to retrieve the actual set value.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port number
[in]speedSpeed in Mbps to configure or retrieve the setting for.
[in]duplexDuplex mode to configure or retrieve the settings on; must be one of BCM_PORT_DUPLEX_HALF or BCM_PORT_DUPLEX_FULL
[in]bit_timesThe requested or returned ifg value in bit_times.

◆ bcm_port_ifilter_get()

int bcm_port_ifilter_get ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
int *  mode 
)

Set or retrieve current behavior of tagged packets arriving on a port not a member of the specified VLAN.

If ingress filtering is enabled, this drops all packets arriving on a port with a VLAN tag identifying a VLAN of which the port is not a member. If disabled, packets will not be dropped if the port is not a member of the VLAN specified in the packet. It may however be dropped for other reasons such as spanning tree state, or head of line blocking. This function is superseded by bcm_port_vlan_member_get . Valid settings for mode are described in table BCM_PORT_IFILTER_MODE_table .

Port IFilter Modes
IFilter Mode Meaning
BCM_PORT_IFILTER_OFF Ingress filtering is disabled
BCM_PORT_IFILTER_ON Ingress filtering is enabled
Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port number
[out]modePort filtering mode

◆ bcm_port_ifilter_set()

int bcm_port_ifilter_set ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
int  mode 
)

Set or retrieve current behavior of tagged packets arriving on a port not a member of the specified VLAN.

If ingress filtering is enabled, this drops all packets arriving on a port with a VLAN tag identifying a VLAN of which the port is not a member. If disabled, packets will not be dropped if the port is not a member of the VLAN specified in the packet. It may however be dropped for other reasons such as spanning tree state, or head of line blocking. This function is superseded by bcm_port_vlan_member_get . Valid settings for mode are described in table BCM_PORT_IFILTER_MODE_table .

Port IFilter Modes
IFilter Mode Meaning
BCM_PORT_IFILTER_OFF Ingress filtering is disabled
BCM_PORT_IFILTER_ON Ingress filtering is enabled
Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port number
[in]modePort filtering mode

◆ bcm_port_ilkn_lane_map_get()

int bcm_port_ilkn_lane_map_get ( int  unit,
int  flags,
bcm_port_t  port,
int  num_of_lanes,
int *  lanes 
)

Get the order of the ILKN lanes for ILKN ports. Each index in lanes[] array stands for ILKN lane ID. The values of lanes[] array is the NIF/Fabric lanes mapped to ILKN logical lane.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]flags
[in]port
[in]num_of_lanes
[out]lanes

◆ bcm_port_ilkn_lane_map_set()

int bcm_port_ilkn_lane_map_set ( int  unit,
int  flags,
bcm_port_t  port,
int  num_of_lanes,
int *  lanes 
)

This API is used to configure the order of the ILKN lanes. Each index in lanes[] array stands for ILKN lane ID. The values of lanes[] array is the NIF/Fabric lanes mapped to ILKN logical lane.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]flags
[in]port
[in]num_of_lanes
[in]lanes

◆ bcm_port_info_get()

int bcm_port_info_get ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
bcm_port_info_t *  info 
)

Get or set multiple port characteristics.

bcm_port_info_get and bcm_port_info_set get and set all valid settings for the specific device and port in question. For these calls the action_mask field of the bcm_port_info_t structure is ignored on entry, but defined to contain the valid action mask bits on return. For all set operations, if both auto-negotiation is enabled and the speed or duplex are forced to a specific setting, the result is undefined. bcm_port_selective_get and bcm_port_selective_set operate similar to bcm_port_info_get and bcm_port_info_set with the exception that action_mask is used to determine which attributes to set or retrieve. bcm_port_info_save and bcm_port_info_restore provide a mechanism to save all valid port state and restore it later. The info parameter to bcm_port_info_save must be passed unaltered to bcm_port_info_restore to restore the previous port state. Any changes to the info structure results in undefined behavior. In the case of setting or restoring port configuration, if the API call returns an error the port state is undefined. Other than as is required for proper functionality, the order is which the configuration options are applied is undefined. Similarly when retrieving options, if an error is returned the entire contents of the info structure are undefined. For example, all three implementations of the function sample_port_speed_get below perform the same function.

#include <bcm/port.h>
// Sample port_speed_get that calls the bcm_port_speed_get function directly.
int
sample_port_speed_get(int unit, bcm_port_t port)
{
int speed;
if (bcm_port_speed_get(unit, port, &speed) != BCM_E_NONE) {
return -1;
} else {
return speed;
}
}

is functionally equivalent to:

#include <bcm/port.h>
// Sample port speed get function that calls the bcm_port_selective_get function.
int
sample_port_speed_get(int unit, bcm_port_t port)
{
bcm_port_info_t info;
info.action_mask = BCM_PORT_ATTR_SPEED_MASK;
if (bcm_port_selective_get(unit, port, &info) != BCM_E_NONE) {
return -1;
} else {
return info.speed;
}
}

While similar to the previous two example, there is one significant difference in the follow sample: All port information is recovered, so if a failure occurs retrieving any of the values, the operation is aborted. In this case, the speed value is undefined.

#include <bcm/port.h>
// Sample port speed get function that calls the bcm_port_info_get function.
int
sample_port_speed_get(int unit, bcm_port_t port)
{
bcm_port_info_t info;
if (bcm_port_info_get(unit, port, &info) != BCM_E_NONE) {
return -1;
} else {
return info.speed;
}
}
Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port number
[in,out]infoPointer to port information structure (see Port Information Control Structure (bcm_port_info_t)).

◆ bcm_port_info_restore()

int bcm_port_info_restore ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
bcm_port_info_t *  info 
)

Get or set multiple port characteristics.

bcm_port_info_get and bcm_port_info_set get and set all valid settings for the specific device and port in question. For these calls the action_mask field of the bcm_port_info_t structure is ignored on entry, but defined to contain the valid action mask bits on return. For all set operations, if both auto-negotiation is enabled and the speed or duplex are forced to a specific setting, the result is undefined. bcm_port_selective_get and bcm_port_selective_set operate similar to bcm_port_info_get and bcm_port_info_set with the exception that action_mask is used to determine which attributes to set or retrieve. bcm_port_info_save and bcm_port_info_restore provide a mechanism to save all valid port state and restore it later. The info parameter to bcm_port_info_save must be passed unaltered to bcm_port_info_restore to restore the previous port state. Any changes to the info structure results in undefined behavior. In the case of setting or restoring port configuration, if the API call returns an error the port state is undefined. Other than as is required for proper functionality, the order is which the configuration options are applied is undefined. Similarly when retrieving options, if an error is returned the entire contents of the info structure are undefined. For example, all three implementations of the function sample_port_speed_get below perform the same function.

#include <bcm/port.h>
// Sample port_speed_get that calls the bcm_port_speed_get function directly.
int
sample_port_speed_get(int unit, bcm_port_t port)
{
int speed;
if (bcm_port_speed_get(unit, port, &speed) != BCM_E_NONE) {
return -1;
} else {
return speed;
}
}

is functionally equivalent to:

#include <bcm/port.h>
// Sample port speed get function that calls the bcm_port_selective_get function.
int
sample_port_speed_get(int unit, bcm_port_t port)
{
bcm_port_info_t info;
info.action_mask = BCM_PORT_ATTR_SPEED_MASK;
if (bcm_port_selective_get(unit, port, &info) != BCM_E_NONE) {
return -1;
} else {
return info.speed;
}
}

While similar to the previous two example, there is one significant difference in the follow sample: All port information is recovered, so if a failure occurs retrieving any of the values, the operation is aborted. In this case, the speed value is undefined.

#include <bcm/port.h>
// Sample port speed get function that calls the bcm_port_info_get function.
int
sample_port_speed_get(int unit, bcm_port_t port)
{
bcm_port_info_t info;
if (bcm_port_info_get(unit, port, &info) != BCM_E_NONE) {
return -1;
} else {
return info.speed;
}
}
Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port number
[in]infoPointer to port information structure (see Port Information Control Structure (bcm_port_info_t)).

◆ bcm_port_info_save()

int bcm_port_info_save ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
bcm_port_info_t *  info 
)

Get or set multiple port characteristics.

bcm_port_info_get and bcm_port_info_set get and set all valid settings for the specific device and port in question. For these calls the action_mask field of the bcm_port_info_t structure is ignored on entry, but defined to contain the valid action mask bits on return. In the case of setting or restoring port configuration, if the API call returns an error the port state is undefined. Other than as is required for proper functionality, the order is which the configuration options are applied is undefined. Similarly when retrieving options, if an error is returned the entire contents of the info structure are undefined. return -1;
} else {
return info.speed;
}

sample_port_speed_get(int unit, bcm_port_t port)

◆ bcm_port_info_set()

int bcm_port_info_set ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
bcm_port_info_t *  info 
)

Get or set multiple port characteristics.

bcm_port_info_get and bcm_port_info_set get and set all valid settings for the specific device and port in question. For these calls the action_mask field of the bcm_port_info_t structure is ignored on entry, but defined to contain the valid action mask bits on return. The info parameter to bcm_port_info_save must be passed unaltered to bcm_port_info_restore to restore the previous port state. Any changes to the info structure results in undefined behavior. In the case of setting or restoring port configuration, if the API call returns an error the port state is undefined. ◆ bcm_port_info_t_init()

void bcm_port_info_t_init ( bcm_port_info_t *  info)

Initializes the bcm_port_info_t structure.

Parameters
[in,out]infoPointer to port information structure (see Port Information Control Structure (bcm_port_info_t)).

◆ bcm_port_ingress_tdm_failover_get()

int bcm_port_ingress_tdm_failover_get ( int  unit,
int  flag,
bcm_pbmp_t *  tdm_enable_pbmp 
)

Get the list of enabled TDM ports.

Retrieve all ports that allow TDM traffic to ingress the device. TDM traffic on any other port will be dropped. Modifying the set of TDM-enabled ports can be used for fast protection-switching of TDM traffic.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]flagfor future use
[out]tdm_enable_pbmp

◆ bcm_port_ingress_tdm_failover_set()

int bcm_port_ingress_tdm_failover_set ( int  unit,
int  flag,
bcm_pbmp_t  tdm_enable_pbmp 
)

Set the list of enabled TDM ports.

Configure all ports that allow TDM traffic to ingress the device. TDM traffic on any other port will be dropped. Modifying the set of TDM-enabled ports can be used for fast protection-switching of TDM traffic.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]flagfor future use
[in]tdm_enable_pbmp

◆ bcm_port_init()

int bcm_port_init ( int  unit)

Initialize the port subsystem.

In initializes the port API subsystem. Initialization includes probing the types of ports on the unit, as well as any external phys. Internally PHY drivers are attached for the known found devices. The initial configuration of the port and PHY state can be controlled through driver run-time configuration properties (see bcm_port_settings_init). All port specific operating modes are placed in a known good state. Port initialization performs the following actions, but not all actions are supported on all chips:

  • Default VLAN for untagged packets is set to 1 (see bcm_port_untagged_vlan_set)
  • Ingress Filtering is disabled (see bcm_port_vlan_member_set)
  • Port egress blocking is disabled (see bcm_port_egress_set)
  • Ports are probed for external PHYs (see bcm_port_probe)
  • The port MAC and PHY are initialized
  • The port is enabled (see bcm_port_enable_set) This routine should only be called as part of initialization. The results of calling this function after configuring a switch are undefined.
Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.

◆ bcm_port_inner_tpid_get()

int bcm_port_inner_tpid_get ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
uint16 *  tpid 
)

Set the default tag protocol ID (TPID) for the specified port.

Set the default tag protocol IDs for the inner and outer tags for double-tagging mode. Not all chips can control both tags. If the "port" parameter is SubTag subport group gport then set the default SubTag tag protocol ID for the subport group. For BCM5645x all logical SubTag subport groups under a given physical port will have same default SubTag tag protocol ID.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port number
[out]tpidTag protocol ID

◆ bcm_port_inner_tpid_set()

int bcm_port_inner_tpid_set ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
uint16  tpid 
)

Set the default tag protocol ID (TPID) for the specified port.

Set the default tag protocol IDs for the inner and outer tags for double-tagging mode. Not all chips can control both tags. If the "port" parameter is SubTag subport group gport then set the default SubTag tag protocol ID for the subport group. For BCM5645x all logical SubTag subport groups under a given physical port will have same default SubTag tag protocol ID.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port number
[in]tpidTag protocol ID

◆ bcm_port_interface_config_get()

int bcm_port_interface_config_get ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
bcm_port_interface_config_t *  config 
)

Configure or retrieve port interface configuration.

Allows for dynamic NIF port configuration changes. Calling bcm_port_interface_config_set must be done on detached ports.

bcm_port_interface_config_t
Field Type Description
flags uint32 flags of port
channel uint32 channel of port
phy_port uint32 related physical port (first physical port for multi-lane interfaces)
interface bcm_port_if_t interface of port (use BCM_PORT_IF_NULL to remove all port configurations)
Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port number
[out]config(for "_set") The requested interface configuration
(for "_get") The retrieved interface configuration

◆ bcm_port_interface_config_set()

bcm_port_t  port,
bcm_port_interface_config_t *  config

◆ bcm_port_interface_get()

int bcm_port_interface_get ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
bcm_port_if_t *  intf 
)

Configure the physical interface between the MAC and the PHY for the specified port.

Provides ability to change the physical interface used between the MAC in the switch device and the PHY. Under normal conditions this setting will be configured during port initialization and should not change. This function is provided for diagnostic purposes only. For information on initial physical interface settings, see PORT_INTERFACE_table . Changing the port interface forces linkscan to recognize a link down event. The valid values for intf are described in table PORT_INTERFACE_table .

Port Interface Values
BCM_PORT_IF_NOCXN PHY is de-initialized or hot swapped. Link status is always returned as 0.
BCM_PORT_IF_NULL Used for directly connect ports where no PHY is present.
BCM_PORT_IF_MII MII Operating mode, not supported on all ports.
BCM_PORT_IF_GMII GMII Operating mode, not supported on all ports.
BCM_PORT_IF_SGMII SGMII operating mode, only supported on Gigabit Ethernet ports with integrated SerDes.
BCM_PORT_IF_TBI TBI interface supported on Gigabit Ethernet ports operating at gigabit speeds.
BCM_PORT_IF_XGMII 10-Gigabit interface.
BCM_PORT_IF_RGMII Reduced Gigabit Media Independent Interface.
BCM_PORT_IF_SFI SFI 10-Gigabit serial electrical interface.
BCM_PORT_IF_XFI XFI 10-Gigabit serial electrical interface.
BCM_PORT_IF_KX Backplane 1 GbE copper interface.
BCM_PORT_IF_KR Backplane 10 GbE 64B/66B interface.
BCM_PORT_IF_KR2 Backplane 2x10GbE 64B/66B interface
BCM_PORT_IF_KR4 Backplane 4x10 GbE 64B/66B interface.
BCM_PORT_IF_CR Copper 10 GbE 64B/66B interface.
BCM_PORT_IF_CR2 Backplane 2x10GbE 64B/66B interface
BCM_PORT_IF_CR4 Copper 4x10 GbE 64B/66B interface.
BCM_PORT_IF_XLAUI 40 Gigabit Attachment Unit Interface.
BCM_PORT_IF_XLAUI2 40 Gigabit Attachment Unit Interface over 2 lanes.
BCM_PORT_IF_SR Fiber SR/LR 64B/66B interface.
BCM_PORT_IF_ZR Fiber ZR 64B/66B interface.
BCM_PORT_IF_SR2 Fiber 2x10GbE 64B/66B interface
BCM_PORT_IF_SR4 Fiber SR4 64B/66B interface.
BCM_PORT_IF_LR4 Fiber LR4 64B/66B interface.
BCM_PORT_IF_SR10 Fiber SR10 64B/66B interface.
BCM_PORT_IF_CR10 Copper CR10 64B/66B interface.
BCM_PORT_IF_KR10 Backplane KR10 64B/66B interface.
BCM_PORT_IF_LR10 Fiber LR10 64B/66B interface.
BCM_PORT_IF_OTL Fiber 4x25 GbE OTL interface.
BCM_PORT_IF_ER Fiber ER 64B/66B interface.
BCM_PORT_IF_ER2 Fiber ER2 2x10G 64B/66B interface.
BCM_PORT_IF_ER4 Fiber ER4 4x10G 64B/66B interface.
BCM_PORT_IF_VSR Fiber VSR 10G 64B/66B interface.
BCM_PORT_IF_CX Copper 10G 10B/8B interface.
BCM_PORT_IF_CX2 Copper 2x10G 10B/8B interface.
BCM_PORT_IF_CX4 Copper 4x10G 10B/8B interface.
BCM_PORT_IF_CAUI_C2C CAUI 100G C2C interface.
BCM_PORT_IF_CAUI_C2M CAUI 100G C2M interface.
BCM_PORT_IF_LR2 Fiber 2x10G 64B/66B interface.
BCM_PORT_IF_LRM Fiber multimode 64B/66B interface.
BCM_PORT_IF_XLPPI 40G parallel physical interface.
BCM_PORT_IF_LBG Link bonding interface
BCM_PORT_IF_CAUI4 CAUI4 100G interface.
BCM_PORT_IF_NIF_ETH Used for all NIF interfaces
Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port number
[out]intfInterface to configure or retrieved interface setting.

◆ bcm_port_interface_set()

bcm_port_t  port,
bcm_port_if_t  intf 
)

Configure the physical interface between the MAC and the PHY for the specified port.

Provides ability to change the physical interface used between the MAC in the switch device and the PHY. Under normal conditions this setting will be configured during port initialization and should not change. This function is provided for diagnostic purposes only. For information on initial physical interface settings, see PORT_INTERFACE_table . Changing the port interface forces linkscan to recognize a link down event. The valid values for intf are described in table PORT_INTERFACE_table .

Port Interface Values
BCM_PORT_IF_NOCXN PHY is de-initialized or hot swapped. Link status is always returned as 0.
BCM_PORT_IF_NULL Used for directly connect ports where no PHY is present.
BCM_PORT_IF_MII MII Operating mode, not supported on all ports.
BCM_PORT_IF_GMII GMII Operating mode, not supported on all ports.

BCM_PORT_IF_ZR Fiber ZR 64B/66B interface.
BCM_PORT_IF_SR2 Fiber 2x10GbE 64B/66B interface
BCM_PORT_IF_SR4 Fiber SR4 64B/66B interface.
BCM_PORT_IF_LR4 Fiber LR4 64B/66B interface.
BCM_PORT_IF_SR10 Fiber SR10 64B/66B interface.
BCM_PORT_IF_CR10 Copper CR10 64B/66B interface.
BCM_PORT_IF_KR10 Backplane KR10 64B/66B interface.
BCM_PORT_IF_LR10 Fiber LR10 64B/66B interface.
BCM_PORT_IF_OTL Fiber 4x25 GbE OTL interface.
BCM_PORT_IF_ER Fiber ER 64B/66B interface.
BCM_PORT_IF_ER2 Fiber ER2 2x10G 64B/66B interface.
BCM_PORT_IF_ER4 Fiber ER4 4x10G 64B/66B interface.
BCM_PORT_IF_VSR Fiber VSR 10G 64B/66B interface.
BCM_PORT_IF_CX Copper 10G 10B/8B interface.
BCM_PORT_IF_CX2 Copper 2x10G 10B/8B interface.
BCM_PORT_IF_CX4 Copper 4x10G 10B/8B interface.
BCM_PORT_IF_CAUI_C2C CAUI 100G C2C interface.
BCM_PORT_IF_CAUI_C2M CAUI 100G C2M interface.
BCM_PORT_IF_LR2 Fiber 2x10G 64B/66B interface.
BCM_PORT_IF_LRM Fiber multimode 64B/66B interface.
BCM_PORT_IF_XLPPI 40G parallel physical interface.
BCM_PORT_IF_LBG Link bonding interface
BCM_PORT_IF_CAUI4 CAUI4 100G interface.

◆ bcm_port_internal_get()

int bcm_port_internal_get ( int  unit,
uint32  flags,
int  internal_ports_max,
bcm_gport_t *  internal_gport,
int *  internal_ports_count 
)

Get handles to internal ports.

This API is used to retrieve the internal port handles

Internal Port Flags
Flag Meaning
BCM_PORT_INTERNAL_EGRESS_REPLICATION Egress replication port
BCM_PORT_INTERNAL_OLP Off-load processor port
BCM_PORT_INTERNAL_RECYCLE Recycling port
BCM_PORT_INTERNAL_CONF_SCOPE_CORE0 core 0 indication
BCM_PORT_INTERNAL_CONF_SCOPE_CORE1 core 1 indication
Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]flagsflags
[in]internal_ports_maxmaximum handles that can be retrieved
[out]internal_gportgport handles to ports
[out]internal_ports_countnumber of internal ports retrieved

◆ bcm_port_ipmc_modify_get()

int bcm_port_ipmc_modify_get ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
uint32 *  flags 
)

Get or set the L3 multicast packet modification operations of a port.

Enable or disable the various packet modification operations on L3 multicast packets based on the egress port of the packet. Packet modifications that can be enabled or disabled are:

  • Source MAC address
  • TTL
  • TTL check The flags can be bitmapped and are defined as follows: PORT_IPMC_MODS_v .
    Bitmap Definitions
    BCM_PORT_IPMC_MODIFY_NO_SRCMAC Disable source MAC Modification
    BCM_PORT_IPMC_MODIFY_NO_TTL Disable TTL Modification
    BCM_PORT_IPMC_CHECK_NO_TTL Disable TTL Check
Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port number
[out]flagsBitmap of the packet modifications.

◆ bcm_port_ipmc_modify_set()

int bcm_port_ipmc_modify_set ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
uint32  flags 
)

Get or set the L3 multicast packet modification operations of a port.

Enable or disable the various packet modification operations on L3 multicast packets based on the egress port of the packet. Packet modifications that can be enabled or disabled are:

  • Source MAC address
  • TTL
  • TTL check The flags can be bitmapped and are defined as follows: PORT_IPMC_MODS_v .
    Bitmap Definitions
    BCM_PORT_IPMC_MODIFY_NO_SRCMAC Disable source MAC Modification
    BCM_PORT_IPMC_MODIFY_NO_TTL Disable TTL Modification
    BCM_PORT_IPMC_CHECK_NO_TTL Disable TTL Check
Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port number
[in]flagsBitmap of the packet modifications.

◆ bcm_port_jam_get()

int bcm_port_jam_get ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
int *  enable 
)

Get or set half-duplex flow control (jam) for a port.

Half-duplex flow control (also known as jamming) is configured independent of full-duplex flow control controlled by bcm_port_pause_set . When enabled, the specified port will jam the link to flow control the incoming traffic. This setting will be in affect when ever the port is operating in half-duplex mode (either as a result of auto-negotiation or by forcing the duplex with bcm_port_duplex_set). Jamming may be enabled or disabled at any time, and will only affect operation when the port is in half-duplex mode. The configuration of jamming is persistent across link events and all other port configuration calls (with the exception of bcm_port_init). By default, jamming is disabled.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port number
[out]enableCurrent jam setting being retrieved or configured; 0 for disable and 1 for enable.

◆ bcm_port_jam_set()

int bcm_port_jam_set ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
int  enable 
)

Get or set half-duplex flow control (jam) for a port.

Half-duplex flow control (also known as jamming) is configured independent of full-duplex flow control controlled by bcm_port_pause_set . When enabled, the specified port will jam the link to flow control the incoming traffic. This setting will be in affect when ever the port is operating in half-duplex mode (either as a result of auto-negotiation or by forcing the duplex with bcm_port_duplex_set). Jamming may be enabled or disabled at any time, and will only affect operation when the port is in half-duplex mode. The configuration of jamming is persistent across link events and all other port configuration calls (with the exception of bcm_port_init). By default, jamming is disabled.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port number
[in]enableCurrent jam setting being retrieved or configured; 0 for disable and 1 for enable.

◆ bcm_port_l3_enable_get()

int bcm_port_l3_enable_get ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
int *  enable 
)

Enable or disable l3 switching on an ingress port.

The L3 switching of packets can be enabled and disabled on a per port basis. Ports with L3 switching disabled will not perform L3 lookups on ingressing packets. Instead the packet will be treated as an L2 packet. Not all devices support L3 switching. The current L3 state of the specified port can be retrieved using bcm_port_l3_enable_get.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port number
[out]enableTRUE (1) to enable L3 switching, FALSE (0) to disable

◆ bcm_port_l3_enable_set()

int bcm_port_l3_enable_set ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
int  enable 
)

Enable or disable l3 switching on an ingress port.

The L3 switching of packets can be enabled and disabled on a per port basis. Ports with L3 switching disabled will not perform L3 lookups on ingressing packets. Instead the packet will be treated as an L2 packet. Not all devices support L3 switching. The current L3 state of the specified port can be retrieved using bcm_port_l3_enable_get.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port number
[in]enableTRUE (1) to enable L3 switching, FALSE (0) to disable

◆ bcm_port_l3_encapsulated_mtu_get()

int bcm_port_l3_encapsulated_mtu_get ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
int *  size 
)

Set or retrieve the current maximum encapsulated L3 packet size permitted on a port (Link-Layer MTU).

Set or retrieve the current maximum egress encapsulated L3 frame size for the specified port. When setting the frame size on a port, it is the callers responsibility to take into account any additional tags or CRC that may be added by the switch device.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portPort to set or retrieve maximum L3 frame size on
[out]sizethe frame size to set (or current frame size returned) in bytes.

◆ bcm_port_l3_encapsulated_mtu_set()

int bcm_port_l3_encapsulated_mtu_set ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
int  size 
)

Set or retrieve the current maximum encapsulated L3 packet size permitted on a port (Link-Layer MTU).

Set or retrieve the current maximum egress encapsulated L3 frame size for the specified port. When setting the frame size on a port, it is the callers responsibility to take into account any additional tags or CRC that may be added by the switch device.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portPort to set or retrieve maximum L3 frame size on
[in]sizethe frame size to set (or current frame size returned) in bytes.

◆ bcm_port_l3_modify_get()

int bcm_port_l3_modify_get ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
uint32 *  flags 
)

Get or set the L3 unicast packet modification operations of a port.

Enable or disable the various packet modification operations on L3 unicast packets based on the ingress port of the packet. Packet modifications that can be enabled or disabled are:

  • Source MAC address
  • Destination MAC Address
  • TTL
  • VLAN ID The flags can be bitmapped and are defined as follows: PORT_L3_UC_MODS_v .
    Bitmap Definitions
    BCM_PORT_L3_MODIFY_NO_SRCMAC Disable source MAC Modification
    BCM_PORT_L3_MODIFY_NO_DSTMAC Disable destination MAC Modification
    BCM_PORT_L3_MODIFY_NO_TTL Disable TTL Modification
    BCM_PORT_L3_MODIFY_NO_VLAN Disable VLAN ID Modification
Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port number
[out]flagsBitmap of the packet modifications.

◆ bcm_port_l3_modify_set()

int bcm_port_l3_modify_set ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
uint32  flags 
)

Get or set the L3 unicast packet modification operations of a port.

Enable or disable the various packet modification operations on L3 unicast packets based on the ingress port of the packet. Packet modifications that can be enabled or disabled are:

  • Source MAC address
  • Destination MAC Address
  • TTL
  • VLAN ID The flags can be bitmapped and are defined as follows: PORT_L3_UC_MODS_v .
    Bitmap Definitions
    BCM_PORT_L3_MODIFY_NO_SRCMAC Disable source MAC Modification
    BCM_PORT_L3_MODIFY_NO_DSTMAC Disable destination MAC Modification
    BCM_PORT_L3_MODIFY_NO_TTL Disable TTL Modification
    BCM_PORT_L3_MODIFY_NO_VLAN Disable VLAN ID Modification
Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port number
[in]flagsBitmap of the packet modifications.

◆ bcm_port_l3_mtu_get()

int bcm_port_l3_mtu_get ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
int *  size 
)

Set or retrieve the current maximum L3 packet size permitted on a port.

Set or retrieve the current maximum egress L3 frame size for the specified port. When setting the frame size on a port, it is the callers responsibility to take into account any additional tags or CRC that may be added by the switch device. For front-panel ports (that is, non-stacking or HiGig ports), setting the maximum egress L3 frame size to X indicates untagged packets of length X are permitted, while tagged packets of X + 4 bytes are permitted.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portPort to set or retrieve maximum L3 frame size on
[out]sizethe frame size to set (or current frame size returned) in bytes.

◆ bcm_port_l3_mtu_set()

int bcm_port_l3_mtu_set ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
int  size 
)

Set or retrieve the current maximum L3 packet size permitted on a port.

Set or retrieve the current maximum egress L3 frame size for the specified port. When setting the frame size on a port, it is the callers responsibility to take into account any additional tags or CRC that may be added by the switch device. For front-panel ports (that is, non-stacking or HiGig ports), setting the maximum egress L3 frame size to X indicates untagged packets of length X are permitted, while tagged packets of X + 4 bytes are permitted.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portPort to set or retrieve maximum L3 frame size on
[in]sizethe frame size to set (or current frame size returned) in bytes.

◆ bcm_port_lane_to_serdes_map_get()

int bcm_port_lane_to_serdes_map_get ( int  unit,
int  flags,
int  map_size,
bcm_port_lane_to_serdes_map_t *  serdes_map 
)

Map lanes to serdeses.

The API receive all lanes configuration at once. Location in the array represent the lane number (e.g. serdes_map[x] holds the information for lane=x).

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]flags
[in]map_size
[out]serdes_map

◆ bcm_port_lane_to_serdes_map_set()

int bcm_port_lane_to_serdes_map_set ( int  unit,
int  flags,
int  map_size,
bcm_port_lane_to_serdes_map_t *  serdes_map 
)

Map lanes to serdeses.

The API receive all lanes configuration at once. Location in the array represent the lane number (e.g. serdes_map[x] holds the information for lane=x).

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]flags
[in]map_size
[in]serdes_map

◆ bcm_port_learn_get()

int bcm_port_learn_get ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
uint32 *  flags 
)

Control the hardware and software learning support on a port.

The learning mode configures what set of actions are taken by the device when an unknown source address is recognized on an ingressing packet. Each of the learning options can be configured independently, however the underlying switch device may not support all combinations. The possible learning modes are described in BCM_PORT_LEARN_table . bcm_port_learn_set and bcm_port_learn_get get and set the current learning mode based on the flags parameter. bcm_port_learn_modify allows learning options to be removed and or added based on the add and remove parameters.

Port Learn Modes
Mode Meaning
BCM_PORT_LEARN_ARL Device learns source addresses automatically
BCM_PORT_LEARN_CPU Packets with unknown source addresses are copied to the CPU
BCM_PORT_LEARN_FWD Packets with unknown source addresses are switched by the device
BCM_PORT_LEARN_PENDING Automatically learned source addresses are marked as pending

If the BCM_PORT_LEARN_CPU flag is specified, then copies of packets with unknown source addresses are sent to the CPU. On some StrataXGS?III devices, it is possible to enable an L2 pending cache to reduce copies of packets to the CPU. When the flags BCM_PORT_LEARN_ARL and BCM_PORT_LEARN_PENDING are specified, the device learns source addresses automatically and marks them as "pending". For packets with a source address matching a pending entry, copies to the CPU are suppressed. For packets with a destination address matching a pending entry, the lookup results in a destination lookup failure (DLF). The application must validate pending entries by explicitly adding the L2 address with bcm_l2_addr_add . By default, the learning mode is the same for a new address and an address that has already been learned on a different ingress port (station movement). For devices that support a separate learning mode for station movement, the port controls bcmPortControlL2Learn and bcmPortControlL2Move can be used for individual control of the two learning modes.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port
[out]flagsLearning flags as defined in table BCM_PORT_LEARN_table

◆ bcm_port_learn_modify()

int bcm_port_learn_modify ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
uint32  add,
uint32  remove 
)

Control the hardware and software learning support on a port.

The learning mode configures what set of actions are taken by the device when an unknown source address is recognized on an ingressing packet. Each of the learning options can be configured independently, however the underlying switch device may not support all combinations. The possible learning modes are described in BCM_PORT_LEARN_table . bcm_port_learn_set and bcm_port_learn_get get and set the current learning mode based on the flags parameter. bcm_port_learn_modify allows learning options to be removed and or added based on the add and remove parameters.

Port Learn Modes
Mode Meaning
BCM_PORT_LEARN_ARL Device learns source addresses automatically
BCM_PORT_LEARN_CPU Packets with unknown source addresses are copied to the CPU
BCM_PORT_LEARN_FWD Packets with unknown source addresses are switched by the device
BCM_PORT_LEARN_PENDING Automatically learned source addresses are marked as pending

If the BCM_PORT_LEARN_CPU flag is specified, then copies of packets with unknown source addresses are sent to the CPU. On some StrataXGS?III devices, it is possible to enable an L2 pending cache to reduce copies of packets to the CPU. When the flags BCM_PORT_LEARN_ARL and BCM_PORT_LEARN_PENDING are specified, the device learns source addresses automatically and marks them as "pending". For packets with a source address matching a pending entry, copies to the CPU are suppressed. For packets with a destination address matching a pending entry, the lookup results in a destination lookup failure (DLF). The application must validate pending entries by explicitly adding the L2 address with bcm_l2_addr_add . By default, the learning mode is the same for a new address and an address that has already been learned on a different ingress port (station movement). For devices that support a separate learning mode for station movement, the port controls bcmPortControlL2Learn and bcmPortControlL2Move can be used for individual control of the two learning modes.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port
[in]addLearning modes to add to the current learning port state
[in]removeLearning modes to remove from the current learning port state

◆ bcm_port_learn_set()

int bcm_port_learn_set ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
uint32  flags 
)

Control the hardware and software learning support on a port.

The learning mode configures what set of actions are taken by the device when an unknown source address is recognized on an ingressing packet. Each of the learning options can be configured independently, however the underlying switch device may not support all combinations. Port Learn Modes
Mode Meaning
BCM_PORT_LEARN_ARL Device learns source addresses automatically
BCM_PORT_LEARN_CPU Packets with unknown source addresses are copied to the CPU
BCM_PORT_LEARN_FWD Packets with unknown source addresses are switched by the device
BCM_PORT_LEARN_PENDING Automatically learned source addresses are marked as pending

If the BCM_PORT_LEARN_CPU flag is specified, then copies of packets with unknown source addresses are sent to the CPU. On some StrataXGS?III devices, it is possible to enable an L2 pending cache to reduce copies of packets to the CPU. When the flags BCM_PORT_LEARN_ARL and BCM_PORT_LEARN_PENDING are specified, the device learns source addresses automatically and marks them as "pending". For packets with a source address matching a pending entry, copies to the CPU are suppressed. For packets with a destination address matching a pending entry, the lookup results in a destination lookup failure (DLF). The application must validate pending entries by explicitly adding the L2 address with bcm_l2_addr_add . For devices that support a separate learning mode for station movement, the port controls bcmPortControlL2Learn and bcmPortControlL2Move can be used for individual control of the two learning modes.
