◆ bcm_port_phy_firmware_set()

int bcm_port_phy_firmware_set ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
uint32  flags,
int  offset,
uint8 *  array,
int  length 
)

Set the given firmware to the PHY's non-volatile storage device.

Set the given firmware to the PHY's non-volatile storage device. This API invokes the underlining PHY driver's firmware set routine. If it is not supported by the driver, then no action will be taken.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port number
[in]flagsBitwise flags. Specify BCM_PORT_PHY_INTERNAL to select internal PHY, otherwise external PHY
[in]offsetOffset from the start of PHY's Non-Volatile storage device to program
[in]arrayPoint to the firmware data buffer
[in]lengthThe length of the data buffer

◆ bcm_port_phy_get()

int bcm_port_phy_get ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
uint32  flags,
uint32  phy_reg_addr,
uint32 *  phy_data 
)

Read or write PHY registers associated with a port.

Most PHY-related operations are performed automatically by the API to satisfy requests. When direct access to the PHY registers are required for diagnostic purposes or special configuration these functions can be used. Use of these routines may interfere with the normal operation of the API, extreme care must be taken when manipulating PHYs. Normal configuration of speed, duplicity, and auto-negotiation must be performed using the normal bcm_port APIs. It allows to select the lane in the PHY register access through gport lane selection.

Port PHY Flags
Flag Meaning
BCM_PORT_PHY_INTERNAL Address the PHY registers associated with the internal SerDes for the specified port. This option is invalid for ports that do not have an internal SerDes.
BCM_PORT_PHY_NOMAP Do not translate the port number into a PHY address. Use the port number directly as an MDIO address. If this option is specified, then the BCM_PORT_PHY_INTERNAL flag is ignored.
BCM_PORT_PHY_CLAUSE45 Access the PHY as a clause 45 device. If this option is not specified Clause 22 is used.
BCM_PORT_PHY_I2C_DATA8 Access 8-bit BSC device connected on the PHY device's MDIO-BSC bridge interface. Check if your PHY device has this interface before using this option.
BCM_PORT_PHY_I2C_DATA16 Access 16-bit BSC device connected on the PHY device's MDIO-BSC bridge interface. Check if your PHY device has this interface before using this option.
BCM_PORT_PHY_PVT_DATA Access Phy Internal registers/memories. Implementation is private to each phy. Check if your PHY device has this interface before using this option.
BCM_PORT_PHY_BROADCAST_WRITE Broadcast write transactions to all MDIO buses within one unit. All the ports that have the same phy address as the specified port will receive the write command. This options is valid for CMICx MDIO interface.

PHY Register Type Flags
Flag Meaning
BCM_PORT_PHY_REG_1000X The address specified is in 1000X or primary SerDes block.

Additional defines located in <bcm/port.h> may be used to form and extract shadow register address, Clause 45 MDIO device, BSC device and register addresses. See BCM_PORT_PHY_REG_INDIRECT_ADDR, BCM_PORT_PHY_CLAUSE45_ADDR and BCM_PORT_PHY_I2C_ADDR for details. The following commented code examples demonstrate the use of these APIs. All APIs assume a valid value for unit and port. For more examples, refer to the corresponding PHY header files in $SDK/src/soc/phy/ directory.

// Write 0x1111 to PHY register 4 on the external PHY connected to port.
rv = bcm_port_phy_set(unit, port, 0, 4, 0x1111);
// Write 0x2222 to PHY address 4 register 3 (Clause 22) on the MDIO bus connected to the device.
rv = bcm_port_phy_set(unit, 4, BCM_PORT_PHY_NOMAP, 3, 0x2222);
// Write 0x3333 to PHY device address 5 register 6 (Clause 45) on the MDIO bus connected to port.
reg_addr = BCM_PORT_PHY_CLAUSE45_ADDR(5, 6);
rv = bcm_port_phy_set(unit, port, BCM_PORT_PHY_CLAUSE45, reg_addr, 0x3333);
// Write 0x4444 to the SerDes PHY register at block 2, register 1 on the SerDes port (SerDes driver must be attached).
reg_addr = 0x00000201;
rv = bcm_port_phy_set(unit, port, 0, reg_addr, 0x4444);
// Write 0x5555 to expansion register 0xF, expansion register number 0x00, which is accessed through register 0x15. (Receive/Transmit Packet Counter Register on BCM5482S).
reg_addr = BCM_PORT_PHY_REG_INDIRECT_ADDR(0, 0x0f00, 0x15);
rv = bcm_port_phy_set(unit, port, 0, reg_addr, 0x5555);
// Write 0x6666 to secondary serdes registers, register number 0x04, which is accessed through register 0x15. (1000BASE-X Control Register of Secondary SerDes on BCM5482S).
reg_addr = BCM_PORT_PHY_REG_INDIRECT_ADDR(0, 0x0e04, 0x15);
rv = bcm_port_phy_set(unit, port, 0, reg_addr, 0x6666);
// Write 0x7777 to primary serdes registers, register number 0x0F (1000BASE-X IEEE Extended Status Register on BCM5482S).
reg_addr = BCM_PORT_PHY_REG_INDIRECT_ADDR(BCM_PORT_PHY_REG_1000X, 0, 0x0f);
rv = bcm_port_phy_set(unit, port, 0, reg_addr, 0x7777);
// Read one byte data from the BSC device connected on the PHY device's MDIO-BSC interface. SOC_PHY_I2C_ADDR(0x52,0) indicates the 7-bit BSC device address is 0x52 and data offset is 0.
reg_addr = SOC_PHY_I2C_ADDR(0x52,0);
rv = bcm_port_phy_get(unit,port,SOC_PHY_I2C_DATA8, reg_addr, &rdata);
// Write value 0x9084 to a 16-bit BSC device connected on the PHY device's MDIO-BSC interface. SOC_PHY_I2C_ADDR(0x56,0x1b) indicates the 7-bit BSC device address is 0x56 and data register is 0x1b.
reg_addr = SOC_PHY_I2C_ADDR(0x56,0x1b);
rv = bcm_port_phy_set(unit,port,SOC_PHY_I2C_DATA16, reg_addr, 0x9084);
// Write value 0xaaaa to internal serdes 0xc140 lane 2 register through indirect mechanism (such as sbus phy driver). For 4-lane port, such as 40G KR4, the valid lane number is 0-3.
bcm_gport_t gport;
int port = 10;
BCM_PHY_GPORT_LANE_PORT_SET(gport, port, 2);
reg_addr = BCM_PORT_PHY_REG_INDIRECT_ADDR(0, 0xc1, 0x40);
rv = bcm_port_phy_set(unit, gport, BCM_PORT_PHY_INTERNAL, reg_addr, 0xaaaa);
// For 100G port, the valid lane number could be 0-9. For 120G port, the valid lane number is 0-11.
Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port number
[in]flagsFlags indicating how to access the PHY, and which PHY if the port has an internal serdes. See BCM_PORT_PHY_flags for details.
[in]phy_reg_addrRegister address in the PHY
[out]phy_dataData to be written or data read

◆ bcm_port_phy_modify()

int bcm_port_phy_modify ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
uint32  flags,
uint32  phy_reg_addr,
uint32  phy_data,
uint32  phy_mask 
)

Read or write PHY registers associated with a port.

Most PHY-related operations are performed automatically by the API to satisfy requests. When direct access to the PHY registers are required for diagnostic purposes or special configuration these functions can be used. Use of these routines may interfere with the normal operation of the API, extreme care must be taken when manipulating PHYs. Normal configuration of speed, duplicity, and auto-negotiation must be performed using the normal bcm_port APIs. It allows to select the lane in the PHY register access through gport lane selection.

Port PHY Flags
Flag Meaning
BCM_PORT_PHY_INTERNAL Address the PHY registers associated with the internal SerDes for the specified port. This option is invalid for ports that do not have an internal SerDes.
BCM_PORT_PHY_NOMAP Do not translate the port number into a PHY address. Use the port number directly as an MDIO address. If this option is specified, then the BCM_PORT_PHY_INTERNAL flag is ignored.
BCM_PORT_PHY_CLAUSE45 Access the PHY as a clause 45 device. If this option is not specified Clause 22 is used.
BCM_PORT_PHY_I2C_DATA8 Access 8-bit BSC device connected on the PHY device's MDIO-BSC bridge interface. Check if your PHY device has this interface before using this option.
BCM_PORT_PHY_I2C_DATA16 Access 16-bit BSC device connected on the PHY device's MDIO-BSC bridge interface. Check if your PHY device has this interface before using this option.
BCM_PORT_PHY_PVT_DATA Access Phy Internal registers/memories. Implementation is private to each phy. Check if your PHY device has this interface before using this option.
BCM_PORT_PHY_BROADCAST_WRITE Broadcast write transactions to all MDIO buses within one unit. All the ports that have the same phy address as the specified port will receive the write command. This options is valid for CMICx MDIO interface.

PHY Register Type Flags
Flag Meaning
BCM_PORT_PHY_REG_1000X The address specified is in 1000X or primary SerDes block.

Additional defines located in <bcm/port.h> may be used to form and extract shadow register address, Clause 45 MDIO device, BSC device and register addresses. See BCM_PORT_PHY_REG_INDIRECT_ADDR, BCM_PORT_PHY_CLAUSE45_ADDR and BCM_PORT_PHY_I2C_ADDR for details. The following commented code examples demonstrate the use of these APIs. All APIs assume a valid value for unit and port. For more examples, refer to the corresponding PHY header files in $SDK/src/soc/phy/ directory.

// Write 0x1111 to PHY register 4 on the external PHY connected to port.
rv = bcm_port_phy_set(unit, port, 0, 4, 0x1111);
// Write 0x2222 to PHY address 4 register 3 (Clause 22) on the MDIO bus connected to the device.
rv = bcm_port_phy_set(unit, 4, BCM_PORT_PHY_NOMAP, 3, 0x2222);
// Write 0x3333 to PHY device address 5 register 6 (Clause 45) on the MDIO bus connected to port.
reg_addr = BCM_PORT_PHY_CLAUSE45_ADDR(5, 6);
rv = bcm_port_phy_set(unit, port, BCM_PORT_PHY_CLAUSE45, reg_addr, 0x3333);
// Write 0x4444 to the SerDes PHY register at block 2, register 1 on the SerDes port (SerDes driver must be attached).
reg_addr = 0x00000201;
rv = bcm_port_phy_set(unit, port, 0, reg_addr, 0x4444);
// Write 0x5555 to expansion register 0xF, expansion register number 0x00, which is accessed through register 0x15. (Receive/Transmit Packet Counter Register on BCM5482S).
reg_addr = BCM_PORT_PHY_REG_INDIRECT_ADDR(0, 0x0f00, 0x15);
rv = bcm_port_phy_set(unit, port, 0, reg_addr, 0x5555);
// Write 0x6666 to secondary serdes registers, register number 0x04, which is accessed through register 0x15. (1000BASE-X Control Register of Secondary SerDes on BCM5482S).
reg_addr = BCM_PORT_PHY_REG_INDIRECT_ADDR(0, 0x0e04, 0x15);
rv = bcm_port_phy_set(unit, port, 0, reg_addr, 0x6666);
// Write 0x7777 to primary serdes registers, register number 0x0F (1000BASE-X IEEE Extended Status Register on BCM5482S).
reg_addr = BCM_PORT_PHY_REG_INDIRECT_ADDR(BCM_PORT_PHY_REG_1000X, 0, 0x0f);
rv = bcm_port_phy_set(unit, port, 0, reg_addr, 0x7777);
// Read one byte data from the BSC device connected on the PHY device's MDIO-BSC interface. SOC_PHY_I2C_ADDR(0x52,0) indicates the 7-bit BSC device address is 0x52 and data offset is 0.
reg_addr = SOC_PHY_I2C_ADDR(0x52,0);
rv = bcm_port_phy_get(unit,port,SOC_PHY_I2C_DATA8, reg_addr, &rdata);
// Write value 0x9084 to a 16-bit BSC device connected on the PHY device's MDIO-BSC interface. SOC_PHY_I2C_ADDR(0x56,0x1b) indicates the 7-bit BSC device address is 0x56 and data register is 0x1b.
reg_addr = SOC_PHY_I2C_ADDR(0x56,0x1b);
rv = bcm_port_phy_set(unit,port,SOC_PHY_I2C_DATA16, reg_addr, 0x9084);
// Write value 0xaaaa to internal serdes 0xc140 lane 2 register through indirect mechanism (such as sbus phy driver). For 4-lane port, such as 40G KR4, the valid lane number is 0-3.
bcm_gport_t gport;
int port = 10;
BCM_PHY_GPORT_LANE_PORT_SET(gport, port, 2);
reg_addr = BCM_PORT_PHY_REG_INDIRECT_ADDR(0, 0xc1, 0x40);
rv = bcm_port_phy_set(unit, gport, BCM_PORT_PHY_INTERNAL, reg_addr, 0xaaaa);
// For 100G port, the valid lane number could be 0-9. For 120G port, the valid lane number is 0-11.
Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port number
[in]flagsFlags indicating how to access the PHY, and which PHY if the port has an internal serdes. See BCM_PORT_PHY_flags for details.
[in]phy_reg_addrRegister address in the PHY
[in]phy_dataData to be written or data read
[in]phy_maskMask write data when modifying register

◆ bcm_port_phy_multi_get()

int bcm_port_phy_multi_get ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
uint32  flags,
uint32  dev_addr,
uint32  offset,
int  max_size,
uint8 *  data,
int *  actual_size 
)

Read data from a slave device connected to a PHY associated with a port.

The routines obtains data from a slave device connected to the PHY. Ex: I2C ROM.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port number
[in]flagsDevice specific flags
[in]dev_addrAddress of the slave device
[in]offsetStarting address in native units
[in]max_sizeRequested data size in bytes
[out]dataArray to place the data
[out]actual_sizePointer to transferred data size in bytes

◆ bcm_port_phy_reset()

int bcm_port_phy_reset ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port 
)

Perform low level PHY reset.

Perform a low level PHY reset on the device attached to the specified port. This routine can be called from the PHY reset callout function to perform the actual reset. This function does not cause a registered PHY reset callout to be invoked.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice port number

◆ bcm_port_phy_reset_register()

int bcm_port_phy_reset_register ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
bcm_port_phy_reset_cb_t  callback,
void *  user_data 
)

Register or unregister a callout to post process PHY resets.

During normal operation, the PHY associated with a port may be reset. If custom programming is required this may be lost when the device is reset. To overcome this, the application should register a callback routine to process the reset request. When the callback is invoked, the PHY has not been reset, it is the callback functions responsibility to perform the reset by calling bcm_port_phy_reset . Only one callback may be registered for a given port. If no callback is registered, a default PHY reset function is performed internally that simply resets the PHY. Example: If after a PHY reset, the PHY must have register 14 programmed with the value 0x1111, the callback function may display as follows:

int
customer_phy_reset(int unit, bcm_port_t port, void *user_data)
{
// Reset the device
BCM_IF_ERROR_RETURN(bcm_port_phy_reset(unit, port));
// Program desired values
return bcm_port_phy_set(unit, port, 0, 14, 0x1111);
}

The function customer_phy_reset must be registered during initialization using the following sequence:

// Register PHY reset callout, note that user_data is set to 0, if the application requires a parameter be passed to the reset function replace 0 with the desired value.
bcm_port_phy_reset_register(unit, port, customer_phy_reset, 0);
Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice port number
[in]callbackFunction to call when the PHY associated with the specified port requires resetting.
[in]user_dataArbitrary user cookie passed to the callback function when invoked.

◆ bcm_port_phy_reset_unregister()

int bcm_port_phy_reset_unregister ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
bcm_port_phy_reset_cb_t  callback,
void *  user_data 
)

Register or unregister a callout to post process PHY resets.

During normal operation, the PHY associated with a port may be reset. If custom programming is required this may be lost when the device is reset. To overcome this, the application should register a callback routine to process the reset request. When the callback is invoked, the PHY has not been reset, it is the callback functions responsibility to perform the reset by calling bcm_port_phy_reset . Only one callback may be registered for a given port. If no callback is registered, a default PHY reset function is performed internally that simply resets the PHY. Example: If after a PHY reset, the PHY must have register 14 programmed with the value 0x1111, the callback function may display as follows:

int
customer_phy_reset(int unit, bcm_port_t port, void *user_data)
{
// Reset the device
BCM_IF_ERROR_RETURN(bcm_port_phy_reset(unit, port));
// Program desired values
return bcm_port_phy_set(unit, port, 0, 14, 0x1111);
}

The function customer_phy_reset must be registered during initialization using the following sequence:

// Register PHY reset callout, note that user_data is set to 0, if the application requires a parameter be passed to the reset function replace 0 with the desired value.
bcm_port_phy_reset_register(unit, port, customer_phy_reset, 0);
Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice port number
[in]callbackFunction to call when the PHY associated with the specified port requires resetting.
[in]user_dataArbitrary user cookie passed to the callback function when invoked.

◆ bcm_port_phy_set()

int bcm_port_phy_set ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
uint32  flags,
uint32  phy_reg_addr,
uint32  phy_data 
)

Read or write PHY registers associated with a port.

Most PHY-related operations are performed automatically by the API to satisfy requests. When direct access to the PHY registers are required for diagnostic purposes or special configuration these functions can be used. Use of these routines may interfere with the normal operation of the API, extreme care must be taken when manipulating PHYs. Normal configuration of speed, duplicity, and auto-negotiation must be performed using the normal bcm_port APIs. It allows to select the lane in the PHY register access through gport lane selection.

Port PHY Flags
Flag Meaning
BCM_PORT_PHY_INTERNAL Address the PHY registers associated with the internal SerDes for the specified port. This option is invalid for ports that do not have an internal SerDes.
BCM_PORT_PHY_NOMAP Do not translate the port number into a PHY address. Use the port number directly as an MDIO address. If this option is specified, then the BCM_PORT_PHY_INTERNAL flag is ignored.
BCM_PORT_PHY_CLAUSE45 Access the PHY as a clause 45 device. If this option is not specified Clause 22 is used.
BCM_PORT_PHY_I2C_DATA8 Access 8-bit BSC device connected on the PHY device's MDIO-BSC bridge interface. Check if your PHY device has this interface before using this option.
BCM_PORT_PHY_I2C_DATA16 Access 16-bit BSC device connected on the PHY device's MDIO-BSC bridge interface. Check if your PHY device has this interface before using this option.
BCM_PORT_PHY_PVT_DATA Access Phy Internal registers/memories. Implementation is private to each phy. Check if your PHY device has this interface before using this option.
BCM_PORT_PHY_BROADCAST_WRITE Broadcast write transactions to all MDIO buses within one unit. All the ports that have the same phy address as the specified port will receive the write command. This options is valid for CMICx MDIO interface.

PHY Register Type Flags
Flag Meaning
BCM_PORT_PHY_REG_1000X The address specified is in 1000X or primary SerDes block.

Additional defines located in <bcm/port.h> may be used to form and extract shadow register address, Clause 45 MDIO device, BSC device and register addresses. See BCM_PORT_PHY_REG_INDIRECT_ADDR, BCM_PORT_PHY_CLAUSE45_ADDR and BCM_PORT_PHY_I2C_ADDR for details. The following commented code examples demonstrate the use of these APIs. All APIs assume a valid value for unit and port. For more examples, refer to the corresponding PHY header files in $SDK/src/soc/phy/ directory.

// Write 0x1111 to PHY register 4 on the external PHY connected to port.
rv = bcm_port_phy_set(unit, port, 0, 4, 0x1111);
// Write 0x2222 to PHY address 4 register 3 (Clause 22) on the MDIO bus connected to the device.
rv = bcm_port_phy_set(unit, 4, BCM_PORT_PHY_NOMAP, 3, 0x2222);
// Write 0x3333 to PHY device address 5 register 6 (Clause 45) on the MDIO bus connected to port.
reg_addr = BCM_PORT_PHY_CLAUSE45_ADDR(5, 6);
rv = bcm_port_phy_set(unit, port, BCM_PORT_PHY_CLAUSE45, reg_addr, 0x3333);
// Write 0x4444 to the SerDes PHY register at block 2, register 1 on the SerDes port (SerDes driver must be attached).
reg_addr = 0x00000201;
rv = bcm_port_phy_set(unit, port, 0, reg_addr, 0x4444);
// Write 0x5555 to expansion register 0xF, expansion register number 0x00, which is accessed through register 0x15. (Receive/Transmit Packet Counter Register on BCM5482S).
reg_addr = BCM_PORT_PHY_REG_INDIRECT_ADDR(0, 0x0f00, 0x15);
rv = bcm_port_phy_set(unit, port, 0, reg_addr, 0x5555);
// Write 0x6666 to secondary serdes registers, register number 0x04, which is accessed through register 0x15. (1000BASE-X Control Register of Secondary SerDes on BCM5482S).
reg_addr = BCM_PORT_PHY_REG_INDIRECT_ADDR(0, 0x0e04, 0x15);
rv = bcm_port_phy_set(unit, port, 0, reg_addr, 0x6666);
// Write 0x7777 to primary serdes registers, register number 0x0F (1000BASE-X IEEE Extended Status Register on BCM5482S).
reg_addr = BCM_PORT_PHY_REG_INDIRECT_ADDR(BCM_PORT_PHY_REG_1000X, 0, 0x0f);
rv = bcm_port_phy_set(unit, port, 0, reg_addr, 0x7777);
// Read one byte data from the BSC device connected on the PHY device's MDIO-BSC interface. SOC_PHY_I2C_ADDR(0x52,0) indicates the 7-bit BSC device address is 0x52 and data offset is 0.
reg_addr = SOC_PHY_I2C_ADDR(0x52,0);
rv = bcm_port_phy_get(unit,port,SOC_PHY_I2C_DATA8, reg_addr, &rdata);
// Write value 0x9084 to a 16-bit BSC device connected on the PHY device's MDIO-BSC interface. SOC_PHY_I2C_ADDR(0x56,0x1b) indicates the 7-bit BSC device address is 0x56 and data register is 0x1b.
reg_addr = SOC_PHY_I2C_ADDR(0x56,0x1b);
rv = bcm_port_phy_set(unit,port,SOC_PHY_I2C_DATA16, reg_addr, 0x9084);
// Write value 0xaaaa to internal serdes 0xc140 lane 2 register through indirect mechanism (such as sbus phy driver). For 4-lane port, such as 40G KR4, the valid lane number is 0-3.
bcm_gport_t gport;
int port = 10;
BCM_PHY_GPORT_LANE_PORT_SET(gport, port, 2);
reg_addr = BCM_PORT_PHY_REG_INDIRECT_ADDR(0, 0xc1, 0x40);
rv = bcm_port_phy_set(unit, gport, BCM_PORT_PHY_INTERNAL, reg_addr, 0xaaaa);
// For 100G port, the valid lane number could be 0-9. For 120G port, the valid lane number is 0-11.
Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port number
[in]flagsFlags indicating how to access the PHY, and which PHY if the port has an internal serdes. See BCM_PORT_PHY_flags for details.
[in]phy_reg_addrRegister address in the PHY
[in]phy_dataData to be written or data read

◆ bcm_port_phy_timesync_config_get()

int bcm_port_phy_timesync_config_get ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
bcm_port_phy_timesync_config_t *  conf 
)

Set/get the port configuration for the specified device.

bcm_port_phy_timesync_config_get returns all known ports configured on the specified device. BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_CONFIG_t describes the meaning of each field.

bcm_port_phy_timesync_config_t
Field BCM Type Description
capabilities uint32 Flags BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_CAP_*
validity_mask uint32 Flags BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_VALID_*
flags uint32 Flags BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_*
itpid uint16 1588 inner tag
otpid uint16 1588 outer tag
otpid2 uint16 1588 outer tag2
timer_adjust Direct timer adjustment
inband_control Inband timesync control
gmode bcm_port_phy_timesync_global_mode_t Global mode
framesync bcm_port_phy_timesync_framesync_t Framesync parameters
syncout bcm_port_phy_timesync_syncout_t Syncout parameters
ts_divider uint16 Timestamp rate divider
original_timecode bcm_time_spec_t Original timecode to be inserted
tx_timestamp_offset uint32 TX AFE delay in ns (per port)
rx_timestamp_offset uint32 RX AFE delay in ns (per port)
rx_link_delay uint32 RX Link delay in ns (per port)
tx_sync_mode bcm_port_phy_timesync_event_message_egress_mode_t TX action for "sync" event messages (per port)
tx_delay_request_mode bcm_port_phy_timesync_event_message_egress_mode_t TX action for "delay request" event messages (per port)
tx_pdelay_request_mode bcm_port_phy_timesync_event_message_egress_mode_t TX action for "pdelay request" event message (per port)
tx_pdelay_response_mode bcm_port_phy_timesync_event_message_egress_mode_t TX action for "pdelay response" event messages (per port)
rx_sync_mode bcm_port_phy_timesync_event_message_ingress_mode_t RX action for "sync" event messages (per port)
rx_delay_request_mode bcm_port_phy_timesync_event_message_ingress_mode_t RX action for "delay request" event messages (per port)
rx_pdelay_request_mode bcm_port_phy_timesync_event_message_ingress_mode_t RX action for "pdelay request" event messages (per port)
rx_pdelay_response_mode bcm_port_phy_timesync_event_message_ingress_mode_t RX action for "pdelay response" event messages (per port)
mpls_control bcm_port_phy_timesync_mpls_control_t MPLS control
phy_1588_dpll_k1 uint16 DPLL K1
phy_1588_dpll_k2 uint16 DPLL K2
phy_1588_dpll_k3 uint16 DPLL K3
phy_1588_dpll_loop_filter uint16 DPLL loop filter
phy_1588_dpll_ref_phase uint16 DPLL ref phase
phy_1588_dpll_ref_phase_delta uint16 DPLL ref phase delta

Port Phy timesync config structure field validity flags
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_VALID_FLAGS Flags field is valid
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_VALID_ITPID itpid is valid
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_VALID_OTPID otpid is valid
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_VALID_OTPID2 otpid2 is valid
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_VALID_GMODE gmode is valid
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_VALID_FRAMESYNC_MODE framesync mode is valid
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_VALID_SYNCOUT_MODE syncout mode is valid
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_VALID_TS_DIVIDER ts divider mode is valid
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_VALID_ORIGINAL_TIMECODE original timecode is valid
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_VALID_TX_TIMESTAMP_OFFSET tx timestamp offset is valid
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_VALID_RX_TIMESTAMP_OFFSET rx timestamp offset is valid
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_VALID_TX_SYNC_MODE tx sync mode is valid
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_VALID_TX_DELAY_REQUEST_MODE tx delay request mode is valid
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_VALID_TX_PDELAY_REQUEST_MODE tx pdelay request mode is valid
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_VALID_TX_PDELAY_RESPONSE_MODE tx pdelay response mode is valid
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_VALID_RX_SYNC_MODE rx sync mode is valid
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_VALID_RX_DELAY_REQUEST_MODE rx delay request mode is valid
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_VALID_RX_PDELAY_REQUEST_MODE rx pdelay request mode is valid
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_VALID_RX_PDELAY_RESPONSE_MODE rx pdelay response mode is valid
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_VALID_MPLS_CONTROL MPLS control is valid
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_VALID_RX_LINK_DELAY rx link delay is valid
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_VALID_PHY_1588_DPLL_K1 phy 1588 dpll k1 is valid
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_VALID_PHY_1588_DPLL_K2 phy 1588 dpll k2 is valid
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_VALID_PHY_1588_DPLL_K3 phy 1588 dpll k3 is valid
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_VALID_PHY_1588_DPLL_LOOP_FILTER phy 1588 dpll loop filter is valid
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_VALID_PHY_1588_DPLL_REF_PHASE phy 1588 dpll ref phase is valid
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_VALID_PHY_1588_DPLL_REF_PHASE_DELTA phy 1588 dpll ref phase delta is valid
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_VALID_TIMER_ADJUSTMENT phy 1588 direct timer adjustment is valid
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_VALID_PHY_1588_INBAND_CONTROL phy 1588 inband timesync control is valid

Port Phy timesync flags
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_ENABLE Enable Time Synchronization Interface
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_CAPTURE_TS_ENABLE Enable Packet Timestamping
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_HEARTBEAT_TS_ENABLE Enable Heartbeat Timestamping
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_RX_CRC_ENABLE Enable CRC checking
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_8021AS_ENABLE 8021AS_ENABLE Enable IEEE802.1AS mode
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_L2_ENABLE IEEE1588 over Layer 2
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_IP4_ENABLE IEEE1588 over IPV4 UDP
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_IP6_ENABLE IEEE1588 over IPV6 UDP
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_CLOCK_SRC_EXT Use external clock source (DPLL)
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_CLOCK_SRC_EXT_MODE DPLL mode, 0 - phase lock, 1 - frequency lock
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_1588_ENCRYPTED_MODE Encrypted mode, 0 - disable, 1 - enable
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_FOLLOW_UP_ASSIST_ENABLE Enable follow up assistant
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_DELAY_RESP_ASSIST_ENABLE Enable delay response assistant
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_64BIT_TIMESTAMP_ENABLE Enable 64bit timestamping
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_1588_OVER_HSR_ENABLE Enable 1588 over HSR
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_CAPTURE_TIMESTAMP_TX_SYNC Capture timestamp of Tx Sync packets
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_CAPTURE_TIMESTAMP_TX_DELAY_REQ Capture timestamp of Tx Delay Request packets
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_CAPTURE_TIMESTAMP_TX_PDELAY_REQ Capture timestamp of Tx PDelay Request packets
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_CAPTURE_TIMESTAMP_TX_PDELAY_RESP Capture timestamp of Tx PDelay Response packets
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_CAPTURE_TIMESTAMP_RX_SYNC Capture timestamp of Rx Sync packets
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_CAPTURE_TIMESTAMP_RX_DELAY_REQ Capture timestamp of Rx Delay Request packets
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_CAPTURE_TIMESTAMP_RX_PDELAY_REQ Capture timestamp of Rx PDelay Request packets
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_CAPTURE_TIMESTAMP_RX_PDELAY_RESP Capture timestamp of Rx PDelay Response packets

Port Phy timesync capability flags (read only)
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_CAP_MPLS PHY is 1588 over MPLS
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_CAP_ENHANCED_TSFIFO PHY has enhanced TSFIFO
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_CAP_INBAND_TS PHY supports inband timestamping
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_CAP_FOLLOW_UP_ASSIST PHY supports follow up assist
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_CAP_DELAY_RESP_ASSIST PHY supports delay response assist
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_CAP_CAPTURE_TIMESTAMP_MSG PHY supports capture capability at message granularity

Port Phy timesync INBAND TS flags
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_INBAND_RESV0_ID_CHECK Enable inband resv0 id check
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_INBAND_SYNC_ENABLE Enable inband timestamping for Sync
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_INBAND_DELAY_RQ_ENABLE Enable inband timestamping for Delay Request
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_INBAND_PDELAY_RQ_ENABLE Enable inband timestamping for PDelay Request
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_INBAND_PDELAY_RESP_ENABLE Enable inband timestamping for PDelay Response
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_INBAND_RESV0_ID_UPDATE Enables update of resv0 field in the ingress packet with the resv0_id
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_INBAND_FOLLOW_UP_ASSIST Enable inband Follow_Up (T1) assist
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_INBAND_DELAY_RESP_ASSIST Enable inband Delay_Response (T3) assist
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_INBAND_TIMER_MODE_SELECT Select 80- or 48-bit counter for inband PTP messages
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_INBAND_CAP_SRC_PORT_CLK_ID By default, MAC DA is captured and saved in the memory/FIFO. To capture source port clock ID instead, this flag can be used. Only one of them can be selected at a time.
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_INBAND_MATCH_VLAN_ID Enable the comparison of the VLAN ID field during delay response(T3) and follow up packet.
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_INBAND_MATCH_SRC_PORT_NUM Enable the comparison of the source port number during delay response(T3) and follow up packet.
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_INBAND_MATCH_MAC_ADDR Enable the comparison of the MAC address during delay response(T3) and follow up packet.
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_INBAND_MATCH_IP_ADDR Enable the comparison of the IP address during delay response(T3) and follow up packet.

Port Phy timesync MPLS flags
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_MPLS_LABEL_IN MPLS label applies to ingress packets
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_MPLS_LABEL_OUT MPLS label applies to egress packets
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_MPLS_ENABLE Enable processing of MPLS 1588 packets
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_MPLS_ENTROPY_ENABLE Enable MPLS entropy on 1588 packets
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_MPLS_SPECIAL_LABEL_ENABLE Enable MPLS special label on 1588 packets
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_MPLS_CONTROL_WORD_ENABLE Enable MPLS control word on 1588 packets

Port Phy timesync load control flags
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_TN_LOAD Load Tn upon framesync
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_TN_ALWAYS_LOAD Always load Tn upon framesync
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_TIMECODE_LOAD Load timecode upon framesync
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_TIMECODE_ALWAYS_LOAD Always load timecode upon framesync
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_SYNCOUT_LOAD Load syncout upon framesync
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_SYNCOUT_ALWAYS_LOAD Always load syncout upon framesync
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_NCO_DIVIDER_LOAD Load NCO divider upon framesync
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_NCO_DIVIDER_ALWAYS_LOAD Always load NCO divider upon framesync
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_LOCAL_TIME_LOAD Load local time upon framesync
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_LOCAL_TIME_ALWAYS_LOAD Always load local time upon framesync
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_NCO_ADDEND_LOAD Load NCO addend upon framesync
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_NCO_ADDEND_ALWAYS_LOAD Always load NCO addend upon framesync
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_DPLL_LOOP_FILTER_LOAD Load DPLL loop filter upon framesync
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_DPLL_LOOP_FILTER_ALWAYS_LOAD Always load DPLL loop filter upon framesync
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_DPLL_REF_PHASE_LOAD Load DPLL ref phase upon framesync
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_DPLL_REF_PHASE_ALWAYS_LOAD Always load DPLL ref phase upon framesync
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_DPLL_REF_PHASE_DELTA_LOAD Load DPLL ref phase delta upon framesync
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_DPLL_REF_PHASE_DELTA_ALWAYS_LOAD Always load DPLL ref phase delta upon framesync
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_DPLL_K3_LOAD Load DPLL coefficient K3 upon framesync
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_DPLL_K3_ALWAYS_LOAD Always load DPLL coefficient K3 upon framesync
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_DPLL_K2_LOAD Load DPLL coefficient K2 upon framesync
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_DPLL_K2_ALWAYS_LOAD Always load DPLL coefficient K2 upon framesync
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_DPLL_K1_LOAD Load DPLL coefficient K1 upon framesync
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_DPLL_K1_ALWAYS_LOAD Always load DPLL coefficient K1 upon framesync

Port Phy timesync interrupt flags
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_TIMESTAMP_INTERRUPT Packet timestamp interrupt from this port
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_TIMESTAMP_INTERRUPT_0 Packet timestamp interrupt from port 0 of the PHY chip
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_TIMESTAMP_INTERRUPT_1 Packet timestamp interrupt from port 1 of the PHY chip
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_TIMESTAMP_INTERRUPT_2 Packet timestamp interrupt from port 2 of the PHY chip
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_TIMESTAMP_INTERRUPT_3 Packet timestamp interrupt from port 3 of the PHY chip
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_TIMESTAMP_INTERRUPT_4 Packet timestamp interrupt from port 4 of the PHY chip
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_TIMESTAMP_INTERRUPT_5 Packet timestamp interrupt from port 5 of the PHY chip
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_TIMESTAMP_INTERRUPT_6 Packet timestamp interrupt from port 6 of the PHY chip
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_TIMESTAMP_INTERRUPT_7 Packet timestamp interrupt from port 7 of the PHY chip
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_FRAMESYNC_INTERRUPT Framesync interrupt

Port Phy timesync interrupt mask flags
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_TIMESTAMP_INTERRUPT_MASK Packet timestamp interrupt mask
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_FRAMESYNC_INTERRUPT_MASK Framesync interrupt mask

Port Phy timesync interrupt mask flags
BCM_PORT_PHY_INTR_TIMESYNC_FRAMESYNC Timesync framesync interrupt
BCM_PORT_PHY_INTR_TIMESYNC_TIMESTAMP Timesync timestamp interrupt
BCM_PORT_PHY_INTR_LINK_EVENT Link status event interrupt
BCM_PORT_PHY_INTR_AUTONEG_EVENT Auto-negotiation event interrupt
BCM_PORT_PHY_INTR_PLL_EVENT PLL status event interrupt
BCM_PORT_PHY_INTR_UC_EVENT Microcontroller event interrupt
BCM_PORT_PHY_INTR_EMON_EVENT Error monitor event interrupt
BCM_PORT_PHY_INTR_AUX_EVENT Non-standard PHY event interrupt

The feature types are shown in PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_GLOBAL_MODE_v

bcm_port_phy_timesync_global_mode_t
bcmPortPhyTimesyncModeFree Free running mode
bcmPortPhyTimesyncModeSyncin Use syncin as the source
bcmPortPhyTimesyncModeCpu CPU based framesync

The feature types are shown in PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_FRAMESYNC_MODE_v

bcm_port_phy_timesync_framesync_mode_t
bcmPortPhyTimesyncFramesyncNone Do nothing
bcmPortPhyTimesyncFramesyncSyncin0 Use long pulse on SyncIn0 for FrameSync
bcmPortPhyTimesyncFramesyncSyncin1 Use SyncIn1 as FrameSync
bcmPortPhyTimesyncFramesyncSyncout Use internal SyncOut as FrameSync
bcmPortPhyTimesyncFramesyncCpu CPU based immediate FrameSync

The feature types are shown in PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_FRAMESYNC_v .

bcm_port_phy_timesync_framesync_t
mode framesync mode
length_threshold syncin threshold for framesync
event_offset event offset for framesync

The feature types are shown in PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_SYNCOUT_MODE_v .

bcm_port_phy_timesync_syncout_mode_t
bcmPortPhyTimesyncSyncoutDisable Do nothing
bcmPortPhyTimesyncSyncoutOneTime One time SYNC pulse on a match with the timesync heartbeat
bcmPortPhyTimesyncSyncoutPulseTrain Pulse train on SyncOut
bcmPortPhyTimesyncSyncoutPulseTrainWithSync Combination of pulse train and one time SYNC

The feature types are shown in PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_SYNCOUT_v .

bcm_port_phy_timesync_syncout_t
mode; syncout mode
pulse_1_length; pulse 1 length in ns
pulse_2_length; pulse 2 length in ns
interval; interval in ns
syncout_ts; syncout timestamp

The feature types are shown in PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_TIMER_ADJUST_v

bcm_port_phy_timesync_timer_adjust_t
mode Timer adjustment mode
delta Timer adjustment delta value

The feature types are shown in PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_INBAND_CONTROL_v

bcm_port_phy_timesync_inband_control_t
flags Inband Timestamping flags (BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_INBAND_* flags)
resv0_id Resv0 ID used
timer_mode Timer mode

The feature types are shown in PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_MSG_v

bcm_port_phy_timesync_msg_t
bcmPortPhyTimesyncMsgSync Sync
bcmPortPhyTimesyncMsgDelayReq Delay Request
bcmPortPhyTimesyncMsgPdelayReq PDelay Request
bcmPortPhyTimesyncMsgPdelayResp PDelay Response

The feature types are shown in PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_PROT_v

bcm_port_phy_timesync_prot_t
bcmPortPhyTimesyncProtLayer2 1588 over Layer 2
bcmPortPhyTimesyncProtIpv4Udp 1588 over IPv4 UDP
bcmbcmPortPhyTimesyncProtIpv6Udp 1588 over IPv6 UDP

The feature types are shown in PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_DIR_v

bcm_port_phy_timesync_dir_t
bcmPortPhyTimesyncDirEgress Egress Packet
bcmPortPhyTimesyncDirIngress Igress Packet

The feature types are shown in PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_TIMER_MODE_v

bcm_port_phy_timesync_timer_mode_t
PortPhyTimesyncTimerModeNone No TimeSync timer
PortPhyTimesyncTimerModeDefault Use the default TimeSync timer
PortPhyTimesyncTimerMode32bit Use 32-bit TimeSync timer
PortPhyTimesyncTimerMode48bit Use 48-bit TimeSync timer
PortPhyTimesyncTimerMode64bit Use 64-bit TimeSync timer
PortPhyTimesyncTimerMode80bit Use 80-bit TimeSync timer

The feature types are shown in PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_MPLS_LABEL_v

bcm_port_phy_timesync_mpls_label_t
value label value (bcm_mpls_label_t)
mask label mask (bcm_mpls_label_t)
flags MPLS label flags (BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_MPLS_* flags)

The feature types are shown in PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_MPLS_CONTROL_v

bcm_port_phy_timesync_mpls_control_t
flags MPLS control flags
special_label special label value (bcm_port_phy_timesync_mpls_label_t)
labels Timesync MPLS labels (bcm_port_phy_timesync_mpls_label_t)
size Number of elements in label array

The feature types are shown in PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_EVENT_MESSAGE_EGRESS_MODE_v

bcm_port_phy_timesync_event_message_egress_mode_t
Value Description
bcmPortPhyTimesyncEventMessageEgressModeNone Do not modify
bcmPortPhyTimesyncEventMessageEgressModeUpdateCorrectionField Update correction field (CF(existing) + TS(txsop))
bcmPortPhyTimesyncEventMessageEgressModeReplaceCorrectionFieldOrigin Replace correction field with delay since framesync (TS(txsop) - TS(1pps)) and original timecode
bcmPortPhyTimesyncEventMessageEgressModeCaptureTimestamp Capture TX timestamp

The feature types are shown in PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_EVENT_MESSAGE_INGRESS_MODE_v

bcm_port_phy_timesync_event_message_ingress_mode_t
Value Description
bcmPortPhyTimesyncEventMessageIngressModeNone Do not modify
bcmPortPhyTimesyncEventMessageIngressModeUpdateCorrectionField Update correction field (CF(existing) - TS(rxsop))
bcmPortPhyTimesyncEventMessageIngressModeInsertTimestamp Insert timestamp from 48 bit NCO (TS(rxsop))
bcmPortPhyTimesyncEventMessageIngressModeInsertDelaytime Insert delay (TS(rxsop) - TS(1pps))
Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portPort number.
[out]conf

◆ bcm_port_phy_timesync_config_set()

int bcm_port_phy_timesync_config_set ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
bcm_port_phy_timesync_config_t *  conf 
)

Set/get the port configuration for the specified device.

bcm_port_phy_timesync_config_get returns all known ports configured on the specified device. BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_CONFIG_t describes the meaning of each field.

bcm_port_phy_timesync_config_t
Field BCM Type Description
capabilities uint32 Flags BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_CAP_*
validity_mask uint32 Flags BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_VALID_*
flags uint32 Flags BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_*
itpid uint16 1588 inner tag
otpid uint16 1588 outer tag
otpid2 uint16 1588 outer tag2
timer_adjust Direct timer adjustment
inband_control Inband timesync control
gmode bcm_port_phy_timesync_global_mode_t Global mode
framesync bcm_port_phy_timesync_framesync_t Framesync parameters
syncout bcm_port_phy_timesync_syncout_t Syncout parameters
ts_divider uint16 Timestamp rate divider
original_timecode bcm_time_spec_t Original timecode to be inserted
tx_timestamp_offset uint32 TX AFE delay in ns (per port)
rx_timestamp_offset uint32 RX AFE delay in ns (per port)
rx_link_delay uint32 RX Link delay in ns (per port)
tx_sync_mode bcm_port_phy_timesync_event_message_egress_mode_t TX action for "sync" event messages (per port)
tx_delay_request_mode bcm_port_phy_timesync_event_message_egress_mode_t TX action for "delay request" event messages (per port)
tx_pdelay_request_mode bcm_port_phy_timesync_event_message_egress_mode_t TX action for "pdelay request" event message (per port)
tx_pdelay_response_mode bcm_port_phy_timesync_event_message_egress_mode_t TX action for "pdelay response" event messages (per port)
rx_sync_mode bcm_port_phy_timesync_event_message_ingress_mode_t RX action for "sync" event messages (per port)
rx_delay_request_mode bcm_port_phy_timesync_event_message_ingress_mode_t RX action for "delay request" event messages (per port)
rx_pdelay_request_mode bcm_port_phy_timesync_event_message_ingress_mode_t RX action for "pdelay request" event messages (per port)
rx_pdelay_response_mode bcm_port_phy_timesync_event_message_ingress_mode_t RX action for "pdelay response" event messages (per port)
mpls_control bcm_port_phy_timesync_mpls_control_t MPLS control
phy_1588_dpll_k1 uint16 DPLL K1
phy_1588_dpll_k2 uint16 DPLL K2
phy_1588_dpll_k3 uint16 DPLL K3
phy_1588_dpll_loop_filter uint16 DPLL loop filter
phy_1588_dpll_ref_phase uint16 DPLL ref phase
phy_1588_dpll_ref_phase_delta uint16 DPLL ref phase delta

Port Phy timesync config structure field validity flags
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_VALID_FLAGS Flags field is valid
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_VALID_ITPID itpid is valid
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_VALID_OTPID otpid is valid
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_VALID_OTPID2 otpid2 is valid
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_VALID_GMODE gmode is valid
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_VALID_FRAMESYNC_MODE framesync mode is valid
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_VALID_SYNCOUT_MODE syncout mode is valid
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_VALID_TS_DIVIDER ts divider mode is valid
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_VALID_ORIGINAL_TIMECODE original timecode is valid
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_VALID_TX_TIMESTAMP_OFFSET tx timestamp offset is valid
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_VALID_RX_TIMESTAMP_OFFSET rx timestamp offset is valid
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_VALID_TX_SYNC_MODE tx sync mode is valid
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_VALID_TX_DELAY_REQUEST_MODE tx delay request mode is valid
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_VALID_TX_PDELAY_REQUEST_MODE tx pdelay request mode is valid
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_VALID_TX_PDELAY_RESPONSE_MODE tx pdelay response mode is valid
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_VALID_RX_SYNC_MODE rx sync mode is valid
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_VALID_RX_DELAY_REQUEST_MODE rx delay request mode is valid
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_VALID_RX_PDELAY_REQUEST_MODE rx pdelay request mode is valid
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_VALID_RX_PDELAY_RESPONSE_MODE rx pdelay response mode is valid
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_VALID_MPLS_CONTROL MPLS control is valid
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_VALID_RX_LINK_DELAY rx link delay is valid
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_VALID_PHY_1588_DPLL_K1 phy 1588 dpll k1 is valid
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_VALID_PHY_1588_DPLL_K2 phy 1588 dpll k2 is valid
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_VALID_PHY_1588_DPLL_K3 phy 1588 dpll k3 is valid
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_VALID_PHY_1588_DPLL_LOOP_FILTER phy 1588 dpll loop filter is valid
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_VALID_PHY_1588_DPLL_REF_PHASE phy 1588 dpll ref phase is valid
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_VALID_PHY_1588_DPLL_REF_PHASE_DELTA phy 1588 dpll ref phase delta is valid
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_VALID_TIMER_ADJUSTMENT phy 1588 direct timer adjustment is valid
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_VALID_PHY_1588_INBAND_CONTROL phy 1588 inband timesync control is valid

Port Phy timesync flags
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_ENABLE Enable Time Synchronization Interface
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_CAPTURE_TS_ENABLE Enable Packet Timestamping
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_HEARTBEAT_TS_ENABLE Enable Heartbeat Timestamping
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_RX_CRC_ENABLE Enable CRC checking
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_8021AS_ENABLE 8021AS_ENABLE Enable IEEE802.1AS mode
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_L2_ENABLE IEEE1588 over Layer 2
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_IP4_ENABLE IEEE1588 over IPV4 UDP
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_IP6_ENABLE IEEE1588 over IPV6 UDP
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_CLOCK_SRC_EXT Use external clock source (DPLL)
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_CLOCK_SRC_EXT_MODE DPLL mode, 0 - phase lock, 1 - frequency lock
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_1588_ENCRYPTED_MODE Encrypted mode, 0 - disable, 1 - enable
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_FOLLOW_UP_ASSIST_ENABLE Enable follow up assistant
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_DELAY_RESP_ASSIST_ENABLE Enable delay response assistant
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_64BIT_TIMESTAMP_ENABLE Enable 64bit timestamping
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_1588_OVER_HSR_ENABLE Enable 1588 over HSR
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_CAPTURE_TIMESTAMP_TX_SYNC Capture timestamp of Tx Sync packets
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_CAPTURE_TIMESTAMP_TX_DELAY_REQ Capture timestamp of Tx Delay Request packets
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_CAPTURE_TIMESTAMP_TX_PDELAY_REQ Capture timestamp of Tx PDelay Request packets
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_CAPTURE_TIMESTAMP_TX_PDELAY_RESP Capture timestamp of Tx PDelay Response packets
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_CAPTURE_TIMESTAMP_RX_SYNC Capture timestamp of Rx Sync packets
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_CAPTURE_TIMESTAMP_RX_DELAY_REQ Capture timestamp of Rx Delay Request packets
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_CAPTURE_TIMESTAMP_RX_PDELAY_REQ Capture timestamp of Rx PDelay Request packets
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_CAPTURE_TIMESTAMP_RX_PDELAY_RESP Capture timestamp of Rx PDelay Response packets

Port Phy timesync capability flags (read only)
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_CAP_MPLS PHY is 1588 over MPLS
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_CAP_ENHANCED_TSFIFO PHY has enhanced TSFIFO
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_CAP_INBAND_TS PHY supports inband timestamping
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_CAP_FOLLOW_UP_ASSIST PHY supports follow up assist
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_CAP_DELAY_RESP_ASSIST PHY supports delay response assist
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_CAP_CAPTURE_TIMESTAMP_MSG PHY supports capture capability at message granularity

Port Phy timesync INBAND TS flags
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_INBAND_RESV0_ID_CHECK Enable inband resv0 id check
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_INBAND_SYNC_ENABLE Enable inband timestamping for Sync
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_INBAND_DELAY_RQ_ENABLE Enable inband timestamping for Delay Request
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_INBAND_PDELAY_RQ_ENABLE Enable inband timestamping for PDelay Request
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_INBAND_PDELAY_RESP_ENABLE Enable inband timestamping for PDelay Response
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_INBAND_RESV0_ID_UPDATE Enables update of resv0 field in the ingress packet with the resv0_id
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_INBAND_FOLLOW_UP_ASSIST Enable inband Follow_Up (T1) assist
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_INBAND_DELAY_RESP_ASSIST Enable inband Delay_Response (T3) assist
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_INBAND_TIMER_MODE_SELECT Select 80- or 48-bit counter for inband PTP messages
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_INBAND_CAP_SRC_PORT_CLK_ID By default, MAC DA is captured and saved in the memory/FIFO. To capture source port clock ID instead, this flag can be used. Only one of them can be selected at a time.
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_INBAND_MATCH_VLAN_ID Enable the comparison of the VLAN ID field during delay response(T3) and follow up packet.
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_INBAND_MATCH_SRC_PORT_NUM Enable the comparison of the source port number during delay response(T3) and follow up packet.
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_INBAND_MATCH_MAC_ADDR Enable the comparison of the MAC address during delay response(T3) and follow up packet.
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_INBAND_MATCH_IP_ADDR Enable the comparison of the IP address during delay response(T3) and follow up packet.

Port Phy timesync MPLS flags
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_MPLS_LABEL_IN MPLS label applies to ingress packets
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_MPLS_LABEL_OUT MPLS label applies to egress packets
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_MPLS_ENABLE Enable processing of MPLS 1588 packets
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_MPLS_ENTROPY_ENABLE Enable MPLS entropy on 1588 packets
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_MPLS_SPECIAL_LABEL_ENABLE Enable MPLS special label on 1588 packets
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_MPLS_CONTROL_WORD_ENABLE Enable MPLS control word on 1588 packets

Port Phy timesync load control flags
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_TN_LOAD Load Tn upon framesync
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_TN_ALWAYS_LOAD Always load Tn upon framesync
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_TIMECODE_LOAD Load timecode upon framesync
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_TIMECODE_ALWAYS_LOAD Always load timecode upon framesync
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_SYNCOUT_LOAD Load syncout upon framesync
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_SYNCOUT_ALWAYS_LOAD Always load syncout upon framesync
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_NCO_DIVIDER_LOAD Load NCO divider upon framesync
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_NCO_DIVIDER_ALWAYS_LOAD Always load NCO divider upon framesync
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_LOCAL_TIME_LOAD Load local time upon framesync
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_LOCAL_TIME_ALWAYS_LOAD Always load local time upon framesync
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_NCO_ADDEND_LOAD Load NCO addend upon framesync
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_NCO_ADDEND_ALWAYS_LOAD Always load NCO addend upon framesync
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_DPLL_LOOP_FILTER_LOAD Load DPLL loop filter upon framesync
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_DPLL_LOOP_FILTER_ALWAYS_LOAD Always load DPLL loop filter upon framesync
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_DPLL_REF_PHASE_LOAD Load DPLL ref phase upon framesync
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_DPLL_REF_PHASE_ALWAYS_LOAD Always load DPLL ref phase upon framesync
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_DPLL_REF_PHASE_DELTA_LOAD Load DPLL ref phase delta upon framesync
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_DPLL_REF_PHASE_DELTA_ALWAYS_LOAD Always load DPLL ref phase delta upon framesync
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_DPLL_K3_LOAD Load DPLL coefficient K3 upon framesync
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_DPLL_K3_ALWAYS_LOAD Always load DPLL coefficient K3 upon framesync
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_DPLL_K2_LOAD Load DPLL coefficient K2 upon framesync
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_DPLL_K2_ALWAYS_LOAD Always load DPLL coefficient K2 upon framesync
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_DPLL_K1_LOAD Load DPLL coefficient K1 upon framesync
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_DPLL_K1_ALWAYS_LOAD Always load DPLL coefficient K1 upon framesync

Port Phy timesync interrupt flags
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_TIMESTAMP_INTERRUPT Packet timestamp interrupt from this port
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_TIMESTAMP_INTERRUPT_0 Packet timestamp interrupt from port 0 of the PHY chip
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_TIMESTAMP_INTERRUPT_1 Packet timestamp interrupt from port 1 of the PHY chip
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_TIMESTAMP_INTERRUPT_2 Packet timestamp interrupt from port 2 of the PHY chip
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_TIMESTAMP_INTERRUPT_3 Packet timestamp interrupt from port 3 of the PHY chip
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_TIMESTAMP_INTERRUPT_4 Packet timestamp interrupt from port 4 of the PHY chip
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_TIMESTAMP_INTERRUPT_5 Packet timestamp interrupt from port 5 of the PHY chip
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_TIMESTAMP_INTERRUPT_6 Packet timestamp interrupt from port 6 of the PHY chip
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_TIMESTAMP_INTERRUPT_7 Packet timestamp interrupt from port 7 of the PHY chip
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_FRAMESYNC_INTERRUPT Framesync interrupt

Port Phy timesync interrupt mask flags
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_TIMESTAMP_INTERRUPT_MASK Packet timestamp interrupt mask
BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_FRAMESYNC_INTERRUPT_MASK Framesync interrupt mask

Port Phy timesync interrupt mask flags
BCM_PORT_PHY_INTR_TIMESYNC_FRAMESYNC Timesync framesync interrupt
BCM_PORT_PHY_INTR_TIMESYNC_TIMESTAMP Timesync timestamp interrupt
BCM_PORT_PHY_INTR_LINK_EVENT Link status event interrupt
BCM_PORT_PHY_INTR_AUTONEG_EVENT Auto-negotiation event interrupt
BCM_PORT_PHY_INTR_PLL_EVENT PLL status event interrupt
BCM_PORT_PHY_INTR_UC_EVENT Microcontroller event interrupt
BCM_PORT_PHY_INTR_EMON_EVENT Error monitor event interrupt
BCM_PORT_PHY_INTR_AUX_EVENT Non-standard PHY event interrupt

The feature types are shown in PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_GLOBAL_MODE_v

bcm_port_phy_timesync_global_mode_t
bcmPortPhyTimesyncModeFree Free running mode
bcmPortPhyTimesyncModeSyncin Use syncin as the source
bcmPortPhyTimesyncModeCpu CPU based framesync

The feature types are shown in PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_FRAMESYNC_MODE_v

bcm_port_phy_timesync_framesync_mode_t
bcmPortPhyTimesyncFramesyncNone Do nothing
bcmPortPhyTimesyncFramesyncSyncin0 Use long pulse on SyncIn0 for FrameSync
bcmPortPhyTimesyncFramesyncSyncin1 Use SyncIn1 as FrameSync
bcmPortPhyTimesyncFramesyncSyncout Use internal SyncOut as FrameSync
bcmPortPhyTimesyncFramesyncCpu CPU based immediate FrameSync

The feature types are shown in PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_FRAMESYNC_v .

bcm_port_phy_timesync_framesync_t
mode framesync mode
length_threshold syncin threshold for framesync
event_offset event offset for framesync

The feature types are shown in PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_SYNCOUT_MODE_v .

bcm_port_phy_timesync_syncout_mode_t
bcmPortPhyTimesyncSyncoutDisable Do nothing
bcmPortPhyTimesyncSyncoutOneTime One time SYNC pulse on a match with the timesync heartbeat
bcmPortPhyTimesyncSyncoutPulseTrain Pulse train on SyncOut
bcmPortPhyTimesyncSyncoutPulseTrainWithSync Combination of pulse train and one time SYNC

The feature types are shown in PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_SYNCOUT_v .

bcm_port_phy_timesync_syncout_t
mode; syncout mode
pulse_1_length; pulse 1 length in ns
pulse_2_length; pulse 2 length in ns
interval; interval in ns
syncout_ts; syncout timestamp

The feature types are shown in PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_TIMER_ADJUST_v

bcm_port_phy_timesync_timer_adjust_t
mode Timer adjustment mode
delta Timer adjustment delta value

The feature types are shown in PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_INBAND_CONTROL_v

bcm_port_phy_timesync_inband_control_t
flags Inband Timestamping flags (BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_INBAND_* flags)
resv0_id Resv0 ID used
timer_mode Timer mode

The feature types are shown in PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_MSG_v

bcm_port_phy_timesync_msg_t
bcmPortPhyTimesyncMsgSync Sync
bcmPortPhyTimesyncMsgDelayReq Delay Request
bcmPortPhyTimesyncMsgPdelayReq PDelay Request
bcmPortPhyTimesyncMsgPdelayResp PDelay Response

bcm_port_phy_timesync_prot_t

bcmPortPhyTimesyncProtIpv4Udp 1588 over IPv4 UDP
bcmbcmPortPhyTimesyncProtIpv6Udp 1588 over IPv6 UDP

bcmPortPhyTimesyncDirIngress Igress Packet

The feature types are shown in PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_TIMER_MODE_v

bcm_port_phy_timesync_timer_mode_t
PortPhyTimesyncTimerModeNone No TimeSync timer
PortPhyTimesyncTimerModeDefault Use the default TimeSync timer
PortPhyTimesyncTimerMode32bit Use 32-bit TimeSync timer
PortPhyTimesyncTimerMode48bit Use 48-bit TimeSync timer
PortPhyTimesyncTimerMode64bit Use 64-bit TimeSync timer
PortPhyTimesyncTimerMode80bit Use 80-bit TimeSync timer

The feature types are shown in PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_MPLS_LABEL_v

bcm_port_phy_timesync_mpls_label_t
value label value (bcm_mpls_label_t)
mask label mask (bcm_mpls_label_t)
flags MPLS label flags (BCM_PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_MPLS_* flags)

bcm_port_phy_timesync_mpls_control_t
flags MPLS control flags
special_label special label value (bcm_port_phy_timesync_mpls_label_t)
labels Timesync MPLS labels (bcm_port_phy_timesync_mpls_label_t)
size Number of elements in label array

The feature types are shown in PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_EVENT_MESSAGE_EGRESS_MODE_v

bcm_port_phy_timesync_event_message_egress_mode_t
Value Description
bcmPortPhyTimesyncEventMessageEgressModeNone Do not modify
bcmPortPhyTimesyncEventMessageEgressModeUpdateCorrectionField Update correction field (CF(existing) + TS(txsop))
bcmPortPhyTimesyncEventMessageEgressModeReplaceCorrectionFieldOrigin Replace correction field with delay since framesync (TS(txsop) - TS(1pps)) and original timecode
bcmPortPhyTimesyncEventMessageEgressModeCaptureTimestamp Capture TX timestamp

The feature types are shown in PORT_PHY_TIMESYNC_EVENT_MESSAGE_INGRESS_MODE_v

bcm_port_phy_timesync_event_message_ingress_mode_t
Value Description
bcmPortPhyTimesyncEventMessageIngressModeNone Do not modify
bcmPortPhyTimesyncEventMessageIngressModeUpdateCorrectionField Update correction field (CF(existing) - TS(rxsop))
bcmPortPhyTimesyncEventMessageIngressModeInsertTimestamp Insert timestamp from 48 bit NCO (TS(rxsop))
bcmPortPhyTimesyncEventMessageIngressModeInsertDelaytime Insert delay (TS(rxsop) - TS(1pps))
Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portPort number.
[in]conf

◆ bcm_port_phy_timesync_config_t_init()

void bcm_port_phy_timesync_config_t_init ( bcm_port_phy_timesync_config_t *  conf)

Initialize a Port Configuration structure.

Initializes a port configuration structure to default values. This function should be used to initialize any Port Configuration structure prior to filling it out and passing it to an API function. This ensures that subsequent API releases may add new structure members to the bcm_port_phy_timesync_config_t structure, and bcm_port_phy_timesync_config_t_init will initialize the new members to correct default values.

Parameters
[in,out]conf
Return values
NONE.

◆ bcm_port_phy_timesync_enhanced_capture_get()

)

bcm_port_phy_timesync_enhanced_capture_t
msg_type Message type
protocol Protocol type
direction Direction type
seq_id Sequence ID
domain Domain
timestamp Timestamp
source_port_identity Source port identity
source_port Source port
vlan_id Vlan ID
Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port number
[out]value

◆ bcm_port_pipe_pbmp_get()

int bcm_port_pipe_pbmp_get ( int  unit,
int  pipe,
bcm_pbmp_t *  pbmp 
)

Get the port bitmap of a given pipe.

For Tomahawk4 chips, there are 16 device pipes, however bcm_port_config_get only get port bit map of no more than 8 pipes. So if customers want to get port bit map of each pipe, they can use this API.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]pipePipe ID.
[out]pbmpPort bitmap of the given pipe.

◆ bcm_port_policer_get()

int bcm_port_policer_get ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
bcm_policer_t *  policer_id 
)

Retrieve the Policer ID associated for the specified physical port.

Applicable to: XCore architecture. Retrieve the Policer ID associated for the specified physical port.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portPort
[out]policer_idPolicer ID.
Return values
BCM_E_XXX

◆ bcm_port_policer_set()

int bcm_port_policer_set ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
bcm_policer_t  policer_id 
)

Set the Policer ID associated for the specified physical port.

Applicable to: XCore architecture. Associate a given policer ID to the specified physical port. The policer is used for Ingress policing only.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portPort
[in]policer_idPolicer ID.
Return values
BCM_E_XXX

◆ bcm_port_pon_info_get()

bcm_port_t  pon_port,
bcm_port_pon_info_t *  info 
)

Get or set multiple port characteristics for PON and link port.

Get or set multiple port characteristics for PON and link port. Only "enable" and "loopback" can be configured in set API.

[in]unitUnit number.
[in]pon_portPhysical port to query or set PON port information on.
[out]infoPointer to PON port information structure (see BCM_PORT_PON_INFO_t).

◆ bcm_port_preemption_control_get()

int bcm_port_preemption_control_get ( int  unit,
bcm_gport_t  gport,
bcm_port_preempt_control_t  type,
uint32 *  arg 
)

Get or set various configurations for Preemption.

Control or examine various configuration for preemption. bcm_port_preemption_control_set can be used to setup various configuration. The <type> parameter to the API identifies the configuration to be acccess. bcm_port_preemption_control_get returns the current value of the preemption feature identified by <type> parameter. The feature types are show in bcm_port_preempt_control_t :

bcm_port_preempt_control_t
Type Description
bcmPortPreemptControlPreemptionSupport Support preemption operation
bcmPortPreemptControlQueueBitmap Specify the preemptable queue in bitmap
bcmPortPreemptControlEnableTx Enable preemption in transmit direction
bcmPortPreemptControlVerifyEnable Enable preemption verify operation.
bcmPortPreemptControlVerifyTime The wait time in ms between verification attempts
bcmPortPreemptControlVerifyAttempts The number of verification attempts.
bcmPortPreemptControlNonFinalFragSizeTx The minimum size of non-final fragment of a packet in transmit direction
bcmPortPreemptControlFinalFragSizeTx The minimum size of final fragment of a packet in transmit direction.
bcmPortPreemptControlNonFinalFragSizeRx The minimum size of non-final fragment of a packet in receive direction
bcmPortPreemptControlFinalFragSizeRx The minimum size of final fragment of a packet in receive direction
bcmPortPreemptControlHoldReqCntMode The MMU preemption request count mode for snmpBcmMacMergeHoldCount
Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]gportgport id
[in]typepreemption control type defined in bcm_port_preempt_control_t
[out]argthe preemption control value

◆ bcm_port_preemption_control_set()

int bcm_port_preemption_control_set ( int  unit,
bcm_gport_t  gport,
bcm_port_preempt_control_t  type,
uint32  arg 
)

Get or set various configurations for Preemption.

Control or examine various configuration for preemption. bcm_port_preemption_control_set can be used to setup various configuration. The <type> parameter to the API identifies the configuration to be acccess. bcm_port_preemption_control_get returns the current value of the preemption feature identified by <type> parameter. The feature types are show in bcm_port_preempt_control_t :

bcm_port_preempt_control_t
Type Description
bcmPortPreemptControlPreemptionSupport Support preemption operation
bcmPortPreemptControlQueueBitmap Specify the preemptable queue in bitmap
bcmPortPreemptControlEnableTx Enable preemption in transmit direction
bcmPortPreemptControlVerifyEnable Enable preemption verify operation.
bcmPortPreemptControlVerifyTime The wait time in ms between verification attempts
bcmPortPreemptControlVerifyAttempts The number of verification attempts.
bcmPortPreemptControlNonFinalFragSizeTx The minimum size of non-final fragment of a packet in transmit direction
bcmPortPreemptControlFinalFragSizeTx The minimum size of final fragment of a packet in transmit direction.
bcmPortPreemptControlNonFinalFragSizeRx The minimum size of non-final fragment of a packet in receive direction
bcmPortPreemptControlFinalFragSizeRx The minimum size of final fragment of a packet in receive direction
bcmPortPreemptControlHoldReqCntMode The MMU preemption request count mode for snmpBcmMacMergeHoldCount
Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]gportgport id
[in]typepreemption control type defined in bcm_port_preempt_control_t
[in]argthe preemption control value

◆ bcm_port_preemption_status_get()

int bcm_port_preemption_status_get ( int  unit,
bcm_gport_t  gport,
bcm_port_preempt_status_t  type,
uint32 *  status 
)

Get the specified preemption status.

Get the specified preemption status For bcmPortPreemptStatusTx type, the status value defined in bcm_port_preempt_status_tx_t For bcmPortPreemptStatusVerify type, the status value defined in bcm_port_preempt_status_verify_t

bcm_port_preempt_status_tx_t
Type Description
bcmPortPreemptStatusTxInactive Verify is enabled but its status is either failed or not initiated. Or Preemption is not enabled
bcmPortPreemptStatusTxVerifying Preemption is enabled and proceeding the verify operation
bcmPortPreemptStatusTxActive Preemption is activated

bcm_port_preempt_status_verify_t
Type Description
bcmPortPreemptStatusVerifyDisabled Verify operation is not enabled.
bcmPortPreemptStatusVerifyInitial Verify operation is enabled but the not started yet
bcmPortPreemptStatusVerifyInProgress Verify operation is in progress
bcmPortPreemptStatusVerifySucceeded Verify operation is succeeded
bcmPortPreemptStatusVerifyFailed Verify operation is failed
Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]gportgport id
[in]typepreemption status type defined in bcm_port_preempt_status_t
[out]statusThe preemption status For bcmPortPreemptStatusTx type, the status value defined in bcm_port_preempt_status_tx_t. For bcmPortPreemptStatusVerify type, the status value defined in bcm_port_preempt_status_verify_t.

◆ bcm_port_priority_color_get()

int bcm_port_priority_color_get ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
int  prio,
bcm_color_t *  color 
)

Set or retrieve color assignment for a given port and priority.

Assign or examine the color with which packets are marked when they arrive on the given port with the specified priority in the VLAN control index.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port number
[in]prioVLAN priority (aka 802.1p CoS)
[out]colorOne of the BCM color selections: bcmColorGreen, bcmColorYellow, bcmColorRed, bcmColorDropFirst, bcmColorPreserve

◆ bcm_port_priority_color_set()

◆ bcm_port_priority_config_get()

int bcm_port_priority_config_get ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
bcm_port_prio_config_t *  priority_config 
)

Retrieve the port priority group configuration.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]port
[out]priority_config

◆ bcm_port_priority_config_set()

int bcm_port_priority_config_set ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
bcm_port_prio_config_t *  port_priority_config 
)

Configure priority groups for the port. Priority group is meant to connect one or more user priorities (see BCM_PORT_F_PRIORITY_*) to a scheduler priority (High, Low, TDM) Each priority group acts as a logical FIFO. The size of the FIFO can be dynamically specified, in entries.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]port
[in]port_priority_config

◆ bcm_port_priority_group_config_get()

int bcm_port_priority_group_config_get ( int  unit,
bcm_gport_t  gport,
int  priority_group,
bcm_port_priority_group_config_t *  prigrp_config 
)

Set/get the port priority group configuration.

Set/get the port Priority Group configuration. The structure bcm_port_priority_group_config_t is used to describte the attributes of a Priority Group.

typedef struct bcm_port_priority_group_config_s {
int shared_pool_xoff_enable; // enable/disable of triggering PFC messages of the Priority Group when exceeds egress shared pool xoff threshold
int shared_pool_discard_enable; // enable/disable of dropping packets of the Priority Group when exceeds egress shared pool discard threshold
int pfc_transmit_enable; // enable/disable of transmitting PFC message even in IBP state
uint16 priority_enable_vector_mask; // Priority enable vector mask that mapped to PriorityEnableVector field in the PFC message
} bcm_port_priority_group_config_t;
Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]gportgeneric port
[in]priority_grouppriority group id
[out]prigrp_config(INOUT) structure describes port priority group configuration

◆ bcm_port_priority_group_config_set()

int bcm_port_priority_group_config_set ( int  unit,
bcm_gport_t  gport,
int  priority_group,
bcm_port_priority_group_config_t *  prigrp_config 
)

Set/get the port priority group configuration.

Set/get the port Priority Group configuration. The structure bcm_port_priority_group_config_t is used to describte the attributes of a Priority Group.

typedef struct bcm_port_priority_group_config_s {
int shared_pool_xoff_enable; // enable/disable of triggering PFC messages of the Priority Group when exceeds egress shared pool xoff threshold
int shared_pool_discard_enable; // enable/disable of dropping packets of the Priority Group when exceeds egress shared pool discard threshold
int pfc_transmit_enable; // enable/disable of transmitting PFC message even in IBP state
uint16 priority_enable_vector_mask; // Priority enable vector mask that mapped to PriorityEnableVector field in the PFC message
} bcm_port_priority_group_config_t;
Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]gportgeneric port
[in]priority_grouppriority group id
[in]prigrp_config(INOUT) structure describes port priority group configuration

◆ bcm_port_priority_group_config_t_init()

void bcm_port_priority_group_config_t_init ( bcm_port_priority_group_config_t *  prigrp_config)

Initialize a port priority group configuration struct.

Initializes a Priority Group configuration structure to default values. This function should be used to initialize any Priority Group configuration structure prior to filling it out and passing it to an API function.

Parameters
[in,out]prigrp_configPointer to the priority group configuration object struct.
Return values
NONE.

◆ bcm_port_probe()

int bcm_port_probe ( int  unit,
bcm_pbmp_t  pbmp,
bcm_pbmp_t *  okay_pbmp 
)

Probe the port to determine the proper MAC and PHY drivers.

Under normal conditions this routine should not be called. bcm_port_init performs this function during initialization. When used in conjunction with bcm_port_detach, systems that supports adding and removing external PHY devices must use this routine to probe and attached newly added PHYs. On successful probe, the port subsystem installs internal drivers for the PHYs allowing the rest of the configuration to be completed using the bcm_port_xxx APIs. Calls made to the BCM API on ports that have not been successfully probed are undefined and may have catastrophic results. All port state is undefined after an attach, and should be explicitly programmed.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]pbmpPort bit map indicating the ports to probe
[out]okay_pbmpReturn value indicating the ports successfully probed

◆ bcm_port_protocol_vlan_add()

int bcm_port_protocol_vlan_add ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
bcm_port_frametype_t  frame,
bcm_port_ethertype_t  ether,
bcm_vlan_t  vid 
)

Add or delete a protocol-based VLAN.

Add or remove a protocol-based VLAN based on frame type and ether type. The ether type is a 16-bit value that matches the EtherType field in the received packet. If the received packet is untagged and the ether type and the frame type match a protocol-based VLAN then the VLAN assigned to the packet is that specified by bcm_port_protocol_vlan_add. If the underlying device does not support protocol-based VLANs, an error is returned. Protocol-based VLANs can be deleted based on the ether type and frame type using bcm_port_protocol_vlan_delete. If all protocol-based VLANs are to be deleted bcm_port_protocol_vlan_delete_all may be used. On devices supporting the VLAN action APIs, if this API is used instead of the newer bcm_vlan_port_protocol_action_add, an entry is added with ut_outer action bcmVlanActionAdd. All other actions are set to bcmVlanActionNone.

Port Frame Types
Frame Type Meaning
BCM_PORT_FRAMETYPE_8023 802.3 Ethernet packet
BCM_PORT_FRAMETYPE_ETHER2 EtherII packet
BCM_PORT_FRAMETYPE_SNAP SNAP packet
BCM_PORT_FRAMETYPE_LLC LLC frame
BCM_PORT_FRAMETYPE_SNAP_PRIVATE Vendor-specific SNAP packet
Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port number
[in]frameFrame type, as specified in BCM_PORT_FRAMETYPE_e
[in]ether16-bit EtherType.
[in]vidVLAN ID assigned if frame and ether match.

◆ bcm_port_protocol_vlan_delete()

int bcm_port_protocol_vlan_delete ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
bcm_port_frametype_t  frame,
bcm_port_ethertype_t  ether 
)

Add or delete a protocol-based VLAN.

Add or remove a protocol-based VLAN based on frame type and ether type. The ether type is a 16-bit value that matches the EtherType field in the received packet. If the received packet is untagged and the ether type and the frame type match a protocol-based VLAN then the VLAN assigned to the packet is that specified by bcm_port_protocol_vlan_add. If the underlying device does not support protocol-based VLANs, an error is returned. Protocol-based VLANs can be deleted based on the ether type and frame type using bcm_port_protocol_vlan_delete. If all protocol-based VLANs are to be deleted bcm_port_protocol_vlan_delete_all may be used. On devices supporting the VLAN action APIs, if this API is used instead of the newer bcm_vlan_port_protocol_action_add, an entry is added with ut_outer action bcmVlanActionAdd. All other actions are set to bcmVlanActionNone.

Port Frame Types
Frame Type Meaning
BCM_PORT_FRAMETYPE_8023 802.3 Ethernet packet
BCM_PORT_FRAMETYPE_ETHER2 EtherII packet
BCM_PORT_FRAMETYPE_SNAP SNAP packet
BCM_PORT_FRAMETYPE_LLC LLC frame

◆ bcm_port_protocol_vlan_delete_all()

int bcm_port_protocol_vlan_delete_all ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port 
)

Add or delete a protocol-based VLAN.

Add or remove a protocol-based VLAN based on frame type and ether type. The ether type is a 16-bit value that matches the EtherType field in the received packet. If the received packet is untagged and the ether type and the frame type match a protocol-based VLAN then the VLAN assigned to the packet is that specified by bcm_port_protocol_vlan_add. If the underlying device does not support protocol-based VLANs, an error is returned. Protocol-based VLANs can be deleted based on the ether type and frame type using bcm_port_protocol_vlan_delete. If all protocol-based VLANs are to be deleted bcm_port_protocol_vlan_delete_all may be used. On devices supporting the VLAN action APIs, if this API is used instead of the newer bcm_vlan_port_protocol_action_add, an entry is added with ut_outer action bcmVlanActionAdd. All other actions are set to bcmVlanActionNone.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port number

◆ bcm_port_queued_count_get()

int bcm_port_queued_count_get ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
uint32 *  count 
)

Get the current count of cells or packets queued on a port for transmission.

Returns a count that is either the number of internal device cells (device specific) or the number of packets queued for egress on the specified port. In general, the count returned should only be considered as 0 (indicating there are no packets queued on the port) or >0 (indicating some packets are queued on the port).

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port number.
[out]countReturned count of cells or packets queued for egress on the specified port.

◆ bcm_port_rate_egress_get()

int bcm_port_rate_egress_get ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
uint32 *  kbits_sec,
uint32 *  kbits_burst 
)

Configure a port for egress rate shaping.

Rate limit an egress port given a maximum rate in kilobits per second (kbits_sec) and a burst in kilobits. Since the underlying device has an intrinsic rate granularity, the actual hardware will be programmed to support a metering rate that is at least as permissive as requested. bcm_port_rate_egress_get returns the current rate configuration. The returned rate and burst size are the actual values, and not necessarily those programmed use bcm_port_rate_egress_set.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port number
[out]kbits_secLimit in kilobits (1000) per second. A value of zero disables rate limiting (full speed).
[out]kbits_burstMaximum burst size in kilobits (1000 bits).

◆ bcm_port_rate_egress_pps_get()

int bcm_port_rate_egress_pps_get ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
uint32 *  pps,
uint32 *  burst 
)

Configure a port for egress rate shaping in packet mode.

Rate limit an egress port given a maximum rate in packet per second (pps) and a burst in kilobits. Since the underlying device has an intrinsic rate granularity, the actual hardware will be programmed to support a metering rate that is at least as permissive as requested. bcm_port_rate_egress_pps_get returns the current rate configuration in pps. The returned rate and burst size are the actual values, and not necessarily those programmed use bcm_port_rate_egress_pps_set.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port number
[out]ppsRate in packet per second. A value of zero disables rate limiting (full speed).
[out]burstMaximum burst size.

◆ bcm_port_rate_egress_pps_set()

int bcm_port_rate_egress_pps_set ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
uint32  pps,
uint32  burst 
)

Configure a port for egress rate shaping in packet mode.

Rate limit an egress port given a maximum rate in packet per second (pps) and a burst in kilobits. Since the underlying device has an intrinsic rate granularity, the actual hardware will be programmed to support a metering rate that is at least as permissive as requested. bcm_port_rate_egress_pps_get returns the current rate configuration in pps. The returned rate and burst size are the actual values, and not necessarily those programmed use bcm_port_rate_egress_pps_set.

[in]ppsRate in packet per second. A value of zero disables rate limiting (full speed).

◆ bcm_port_rate_egress_set()

int bcm_port_rate_egress_set ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
uint32  kbits_sec,
uint32  kbits_burst 
)

Configure a port for egress rate shaping.

Rate limit an egress port given a maximum rate in kilobits per second (kbits_sec) and a burst in kilobits. Since the underlying device has an intrinsic rate granularity, the actual hardware will be programmed to support a metering rate that is at least as permissive as requested. bcm_port_rate_egress_get returns the current rate configuration.
