◆ bcm_port_rate_ingress_get()

int bcm_port_rate_ingress_get ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
uint32 *  kbits_sec,
uint32 *  kbits_burst 
)

Configure a port for ingress rate policing.

Rate limit an ingress port given a maximum rate in kilobits per second (kbits_sec) and a burst in kilobits. Since the underlying device has an intrinsic rate granularity, the actual hardware will be programmed to support a metering rate that is at least as permissive as requested. When the port exceeds the requested values, packets are dropped. bcm_port_rate_ingress_get returns the current rate configuration. The returned rate and burst size are the actual values, and not necessarily those programmed use bcm_port_rate_ingress_set. If the returned kbits_sec value is 0, rate limiting is disabled.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portPort to configure
[out]kbits_secLimit in kilobits (1000) per second. A value of zero disables rate limiting (full speed).
[out]kbits_burstMaximum burst size in kilobits (1000 bits).

◆ bcm_port_rate_ingress_set()

int bcm_port_rate_ingress_set ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
uint32  kbits_sec,
uint32  kbits_burst 
)

Configure a port for ingress rate policing.

Rate limit an ingress port given a maximum rate in kilobits per second (kbits_sec) and a burst in kilobits. Since the underlying device has an intrinsic rate granularity, the actual hardware will be programmed to support a metering rate that is at least as permissive as requested. When the port exceeds the requested values, packets are dropped. bcm_port_rate_ingress_get returns the current rate configuration. The returned rate and burst size are the actual values, and not necessarily those programmed use bcm_port_rate_ingress_set. If the returned kbits_sec value is 0, rate limiting is disabled.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portPort to configure
[in]kbits_secLimit in kilobits (1000) per second. A value of zero disables rate limiting (full speed).
[in]kbits_burstMaximum burst size in kilobits (1000 bits).

◆ bcm_port_rate_pause_get()

int bcm_port_rate_pause_get ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
uint32 *  kbits_pause,
uint32 *  kbits_resume 
)

Configure a port's ingress rate limiting pause frame control parameters.

Rate limit an ingress port given a maximum rate in kilobits per second (kbits_sec) and a burst in kilobits. Since the underlying device has an intrinsic rate granularity, the actual hardware will be programmed to support a metering rate that is at least as permissive as requested. When the port exceeds the requested values, packets are dropped. bcm_port_rate_ingress_get returns the current rate configuration. The returned rate and burst size are the actual values, and not necessarily those programmed use bcm_port_rate_egress_set. If the returned kbits_sec value is 0, rate limiting is disabled. Set the hardware such that the requested ingress pause frame parameters are implemented. If the maximum of bits that could be received before dropping a frame falls below the kbits_pause threshold, a pause frame is sent. A resume frame will be sent when it becomes possible once again to receive kbits_resume bits of data. Since hardware has an intrinsic pause threshold granularity, the actual hardware will be programmed to support pause behavior that is at least as conservative as requested.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port number
[out]kbits_pausePause threshold in kbits (1000 bits). A value of zero disables the pause/resume mechanism.
[out]kbits_resumeResume threshold in kbits (1000 bits).

◆ bcm_port_rate_pause_set()

int bcm_port_rate_pause_set ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
uint32  kbits_pause,
uint32  kbits_resume 
)

Configure a port's ingress rate limiting pause frame control parameters.

Rate limit an ingress port given a maximum rate in kilobits per second (kbits_sec) and a burst in kilobits. Since the underlying device has an intrinsic rate granularity, the actual hardware will be programmed to support a metering rate that is at least as permissive as requested. When the port exceeds the requested values, packets are dropped. bcm_port_rate_ingress_get returns the current rate configuration. The returned rate and burst size are the actual values, and not necessarily those programmed use bcm_port_rate_egress_set. If the returned kbits_sec value is 0, rate limiting is disabled. Set the hardware such that the requested ingress pause frame parameters are implemented. If the maximum of bits that could be received before dropping a frame falls below the kbits_pause threshold, a pause frame is sent. A resume frame will be sent when it becomes possible once again to receive kbits_resume bits of data. Since hardware has an intrinsic pause threshold granularity, the actual hardware will be programmed to support pause behavior that is at least as conservative as requested.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port number
[in]kbits_pausePause threshold in kbits (1000 bits). A value of zero disables the pause/resume mechanism.
[in]kbits_resumeResume threshold in kbits (1000 bits).

◆ bcm_port_redirect_config_get()

int bcm_port_redirect_config_get ( int  unit,
bcm_gport_t  gport,
bcm_port_redirect_config_t *  redirect_config 
)

Configure/retrieve port redirection data.

Configure/retrieve port redirection data. When you do not pass any redirection flag types in the configuration structure, the redirection on the particular port would be disabled.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]gport
[in,out]redirect_config

◆ bcm_port_redirect_config_set()

bcm_gport_t  port,
bcm_port_redirect_config_t *  redirect_config

Parameters

[in]portport number
[in]redirect_config

◆ bcm_port_redirect_config_t_init()

void bcm_port_redirect_config_t_init ( bcm_port_redirect_config_t *  redirect_config)

Initialize a port redirection structure.

Initializes a redirection configuration structure to default values. This function should be used to initialize any port redirection configuration structure prior to filling it out and passing it to an API function.

Parameters
[in,out]redirect_config(INOUT) Pointer to the priority redirection configuration structure.
Return values
NONE.

◆ bcm_port_remove()

int bcm_port_remove ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
uint32  flags 
)

add/remove/get port

Allows for dynamic NIF port configuration changes. Calling bcm_petra_port_add must be done on detached ports.

bcm_port_interface_config_t
Field Type Description
phy_port uint32 related physical port (first physical port for multi-lane interfaces)
interface bcm_port_if_t interface of port (See BCM_PORT_IF_types table for supported interface types)
num_lanes uint32 number of lanes the interface occupies
phy_pbmp bcm_pbmp_t bitmap of phy lanes occupied by the interface(relevant only for ILKN interface)
interface_id uint32 interface id(relevant only for ILKN interface)
max_speed int The supported port max speed via legacy flex port operations, i.e. the max speed provisioned through soc property port_map.

bcm_port_mapping_info_t
Field Type Description
channel uint32 related port channel
core int related port core id
tm_port uint32 corresponding tm port
base_q_pair uint32 corresponding base queue pair (relevant in case BCM_PORT_ADD_BASE_Q_PAIR_WITH_ID flag is set)
num_priorities uint32 ports number of priorities
base_uc_queue uint32 base of unicast queue
num_uc_queue uint32 number of unicast queue
base_mc_queue uint32 base of mcast queue
num_mc_queue uint32 number of mcast queue

Port add Flags
Flag Meaning
BCM_PORT_ADD_BASE_Q_PAIR_WITH_ID The id of base queue pair is given in bcm_port_mapping_info_t strcuture.
BCM_PORT_ADD_CONFIG_CHANNELIZED The added port if part of an channelized interface (relevant for non-Interlaken interfaces).
BCM_PORT_ADD_CGM_AUTO_ADJUST_DISABLE disable CGM default adjustments, if set the user is responsible for CGM configuration.
BCM_PORT_ADD_HIGH_GIG Indicate a high gig port.
BCM_PORT_ADD_DONT_PROBE Don't probe(initialize SerDes and MAC) the new physical interface.
BCM_PORT_ADD_USE_PHY_PBMP Use phy_pbmp parameter to indicate interface lanes.
BCM_PORT_ADD_TDM_QUEUING_ON TDM queuing is on for this port, it's handled as a TDM interleaved port.
BCM_PORT_ADD_TDM_PORT Indicate a new TDM port.
BCM_PORT_ADD_IF_TDM_ONLY Indicate if the interface will have only TDM ports
BCM_PORT_ADD_IF_TDM_HYBRID Indicate if the interface will have ome TDM ports and some NON-TDM ports
BCM_PORT_ADD_KBP_PORT Inidicate that port is allocated for KBP
BCM_PORT_ADD_STIF_PORT Inidicate that port is allocated for Statistic Interface
BCM_PORT_ADD_RCY_MIRROR_PRIORITY_HIGH Inidicate that the high proirty contex will be allocated for the port
BCM_PORT_ADD_RCY_MIRROR_PRIORITY_NORMAL Inidicate that the normal proirty contex will be allocated for the port
BCM_PORT_ADD_ILKN_OVER_FABRIC_PORT Indicate it is an over fabric port
BCM_PORT_ADD_CROSS_CONNECT Indicate it is a cross connect port

Port remove Flags
Flag Meaning
BCM_PORT_REMOVE_SCH_ONLY Remove scheduler only from the port

Port interfaces
Flag Meaning
BCM_PORT_IF_SGMII SGMII interface.
BCM_PORT_IF_CAUI CAUI interface.
BCM_PORT_IF_RXAUI RXAUI interface.
BCM_PORT_IF_XFI XFI interface.
BCM_PORT_IF_XLAUI XLAUI interface.
BCM_PORT_IF_ILKN INTERLAKEN interface.
BCM_PORT_IF_XAUI XAUI interface.
BCM_PORT_IF_CPU CPU interface (phy port must be 0).
BCM_PORT_IF_EVENTOR Eventor interface (phy port must be 0).
BCM_PORT_IF_RCY_MIRROR Recycle mirror interface (phy port must be 0).
BCM_PORT_IF_SCH SCH interface.
Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port number.
[in]flags(for "_set") See BCM_PORT_ADD_flags for details.
(for "_get") See BCM_PORT_ADD_flags for details.

◆ bcm_port_resource_default_get()

int bcm_port_resource_default_get ( int  unit,
bcm_gport_t  port,
uint32  flags,
bcm_port_resource_t *  resource 
)

Get suggested default resource values prior to calling bcm_port_resource_set.

This API fills default values in the provided resource struct, based on the given input values of the struct members. To get the default value of a resource struct member- set its value to -1. To give a value of a resource struct member as input- its value should be different from -1. resource->speed is mandatory to be given as input. The function will get all the -1 values of resource and fill them with default suggested values according to the filled values.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port number
[in]flagsAPI flags
[in,out]resource(INOUT) Port resource configuration

◆ bcm_port_resource_get()

int bcm_port_resource_get ( int  unit,
bcm_gport_t  port,
bcm_port_resource_t *  resource 
)

Get the port resource configuration.

Gets the port resource configuration for the specified logical port.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port number.
[out]resourcePort resource configuration.

◆ bcm_port_resource_multi_set()

int bcm_port_resource_multi_set ( int  unit,
int  nport,
bcm_port_resource_t *  resource 
)

Performs a FlexPort operation changing the port resources for a set of ports.

Performs a FlexPort operation changing the port resources for a set of ports:

  • Logical to Physical port mapping
  • Speed
  • Number of PHY lanes
  • Encapsulation mode The functions bcm_port_resource_set and bcm_port_resource_multi_set can be used to perform a FlexPort operation to change the port resource configuration such as the port seed, number of PHY lanes, encapsulation mode, as well as the logical to physical port mapping. The goal of the APIs is leave no ambiguities as to what the resulting port configuration is. SDK should not make any best guesses. SDK will validate that the information provide is correct.
  • Operation: The API can perform a set of FlexPort operations. This can involve one or more TSC-4/TSC12 port blocks. For example, 4x10GE to 40GE, 8x10GE to 2x40GE (this involves 2 TSC-4 port blocks).
  • Port Information Array: The provided array must contain the mapping specifications for all the ports that are involved in the FlexPort operation. Applications should always specify to clear or delete any existing ports which are part of the FlexPort operation even if the ports mapping remain after the FlexPort operation. A clear or delete is specified by setting the physical port field value to -1.
  • Order of Array Elements: Any clear or delete array element (i.e. physical port is -1) must be first in the array list. In addition to bring down the ports affected by the FlexPort operation, it is the application's responsibility to remove all references to any reassigned logical port number before port reconfiguration, in addition to re-programming after the FlexPort operation if needed. If this is not performed, then the per-port properties and forwarding logic will retain the configuration of the previous personality of the logical port number and the behavior is undefined. For example, when a HG port is ch anged into an Ethernet port, with only ENCAP changed, the Ethernet port properties will retain the configuration of HG port. Applications need to reconfigure the Ethernet port properties to make the port work. Forwarding tables are not modified as part of the FlexPort operation, even though they may refer to port numbers that are either invalid or reused to refer to a different port. Customer software must modify these tables. In particular, the FlexPort sequence assumes that a port will not be part of any forwarding table immediately after the reconfiguration completes. Applications need to reconfigure switch logic on new or remapped ports. A new or remapped logical port created after a FlexPort operation will look like a port that is brought up after the SDK initialization. Also, applications should stop any thread that makes references to logical ports, such as the counter DMA thread or linkscan.
Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]nportNumber of elements in array resource.
[in]resourcePort resource configuration.

◆ bcm_port_resource_set()

int bcm_port_resource_set ( int  unit,
bcm_gport_t  port,
bcm_port_resource_t *  resource 
)

Perform a FlexPort operation changing the port resources for a given logical port.

Performs a FlexPort operation changing the port resources for a given logical port:

  • Logical to Physical port mapping
  • Speed
  • Number of PHY lanes
  • Encapsulation mode
Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port number.
[in]resourcePort resource configuration.

◆ bcm_port_resource_speed_config_validate()

int bcm_port_resource_speed_config_validate ( int  unit,
bcm_port_resource_t *  resource,
bcm_pbmp_t *  pbmp 
)

Validate a port's speed configuration on the BCM56980 by fetching the affected ports.

This API can be used to provide the user information if the new requested speed from a logical port can be done without affecting the other sister ports on the same core or not. If the new function returns BCM_E_NONE, it implies that the new speed config can be honored without affecting the other sister ports on the same core. If the new function returns BCM_E_PARAM, then it implies that in order to honor this port speed config change, some of the sister ports on the same core will be affected, and the affected sister ports will be listed as pbmp in the outer parameter of the same function. Here an assumption is made in terms of what will be the affected sister ports, that is all the ports using the OVCO will be returned as the affected sister ports. Since any change to the TVCO will affect all the ports on the same core, this case should be avoided as much as possible.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]resourcePort Resource Configuration
[out]pbmpPort bitmap of ports affected by resource

◆ bcm_port_resource_speed_get()

int bcm_port_resource_speed_get ( int  unit,
bcm_gport_t  port,
bcm_port_resource_t *  resource 
)

Get/Modify the speed for a given port.

Get/Modify the speed for a given port. Note that the parameter "port" will be used to determine the associated physical port. When setting speed, corresponding MAC/PHY settings may get updated. User/application needs to re-apply any custom settings.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portLogical Port number
[out]resourceSpeed settings

◆ bcm_port_resource_speed_multi_set()

int bcm_port_resource_speed_multi_set ( int  unit,
int  nport,
bcm_port_resource_t *  resource 
)

Modify the Port Speeds for a set of ports in a single Port Macro.

Modify the Port Speeds for a set of ports in a single Port Macro. When setting speed, corresponding MAC/PHY settings may get updated. User/application needs to re-apply any custom settings. It is not recommended to configure phy_lane_config when link_training is enabled.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]nportNumber of elements in resource array
[in]resourcePort Resource configuration array

◆ bcm_port_resource_speed_set()

bcm_gport_t  port,
bcm_port_resource_t *  resource

Get/Modify the speed for a given port.

Get/Modify the speed for a given port. Note that the parameter "port" will be used to determine the associated physical port. When setting speed, corresponding MAC/PHY settings may get updated. User/application needs to re-apply any custom settings. It is not recommended to configure phy_lane_config when link_training is enabled.

◆ bcm_port_resource_t_init()

void bcm_port_resource_t_init ( bcm_port_resource_t *  resource)

Initialize a Port Resource Configuration structure.

Initializes a port resource configuration structure to default values. This function should be used to initialize any Port Resource configuration structure prior to filling it out and passing it to an API function. This ensures that subsequent API releases may add new structure members to the bcm_port_resouce_t structure, and bcm_port_resource_t_init will initialize the new members to correct default values.

Parameters
[in,out]resource(INOUT) Pointer to Port Resource data structure to initialize.
Return values
NONE.

◆ bcm_port_resource_traverse()

int bcm_port_resource_traverse ( int  unit,
bcm_port_resource_traverse_cb  trav_fn,
void *  user_data 
)

Iterate over the port resource configurations on a given unit and call user-provided callback for every entry.

Iterates over the port resource configurations on a given unit and calls user-provided callback for every entry.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]trav_fnCallback function to execute.
[in]user_dataPointer to any user data.

◆ bcm_port_rlm_config_get()

◆ bcm_port_sample_rate_get()

int bcm_port_sample_rate_get ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
int *  ingress_rate,
int *  egress_rate 
)

Control the sampling of packets ingressing or egressing a port.

The Packet Sampling APIs are building blocks that can be used to implement the sFlow specification (RFC 3176). StrataXGS?III chips can select a random sampling of ingressing or egressing packets and send them to the CPU for profiling purposes. There are also three related switch control parameters to support the implementation of sFlow; see bcm_switch_control_set and bcm_switch_control_port_set :

  • bcmSwitchCpuSamplePrio
  • bcmSwitchSampleIngressRandomSeed
  • bcmSwitchSampleEgressRandomSeed There are two Packet Receive reason codes defined in <bcm/rx.h> to support the implementation of sFlow; see rx_reason_code_table .
  • BCM_RX_PR_SAMPLE_SRC
  • BCM_RX_PR_SAMPLE_DST
Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port number
[out]ingress_rateEvery 1/ingress_rate ingressing packets will be sampled; 0 indicates no sampling while 1 indicates sampling all packets
[out]egress_rateEvery 1/egress_rate egressing packets will be sampled; 0 indicates no sampling while 1 indicates sampling all packets

◆ bcm_port_sample_rate_set()

int bcm_port_sample_rate_set ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
int  ingress_rate,
int  egress_rate 
)

Control the sampling of packets ingressing or egressing a port.

The Packet Sampling APIs are building blocks that can be used to implement the sFlow specification (RFC 3176). StrataXGS?III chips can select a random sampling of ingressing or egressing packets and send them to the CPU for profiling purposes. There are also three related switch control parameters to support the implementation of sFlow; see bcm_switch_control_set and bcm_switch_control_port_set :

  • bcmSwitchCpuSamplePrio
  • bcmSwitchSampleIngressRandomSeed
  • bcmSwitchSampleEgressRandomSeed There are two Packet Receive reason codes defined in <bcm/rx.h> to support the implementation of sFlow; see rx_reason_code_table .
  • BCM_RX_PR_SAMPLE_SRC
  • BCM_RX_PR_SAMPLE_DST
Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port number
[in]ingress_rateEvery 1/ingress_rate ingressing packets will be sampled; 0 indicates no sampling while 1 indicates sampling all packets
[in]egress_rateEvery 1/egress_rate egressing packets will be sampled; 0 indicates no sampling while 1 indicates sampling all packets

◆ bcm_port_selective_get()

int bcm_port_selective_get ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
bcm_port_info_t *  info 
)

Get or set multiple port characteristics.

bcm_port_info_get and bcm_port_info_set get and set all valid settings for the specific device and port in question. For these calls the action_mask field of the bcm_port_info_t structure is ignored on entry, but defined to contain the valid action mask bits on return. For all set operations, if both auto-negotiation is enabled and the speed or duplex are forced to a specific setting, the result is undefined. bcm_port_selective_get and bcm_port_selective_set operate similar to bcm_port_info_get and bcm_port_info_set with the exception that action_mask is used to determine which attributes to set or retrieve. bcm_port_info_save and bcm_port_info_restore provide a mechanism to save all valid port state and restore it later. The info parameter to bcm_port_info_save must be passed unaltered to bcm_port_info_restore to restore the previous port state. Any changes to the info structure results in undefined behavior. In the case of setting or restoring port configuration, if the API call returns an error the port state is undefined. Other than as is required for proper functionality, the order is which the configuration options are applied is undefined. Similarly when retrieving options, if an error is returned the entire contents of the info structure are undefined. For example, all three implementations of the function sample_port_speed_get below perform the same function.

#include <bcm/port.h>
// Sample port_speed_get that calls the bcm_port_speed_get function directly.
int
sample_port_speed_get(int unit, bcm_port_t port)
{
int speed;
if (bcm_port_speed_get(unit, port, &speed) != BCM_E_NONE) {
return -1;
} else {
return speed;
}
}

is functionally equivalent to:

#include <bcm/port.h>
// Sample port speed get function that calls the bcm_port_selective_get function.
int
sample_port_speed_get(int unit, bcm_port_t port)
{
bcm_port_info_t info;
info.action_mask = BCM_PORT_ATTR_SPEED_MASK;
if (bcm_port_selective_get(unit, port, &info) != BCM_E_NONE) {
return -1;
} else {
return info.speed;
}
}

While similar to the previous two example, there is one significant difference in the follow sample: All port information is recovered, so if a failure occurs retrieving any of the values, the operation is aborted. In this case, the speed value is undefined.

#include <bcm/port.h>
// Sample port speed get function that calls the bcm_port_info_get function.
int
sample_port_speed_get(int unit, bcm_port_t port)
{
bcm_port_info_t info;
if (bcm_port_info_get(unit, port, &info) != BCM_E_NONE) {
return -1;
} else {
return info.speed;
}
}
Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port number
[in,out]infoPointer to port information structure (see Port Information Control Structure (bcm_port_info_t)).

◆ bcm_port_selective_set()

int bcm_port_selective_set ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
bcm_port_info_t *  info 
)

Get or set multiple port characteristics.

bcm_port_info_get and bcm_port_info_set get and set all valid settings for the specific device and port in question. For these calls the action_mask field of the bcm_port_info_t structure is ignored on entry, but defined to contain the valid action mask bits on return. For all set operations, if both auto-negotiation is enabled and the speed or duplex are forced to a specific setting, the result is undefined. bcm_port_selective_get and bcm_port_selective_set operate similar to bcm_port_info_get and bcm_port_info_set with the exception that action_mask is used to determine which attributes to set or retrieve. bcm_port_info_save and bcm_port_info_restore provide a mechanism to save all valid port state and restore it later. The info parameter to bcm_port_info_save must be passed unaltered to bcm_port_info_restore to restore the previous port state. Any changes to the info structure results in undefined behavior. In the case of setting or restoring port configuration, if the API call returns an error the port state is undefined. Other than as is required for proper functionality, the order is which the configuration options are applied is undefined. Similarly when retrieving options, if an error is returned the entire contents of the info structure are undefined. For example, all three implementations of the function sample_port_speed_get below perform the same function.

#include <bcm/port.h>
// Sample port_speed_get that calls the bcm_port_speed_get function directly.
int
sample_port_speed_get(int unit, bcm_port_t port)
{
int speed;
if (bcm_port_speed_get(unit, port, &speed) != BCM_E_NONE) {
return -1;
} else {
return speed;
}
}

is functionally equivalent to:

#include <bcm/port.h>
// Sample port speed get function that calls the bcm_port_selective_get function.
int
sample_port_speed_get(int unit, bcm_port_t port)
{
bcm_port_info_t info;
info.action_mask = BCM_PORT_ATTR_SPEED_MASK;
if (bcm_port_selective_get(unit, port, &info) != BCM_E_NONE) {
return -1;
} else {
return info.speed;
}
}

While similar to the previous two example, there is one significant difference in the follow sample: All port information is recovered, so if a failure occurs retrieving any of the values, the operation is aborted. In this case, the speed value is undefined.

#include <bcm/port.h>
// Sample port speed get function that calls the bcm_port_info_get function.
int
sample_port_speed_get(int unit, bcm_port_t port)
{
bcm_port_info_t info;
if (bcm_port_info_get(unit, port, &info) != BCM_E_NONE) {
return -1;
} else {
return info.speed;
}
}
Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port number
[in]infoPointer to port information structure (see Port Information Control Structure (bcm_port_info_t)).

◆ bcm_port_speed_ability_local_get()

int bcm_port_speed_ability_local_get ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
int  max_num_ability,
bcm_port_speed_ability_t *  abilities_array,
int *  actual_num_ability 
)

Get a local port supported speed ability on BCM56980.

bcm_port_speed_ability_local_get should be used to retrieve all the supported speed that this port can support includes both forced speed and auotnge speed. if the actual number of ability is greater than max_num_ability, then BCM_E_PARAM will be returned, otherwise actual_num_ability will be updated.

// speed_ability supported by a port
typedef struct bcm_port_speed_ability_s {
uint32 speed; // port speed in mbps
uint32 resolved_num_lanes; // autoneg resolved speed num lane
bcm_port_phy_fec_t fec_type; // fec_type for port
bcm_port_medium_t medium; // medium type of a port
bcm_port_phy_pause_t pause; // pause
bcm_port_phy_channel_t channel; // short/long channel for a port
bcm_port_autoneg_mode_t an_mode; // autoneg mode
} bcm_port_speed_ability_t;
Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice port number or logical device
[in]max_num_abilitymax number of ability to advertise
[out]abilities_array
[out]actual_num_ability

◆ bcm_port_speed_get()

int bcm_port_speed_get ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
int *  speed 
)

Get or set the current operating speed of a port.

Set or get the speed of the specified port. bcm_port_speed_set disables auto-negotiation if it is enabled. When setting a speed, if an error is returned the PHY and the MAC may not be properly set for operation. When setting a speed, corresponding MAC/PHY settings may get updated. User/application needs to re-apply any custom settings. On 5656x, 5676x, 5686x and 5697x class of chips, setting a speed on a port that is not supported by the port block (because of the PLL parameters) may result in a failure during reconfiguration. There are also other restrictions in the chip for these class of chips (E.g., different ports within a port block cannot have different speeds when the port block is configured in oversub calendar) which can cause reconfiguring the port to fail. All the limitations/restrictions of the chip and port block will be documented in the data sheet for the respective chips. A value of 0 indicates, set max speed. For correct operation following an error, a valid speed must be set. When retrieving the current speed of a port, if auto-negotiation is enabled the current negotiated speed is returned. If auto-negotiation is in progress or there is no link, speed returned is undefined. If auto-negotiation is disabled, the forced speed of the port is returned regardless of the link state. bcm_port_speed_max returns the maximum possible operating speed of the port based on the attributes of the MAC and the PHY. Note that: From the start of BCM56970, set port speed is a FlexPort operation. Bahaviors of bcm_port_speed_set will follow bcm_port_resource_multi_set.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port number
[out]speedSpeed specified in Mbps.

◆ bcm_port_speed_max()

int bcm_port_speed_max ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
int *  speed 
)

Get or set the current operating speed of a port.

Set or get the speed of the specified port. bcm_port_speed_set disables auto-negotiation if it is enabled. When setting a speed, if an error is returned the PHY and the MAC may not be properly set for operation. When setting a speed, corresponding MAC/PHY settings may get updated. User/application needs to re-apply any custom settings. On 5656x, 5676x, 5686x and 5697x class of chips, setting a speed on a port that is not supported by the port block (because of the PLL parameters) may result in a failure during reconfiguration. There are also other restrictions in the chip for these class of chips (E.g., different ports within a port block cannot have different speeds when the port block is configured in oversub calendar) which can cause reconfiguring the port to fail. All the limitations/restrictions of the chip and port block will be documented in the data sheet for the respective chips. A value of 0 indicates, set max speed. For correct operation following an error, a valid speed must be set. When retrieving the current speed of a port, if auto-negotiation is enabled the current negotiated speed is returned. If auto-negotiation is in progress or there is no link, speed returned is undefined. If auto-negotiation is disabled, the forced speed of the port is returned regardless of the link state. bcm_port_speed_max returns the maximum possible operating speed of the port based on the attributes of the MAC and the PHY. Note that: From the start of BCM56970, set port speed is a FlexPort operation. Bahaviors of bcm_port_speed_set will follow bcm_port_resource_multi_set.

Parameters

[out]speedSpeed specified in Mbps.

◆ bcm_port_speed_set()

int bcm_port_speed_set ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
int  speed 
)

Get or set the current operating speed of a port.

Set or get the speed of the specified port. bcm_port_speed_set disables auto-negotiation if it is enabled. When setting a speed, if an error is returned the PHY and the MAC may not be properly set for operation. When setting a speed, corresponding MAC/PHY settings may get updated. User/application needs to re-apply any custom settings. On 5656x, 5676x, 5686x and 5697x class of chips, setting a speed on a port that is not supported by the port block (because of the PLL parameters) may result in a failure during reconfiguration. There are also other restrictions in the chip for these class of chips (E.g., different ports within a port block cannot have different speeds when the port block is configured in oversub calendar) which can cause reconfiguring the port to fail. All the limitations/restrictions of the chip and port block will be documented in the data sheet for the respective chips. A value of 0 indicates, set max speed. For correct operation following an error, a valid speed must be set. When retrieving the current speed of a port, if auto-negotiation is enabled the current negotiated speed is returned. If auto-negotiation is in progress or there is no link, speed returned is undefined. If auto-negotiation is disabled, the forced speed of the port is returned regardless of the link state. bcm_port_speed_max returns the maximum possible operating speed of the port based on the attributes of the MAC and the PHY. Note that: From the start of BCM56970, set port speed is a FlexPort operation. Bahaviors of bcm_port_speed_set will follow bcm_port_resource_multi_set.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port number
[in]speedSpeed specified in Mbps.

)

Enable/disable packet and byte counters for the selected gport.

This API will initialize statistic collection for the given GPORT (enable=TRUE) or release the HW resources used for the tracking the statistics (enable=FALSE).

[in]portGPORT ID
[in]enableNon-zero to enable counter collection, zero to disable.

◆ bcm_port_stat_multi_get()

int bcm_port_stat_multi_get ( int  unit,
bcm_gport_t  port,
int  nstat,
bcm_port_stat_t *  stat_arr,
uint64 *  value_arr 
)

Get 64-bit/32-bit counter value for multiple port statistic types.

This API will retrieve a set of port statistic values of the types specified in the stat_arr array. Then number of values in the stat_arr array and the available positions in the value_arr array must match the number given in the nstat argument.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portGPORT ID
[in]nstatNumber of elements in stat array
[in]stat_arrCollected statistics descriptors array
[out]value_arrCollected counters values
Return values
BCM_E_XXX

◆ bcm_port_stp_get()

int bcm_port_stp_get ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
int *  state 
)

Set the spanning tree state for a port (single instance spanning tree only).

Used only if there is a single instance of spanning tree running, these functions get and set the spanning tree state for a port. These routines do not interoperate with the multiple spanning tree support defined in Spanning Tree Groups . The application must use either bcm_port_stp_set and bcm_port_spt_get or the multiple spanning tree support routines exclusively. No check is made for using both methods simultaneously and the results are undefined. On many switch devices, no distinction is made between the BLOCKING and LISTENING states. For this reason BCM_STG_STP_BLOCK and BCM_STG_STP_LISTEN should be considered equivalent when calling these APIs. For example, setting a port in BLOCKING state using:

bcm_port_stp_set(unit, port, BCM_STG_STP_BLOCK);

may result in either the BCM_STG_STP_BLOCK or BCM_STG_STP_LISTEN state being returned as the current state for:

bcm_port_stp_get(unit, port, &state);
Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port
[out]stateSpanning tree state, for valid values see BCM_STG_STP_e .

◆ bcm_port_stp_set()

int bcm_port_stp_set ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
int  state 
)

Set the spanning tree state for a port (single instance spanning tree only).

Used only if there is a single instance of spanning tree running, these functions get and set the spanning tree state for a port. These routines do not interoperate with the multiple spanning tree support defined in Spanning Tree Groups . The application must use either bcm_port_stp_set and bcm_port_spt_get or the multiple spanning tree support routines exclusively. No check is made for using both methods simultaneously and the results are undefined. On many switch devices, no distinction is made between the BLOCKING and LISTENING states. For this reason BCM_STG_STP_BLOCK and BCM_STG_STP_LISTEN should be considered equivalent when calling these APIs. For example, setting a port in BLOCKING state using:

bcm_port_stp_set(unit, port, BCM_STG_STP_BLOCK);

may result in either the BCM_STG_STP_BLOCK or BCM_STG_STP_LISTEN state being returned as the current state for:

bcm_port_stp_get(unit, port, &state);
Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port
[in]stateSpanning tree state, for valid values see BCM_STG_STP_e .

◆ bcm_port_subsidiary_ports_get()

int bcm_port_subsidiary_ports_get ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
bcm_pbmp_t *  pbmp 
)

Get the list of ancillary/flex ports belonging to the same port block as the controlling port.

Given a controlling port, this API returns the set of ancillary/flex ports belonging to the group (port block) that can be created by performing Flex-IO operation on the controlling port using API bcm_port_control_set(unit, port, bcmPortControlLanes, lanes). If the input port is not a controlling port, BCM_E_PORT error will be returned.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portControlling port
[out]pbmpList of subsidiary ports in the same block as the controlling port
Return values
BCM_E_XXX

◆ bcm_port_timestamp_adjust_get()

int bcm_port_timestamp_adjust_get ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
bcm_port_timestamp_adjust_t *  ts_adjust 
)

Get or set timestamp OSTS/TSTS adjust.

set/get the timestamp adjustment to/from MAC register.

bcm_port_timestamp_adjust_t
Field BCM Type Description
osts_adjust uint32 OSTS adjust is used for MAC pipeline delay
tsts_adjust uint32 Delay of TS timer from TS clk to TSC_Clk domain
typedef _shr_port_timestamp_adjust_t bcm_port_timestamp_adjust_t;
typedef struct _shr_port_timestamp_adjust_s {
uint32 osts_adjust; // MAC pipeline delay in OSTS
uint32 int tsts_adjust; // Delay of TS timer from TS clk to TSC_Clk domain
} _shr_port_timestamp_adjust_t;
Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port number
[out]ts_adjust(IN/OUT) Pointer to structure to get timestamp OSTS,TSTS information (see BCM_PORT_TIMESTAMP_ADJUST_T)

◆ bcm_port_timesync_config_get()

int bcm_port_timesync_config_get ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
int  array_size,
bcm_port_timesync_config_t *  config_array,
int *  array_count 
)

Get timesync configurations for the port.

Get port and MPLS timesync configurations which is configured for the port. This function returns timesync configurations configured per port and its configuration array count.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port number
[in]array_sizeRequired Count of timesync configurations
[out]config_array(IN/OUT) Pointer to timesync configurations (see BCM_PORT_TIMESYNC_CONFIG_T)
[out]array_countPointer to timesync configuration array count

◆ bcm_port_timesync_config_set()

int bcm_port_timesync_config_set ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
int  config_count,
bcm_port_timesync_config_t *  config_array 
)

Set timesync configurations for the port.

Set port and MPLS timesync configurations for the port. This function sets timesync configurations for the specified port, and for each MPLS label range of that port. The timesync configurations must be setup as an array of configuration types with its related configurations. The port timesync configuration must specify one-step or two-step timestamp type and its packet drop and CPU forward bitmaps. The MPLS timesync configurations must be setup with min and max MPLS label range and its respect ive packet drop and CPU forward bitmaps. Note that BCM56640 supports one port timesync configuration and two MPLS label range timesync configurations per port. BCM56440 supports only one port type timesync configuration. To disable timesync configuration on a particular port, bcm_port_timesync_config_set() API needs to be called with zero config count and NULL pointer needs to be passed to bcm_port_timesync_config_t structure pointer. This function applies to both local device ports and remote device ports. The following flags and packet type are invalid on remote device ports for BCM56870/BCM56770/BCM56370, instead they are only allowed on local device ports:BCM_PORT_TIMESYNC_ONE_STEP_TIMESTAMP, BCM_PORT_TIMESYNC_TWO_STEP_TIMESTAMP, BCM_PORT_TIMESYNC_TIMESTAMP_CFUPDATE_ALL, and BCM_PORT_TIMESYNC_PKT_INVALID. Proxy type gport is allowed to pass when this function is used to set remote device ports.

bcm_port_timesync_config_t
PORT_MATCH_MIM_SERVICE_SMAC MiM match entry includes Source B-MAC address The bcm_port_match_info_t structure describes the match criteria.
// Generic port match attribute structure
typedef struct bcm_port_match_info_s {
bcm_port_match_t match; // Match criteria
bcm_gport_t port; // Match port
bcm_vlan_t match_vlan; // Outer VLAN ID to match
bcm_vlan_t match_vlan_max; // Maximum VLAN ID in range to match
bcm_vlan_t match_inner_vlan; // Inner VLAN ID to match
bcm_vlan_t match_inner_vlan_max; // Maximum Inner VLAN ID in range to match
bcm_vlan_t match_tunnel_vlan; // B-domain VID
bcm_mac_t match_tunnel_srcmac; // B-domain source MAC address
bcm_mpls_label_t match_label; // MPLS label
uint32 flags; // BCM_PORT_MATCH_XXX flags
bcm_tunnel_id_t match_pon_tunnel; // PON Tunnel value to match.
bcm_port_ethertype_t match_ethertype; // Ethernet type value to match
int match_pcp; // Outer PCP ID to match
bcm_vlan_action_set_t *action; // Match action
uint16 extended_port_vid; // Extender port VID
bcm_vpn_t vpn; // VPN ID
uint16 niv_port_vif; // NIV port VIF
uint32 isid;
bcm_mac_t src_mac; // Source Mac Address
uint32 port_class; // Port Class Id
} bcm_port_match_info_t;
For BCM_PORT_MATCH_PORT_VLAN, BCM_PORT_MATCH_PORT_VLAN_RANGE and BCM_PORT_MATCH_PORT_VLAN_STACKED, the matching physical port/trunk may either be supplied as part of the bcm_port_match_info_t structure or may be the virtual port's initial physical port/trunk. To use the virtual port's initial port/trunk, the port member of the bcm_port_match_info_t structure must be set to BCM_GPORT_INVALID.
Field BCM Type Description
flags uint32 Timesync Configuration flags TIMESYNC_CONFIGURATION_FLAGS_table
pkt_drop uint32 Packet Drop bitmap of event and general timesync packet types TIMESYNC_PACKET_TYPES_table
pkt_tocpu uint32 CPU forward bitmap of event and general timesync packet types TIMESYNC_PACKET_TYPES_table
mpls_min_label int Min label for Timesync over MPLS
mpls_max_label int Max label for Timesync over MPLS
src_mac_addr bcm_mac_t Source MAC address update for one step timestamp
typedef struct bcm_port_timesync_config_s {
uint32 flags; // configuration flags
uint32 pkt_drop; // Packet drop types
uint32 pkt_tocpu; // Packet forward to CPU
int mpls_min_label; // MPLS min label
int mpls_max_label; // MPLS max label
bcm_mac_t src_mac_addr; // Source MAC address
} bcm_port_timesync_config_t;

Timesync configuration flags
Configuration Flag Description
BCM_PORT_TIMESYNC_DEFAULT Timesync Configuration
BCM_PORT_TIMESYNC_MPLS Timesync MPLS configuration
BCM_PORT_TIMESYNC_ONE_STEP_TIMESTAMP One Step Timestamp configuration
BCM_PORT_TIMESYNC_TWO_STEP_TIMESTAMP Two Step Timestamp configuration
BCM_PORT_TIMESYNC_TIMESTAMP_CFUPDATE_ALL All 1588 packets will be egress timestamped. By default, only ingress timestamped packets are egress timestamped

Timesync Packet Types
Timesync Packet Type Description
BCM_PORT_TIMESYNC_PKT_SYNC Sync Event Packet type
BCM_PORT_TIMESYNC_PKT_DELAY_REQ Delay Request Event Packet type
BCM_PORT_TIMESYNC_PKT_PDELAY_REQ Pdelay Request Event Packet type
BCM_PORT_TIMESYNC_PKT_PDELAY_RESP Pdelay Response Event Packet type
BCM_PORT_TIMESYNC_PKT_FOLLOWUP Followup General Packet type
BCM_PORT_TIMESYNC_PKT_DELAY_RESP Delay_resp General Packet type
BCM_PORT_TIMESYNC_PKT_PDELAY_RESP_FOLLOWUP Pdelay resp followup packet type
BCM_PORT_TIMESYNC_PKT_ANNOUNCE Announce general packet type
BCM_PORT_TIMESYNC_PKT_SIGNALLING Signalling general packet type
BCM_PORT_TIMESYNC_PKT_MANAGEMENT Management general packet type
BCM_PORT_TIMESYNC_PKT_INVALID Invalid Packet
Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port number
[in]config_countCount of timesync configurations
[in]config_arrayPointer to timesync configurations (see BCM_PORT_TIMESYNC_CONFIG_T)

◆ bcm_port_timesync_config_t_init()

void bcm_port_timesync_config_t_init ( bcm_port_timesync_config_t *  port_timesync_config)

Initialize a Port Configuration structure.

Initializes a port configuration structure to default values. This function should be used to initialize any Port Configuration structure prior to filling it out and passing it to an API function.

Parameters
[in,out]port_timesync_config
Return values
NONE.

◆ bcm_port_timesync_tx_info_get()

int bcm_port_timesync_tx_info_get ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
bcm_port_timesync_tx_info_t *  tx_info 
)

Get 1588 packet's transmit information form the port.

In 1588 two-step mode, get timestamp and sequence id of ptp packet after sending 1588 packet.

bcm_port_timesync_tx_info_t
Field BCM Type Description
timestamp uint64 Transmit timestamp of ptp packet
sequence_id uint32 Sequence id of transmitted ptp packet
typedef struct bcm_port_timesync_tx_info_s {
uint64 timestamp; // transmit timestamp of ptp packet
uint32 sequence_id; // sequence id of transmitted ptp packet
} bcm_port_timesync_tx_info_t;
Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port number
[in,out]tx_info(IN/OUT) Pointer to structure to get timesync tx information (see BCM_PORT_TIMESYNC_TX_INFO_T)

◆ bcm_port_tpid_add()

int bcm_port_tpid_add ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
uint16  tpid,
int  color_select 
)

Add an allowed outer tag protocol ID (TPID) for the specified port.

Add an allowed VLAN tag protocol ID of outer VLAN tags on newer devices which allow to configure more than one outer TPID for a port.

Color Mode
Tag Color Mode Description
BCM_COLOR_PRIORITY map VLAN priority to color
BCM_COLOR_OUTER_CFI map Outer VLAN tag CFI to color
BCM_COLOR_INNER_CFI map Inner VLAN tag CFI to color
Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port number
[in]tpidTag protocol ID
[in]color_selectColor mode, as specified in BCM_TAG_COLORMODE_table

◆ bcm_port_tpid_class_create()

int bcm_port_tpid_class_create ( int  unit,
uint32  flags,
bcm_port_tag_struct_type_t  tag_struct_type,
bcm_port_tag_format_class_t *  tag_format_class_id 
)

Create/destroy a VLAN tag classification ID used to aggregate a group of ports for further processing such as VLAN translation and field processing.

Create/delete a VLAN tag classification ID used to aggregate a group of ports for further processing such as VLAN translation and field processing. The VLAN tag structure types are shown in bcm_tag_struct_type_e:

bcm_port_class_t
bcmTagStructTypeUntag Type Untagged
bcmTagStructTypeSTag Type S tag
bcmTagStructTypeCTag Type C tag
bcmTagStructTypeSCTag Type S C tag
TagStructTypeSPrioCTag Type S prio C tag
NofTagStructType Number of tag structure types
Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]flagsFlags
[in]tag_struct_typeVLAN tag structure type (relevant only for create)
[in,out]tag_format_class_idVLAN tag classification ID

◆ bcm_port_tpid_class_destroy()

int bcm_port_tpid_class_destroy ( int  unit,
uint32  flags,
bcm_port_tag_format_class_t  tag_format_class_id 
)

Create/destroy a VLAN tag classification ID used to aggregate a group of ports for further processing such as VLAN translation and field processing.

Create/delete a VLAN tag classification ID used to aggregate a group of ports for further processing such as VLAN translation and field processing. The VLAN tag structure types are shown in bcm_tag_struct_type_e:

bcm_port_class_t
bcmTagStructTypeUntag Type Untagged
bcmTagStructTypeSTag Type S tag
bcmTagStructTypeCTag Type C tag
bcmTagStructTypeSCTag Type S C tag
TagStructTypeSPrioCTag Type S prio C tag
NofTagStructType Number of tag structure types
Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]flagsFlags
[in]tag_format_class_idVLAN tag classification ID

◆ bcm_port_tpid_class_get()

int bcm_port_tpid_class_get ( int  unit,
bcm_port_tpid_class_t *  tpid_class 
)

Get VLAN tag classification for a port.

Get VLAN tag classification for a port. Get tag-classifier for given identified TPIDs on packet.

Parameters

[in,out]tpid_classPointer to a structure that holds both the key and the info for Port TPID class configuration.

◆ bcm_port_tpid_get()

int bcm_port_tpid_get ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
uint16 *  tpid 
)

Set the default tag protocol ID (TPID) for the specified port.

Set the default tag protocol IDs for the inner and outer tags for double-tagging mode. Not all chips can control both tags. If the "port" parameter is SubTag subport group gport then set the default SubTag tag protocol ID for the subport group. For BCM5645x all logical SubTag subport groups under a given physical port will have same default SubTag tag protocol ID.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port number
[out]tpidTag protocol ID

int *  color_array,
int *  count 
)

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portlogical port number
[in]sizenumber of elements of the next two array parameters
[out]tpid_arraybuffer array to hold a list of retrieved tpids
[out]color_arraybuffer array to hold a list of retrieved color selections
[out]countactual number of tpids retrieved

◆ bcm_port_trunk_index_get()

int bcm_port_trunk_index_get ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
int *  port_index 
)

Set or get port index of a trunk for ingress port that is used to select the egress port in the trunk.

The port index is a programmable value that is used to select the egress port in the trunk for transmit. In addition, this feature can be turned on by using RTAG 7 of a trunk group.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port number
[out]port_indexPort index of a trunk.

◆ bcm_port_trunk_index_set()

Set or get port index of a trunk for ingress port that is used to select the egress port in the trunk.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port number
[in]port_indexPort index of a trunk.

◆ bcm_port_untagged_priority_get()

int bcm_port_untagged_priority_get ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
int *  priority 
)

Get or set the default priority for packets that ingress untagged.

All packets that ingress a port untagged are treated as if they were tagged with the value specified by bcm_port_untagged_priority_set. This priority is used regardless of any ARL entry match. Selected SoC devices allow optional priority remapping determined by a subsequent ARL entry match. In those configurations, the priority specified in bcm_port_untagged_priority_set is applied only if there is no subsequent ARL match. To configure this scenario, two separate calls to bcm_port_untagged_priority_set must be executed. The first call passes the (positive) priority to be assigned when no ARL hits occur. The second call passes a negative priority, which allows ARL hits to specify the assigned priority. These APIs can also be used for WLAN gports. They will set/get the default priority for untagged packets coming in from a WLAN source port.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice port number or logical device
[out]priorityPriority to assign to packets that ingress the port untagged. A negative value here has special meaning to certain SoC devices.

◆ bcm_port_untagged_priority_set()

int bcm_port_untagged_priority_set ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
int  priority 
)

Get or set the default priority for packets that ingress untagged.

All packets that ingress a port untagged are treated as if they were tagged with the value specified by bcm_port_untagged_priority_set. This priority is used regardless of any ARL entry match. Selected SoC devices allow optional priority remapping determined by a subsequent ARL entry match. In those configurations, the priority specified in bcm_port_untagged_priority_set is applied only if there is no subsequent ARL match. To configure this scenario, two separate calls to bcm_port_untagged_priority_set must be executed. The first call passes the (positive) priority to be assigned when no ARL hits occur. The second call passes a negative priority, which allows ARL hits to specify the assigned priority. These APIs can also be used for WLAN gports. They will set/get the default priority for untagged packets coming in from a WLAN source port.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice port number or logical device
[in]priorityPriority to assign to packets that ingress the port untagged. A negative value here has special meaning to certain SoC devices.

◆ bcm_port_untagged_vlan_get()

int bcm_port_untagged_vlan_get ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
bcm_vlan_t *  vid_ptr 
)

Get or set the default VLAN for packets that ingress untagged.

All packets that ingress a port untagged are treated as if they were tagged with the value specified by bcm_port_untagged_vlan_set. All ports are initially configured with the untagged VLAN set to the default VLAN (or VLAN 1). If the packet egresses on a port that is configured as a tagged port, the VLAN ID in the egressing packet is set to this value. If the (port,vid) resolves to a VLAN gport, untagged packets will be sent to the to the VLAN port, and not the default VLAN. Similarly, if (port,vid) resolves to a MPLS gport, untagged packets will be sent to the MPLS port and not to the default VLAN. In either case, the value does not affect the egress behavior of packets. To affect egress behavior of a VLAN gport, a GPORT ID is passed as the port parameter. The vid is used as the untagged vid on ingress into a PEP. Specifically, when an STAG only packet arrives on a provider port, and egresses a customer port, the given vid is added to the untagged packet on egress. These APIs can also be used for WLAN gports. They will set/get the default VLAN for untagged packets coming in from a WLAN source port.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice port number or logical device
[out]vid_ptrPointer to location to store current default VLAN ID.

◆ bcm_port_untagged_vlan_set()

int bcm_port_untagged_vlan_set ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
bcm_vlan_t  vid 
)

Get or set the default VLAN for packets that ingress untagged.

All packets that ingress a port untagged are treated as if they were tagged with the value specified by bcm_port_untagged_vlan_set. All ports are initially configured with the untagged VLAN set to the default VLAN (or VLAN 1). If the packet egresses on a port that is configured as a tagged port, the VLAN ID in the egressing packet is set to this value. If the (port,vid) resolves to a VLAN gport, untagged packets will be sent to the to the VLAN port, and not the default VLAN. Similarly, if (port,vid) resolves to a MPLS gport, untagged packets will be sent to the MPLS port and not to the default VLAN. In either case, the value does not affect the egress behavior of packets. To affect egress behavior of a VLAN gport, a GPORT ID is passed as the port parameter. The vid is used as the untagged vid on ingress into a PEP. Specifically, when an STAG only packet arrives on a provider port, and egresses a customer port, the given vid is added to the untagged packet on egress. These APIs can also be used for WLAN gports. They will set/get the default VLAN for untagged packets coming in from a WLAN source port.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice port number or logical device
[in]vidVLAN ID used for packets that ingress the port untagged.

◆ bcm_port_update()

int bcm_port_update ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
int  link 
)

Process a link change event and perform required device configuration.

This function is performed automatically by Link Monitoring and Notification . This routine should only be used if the bcm_linkscan APIs are not used (it is strongly recommended that the linkscan be used to notice and process all link events). If link is 0, the link down events are processed including possible PHY programming. Similarly if link is 1, the MAC for the port is programmed to match the current PHY configuration in terms of speed and duplex. If the supplied linkscan is not used, when a link up or link down event is recognized on a port, this routine must be called to properly program both the MAC and the PHY. Calling this function with traffic flowing on the specified port has undefined results.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port number
[in]link0 to indicate a link down event has been recognized and 1 for a link up event.

◆ bcm_port_vlan_dscp_map_get()

int bcm_port_vlan_dscp_map_get ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
bcm_vlan_t  vlan,
int  dscp,
int *  internal_pri,
bcm_color_t *  color 
)

Map the incoming IP packet DSCP to internal priority and color.

Configure the mapping of IP packet code point (dscp) to device internal priority and color on a per-port per-VLAN (outer tag in the packet) basis.

[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port number
[in]vlanVLAN ID
[in]dscpSource code point
[out]internal_priPriority internal to device
(OUT for "_get") Priority internal to device
[out]colorColor for the packet, internal to device
(OUT for "_get") Color for the packet, internal to device

int  internal_pri,
bcm_color_t  color

◆ bcm_port_vlan_inner_tag_get()

int bcm_port_vlan_inner_tag_get ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
uint16 *  inner_tag 
)

Set the inner tag value to be added to the outgoing packet.

Set the inner tag value to be added to the outgoing packet. To add inner VLAN tag to the outgoing packet, the application must enable BCM_PORT_DTAG_ADD_EXTERNAL_TAG flag when specifying double tag mode with bcm_port_dtag_mode_set.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port number
[out]inner_tag(for "_set") Inner tag of the packet. Priority[15:13] CFI[12] VLAN ID [11:0]
(for "_get", OUT) Inner tag of the packet.

◆ bcm_port_vlan_inner_tag_set()

bcm_port_t  port,
uint16  inner_tag 
)

Set the inner tag value to be added to the outgoing packet.

Set the inner tag value to be added to the outgoing packet. To add inner VLAN tag to the outgoing packet, the application must enable BCM_PORT_DTAG_ADD_EXTERNAL_TAG flag when specifying double tag mode with bcm_port_dtag_mode_set.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port number
[in]inner_tag(for "_set") Inner tag of the packet. Priority[15:13] CFI[12] VLAN ID [11:0]
(for "_get", OUT) Inner tag of the packet.

◆ bcm_port_vlan_member_get()

int bcm_port_vlan_member_get ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
uint32 *  flags 
)

Set or retrieve current behavior of tagged packets arriving/leaving on a port not a member of the specified VLAN.

Ingress/egress filtering, if enabled, drops all packets arriving/leaving on a port with a VLAN tag identifying a VLAN of which the port is not a member. If disabled, packets will not be dropped if the port is not a member of the VLAN specified in the packet. It may however be dropped for other reasons such as spanning tree state, head of line blocking etc. For StrataXGS?III, ingress filtering is also applied. Virtual Port(VP) will be assigned to a VP group or removed from a VP group through this API when filtering is enabled or disabled if flag BCM_PORT_VLAN_MEMBER_VP_VLAN_MEMBERSHIP is not set. So if user uses un-managed VP group mechanism, API bcm_port_control_set() with bcmPortControlVlanVpGroupEgress/bcmPortControlVlanVpGroupIngress type should be called before bcm_port_vlan_member_set(). And if user use managed VP group mechanism, bcm_port_vlan_member_set should be called before API bcm_vlan_gport_add . Please refer to the DESCRIPTION of bcm_vlan_gport_add for more detail about VP group . BCM_PORT_VLAN_MEMBER_VP_DO_NOT_CHECK is used with BCM_PORT_VLAN_MEMBER_INGRESS/BCM_PORT_VLAN_MEMBER_EGRESS for L2 tunnel cases. When the flag is set, VLAN filtering is performed on VLAN and phisical port, instead of on VFI and VP. This function supersedes bcm_port_ifilter_get . Valid settings for flags are described in BCM_PORT_VLAN_MEMBER_FLAGS_table .

Flags for Port Ingress and Egress Modes
Filter Mode Meaning
BCM_PORT_VLAN_MEMBER_INGRESS Ingress filtering is enabled if this flag is set; disabled otherwise.
BCM_PORT_VLAN_MEMBER_EGRESS Egress filtering is enabled if this flag is set; disabled otherwise.
BCM_PORT_VLAN_MEMBER_VP_VLAN_MEMBERSHIP vp vlan membership filtering method.
BCM_PORT_VLAN_MEMBER_VP_DO_NOT_CHECK indicate forwarding domain the filtering happens.
Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port number
[out]flagsFlags to indicate port filtering mode

◆ bcm_port_vlan_member_set()

int bcm_port_vlan_member_set ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
uint32  flags 
)

Set or retrieve current behavior of tagged packets arriving/leaving on a port not a member of the specified VLAN.

Ingress/egress filtering, if enabled, drops all packets arriving/leaving on a port with a VLAN tag identifying a VLAN of which the port is not a member. If disabled, packets will not be dropped if the port is not a member of the VLAN specified in the packet. It may however be dropped for other reasons such as spanning tree state, head of line blocking etc. For StrataXGS?III, ingress filtering is also applied. Virtual Port(VP) will be assigned to a VP group or removed from a VP group through this API when filtering is enabled or disabled if flag BCM_PORT_VLAN_MEMBER_VP_VLAN_MEMBERSHIP is not set. So if user uses un-managed VP group mechanism, API bcm_port_control_set() with bcmPortControlVlanVpGroupEgress/bcmPortControlVlanVpGroupIngress type should be called before bcm_port_vlan_member_set(). And if user use managed VP group mechanism, bcm_port_vlan_member_set should be called before API bcm_vlan_gport_add . Please refer to the DESCRIPTION of bcm_vlan_gport_add for more detail about VP group . BCM_PORT_VLAN_MEMBER_VP_DO_NOT_CHECK is used with BCM_PORT_VLAN_MEMBER_INGRESS/BCM_PORT_VLAN_MEMBER_EGRESS for L2 tunnel cases. When the flag is set, VLAN filtering is performed on VLAN and phisical port, instead of on VFI and VP. This function supersedes bcm_port_ifilter_get . Valid settings for flags are described in BCM_PORT_VLAN_MEMBER_FLAGS_table .

Flags for Port Ingress and Egress Modes
Filter Mode Meaning
BCM_PORT_VLAN_MEMBER_INGRESS Ingress filtering is enabled if this flag is set; disabled otherwise.
BCM_PORT_VLAN_MEMBER_EGRESS Egress filtering is enabled if this flag is set; disabled otherwise.
BCM_PORT_VLAN_MEMBER_VP_VLAN_MEMBERSHIP vp vlan membership filtering method.
BCM_PORT_VLAN_MEMBER_VP_DO_NOT_CHECK indicate forwarding domain the filtering happens.
Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port number
[in]flagsFlags to indicate port filtering mode

◆ bcm_port_vlan_priority_mapping_get()

int bcm_port_vlan_priority_mapping_get ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
bcm_vlan_t  vid,
int  pkt_pri,
int  cfi,
bcm_priority_mapping_t *  pri_map 
)

Get the mapping of wire/packet PRI and CFI to internal priority and color.

This API can be used to retrieve the mapping of Ingress packet priority and Canonical Format Indicator (CFI) to internal priority and color values. When an invalid value is passed into bcm_vlan_t param, the API gets the mapping for the specified port (bcm_port_t). Also a GPORT (MPLS or VLAN logical gport) can be passed in as bcm_port_t param.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portPort number.
[in]vidVLAN identifier
[in]pkt_priPacket priority
[in]cfiCanonical Format Indicator (CFI) in packet VLAN tag
[out]pri_mapPriority mapping information
Return values
BCM_E_XXX

◆ bcm_port_vlan_priority_mapping_set()

int bcm_port_vlan_priority_mapping_set ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
bcm_vlan_t  vid,
int  pkt_pri,
int  cfi,
bcm_priority_mapping_t *  pri_map 
)

Set the mapping of wire/packet PRI and CFI to internal priority and color.

This API can be used to set the Ingress priority mapping for a given packet priority and VLAN cfi. For BCM88020, the application has the flexibility to pass two different sets of values for internal priority and color (one for remarking and the other for fabric). When an invalid value is passed into bcm_vlan_t param, the API sets the mapping for the specified port (bcm_port_t). Also, a GPORT (MPLS or VLAN logical gport) can be passed in as bcm_port_t param. The struct bcm_priority_mapping_t is used to describe the priority mapping data.

bcm_priority_mapping_t
Field Type Description
internal_pri int Internal priority
color bcm_color_t Internal color or drop precedence
remark_internal_pri int Internal remarking priority
remark_color bcm_color_t Internal remarking color or drop precedence
policer_offset int Offset based on pri/cos to fetch a policer
typedef struct bcm_priority_mapping_s {
int internal_pri; // Internal priority
bcm_color_t color; // (internal) color or drop precedence
int remark_internal_pri; // (internal) remarking priority
bcm_color_t remark_color; // (internal) remarking color or drop precedence
int policer_offset; // Offset based on pri/cos to fetch a policer
} bcm_priority_mapping_t;
Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portPort number.
[in]vidVLAN identifier
[in]pkt_priPacket priority
[in]cfiCanonical Format Indicator (CFI) in packet VLAN tag
[in]pri_mapPriority mapping information
Return values
BCM_E_XXX

◆ bcm_port_vlan_priority_unmap_get()

int bcm_port_vlan_priority_unmap_get ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
int  internal_pri,
bcm_color_t  color,
int *  pkt_pri,
int *  cfi 
)

Map the internal priority and color to outgoing packet priority and Canonical Format Indicator (CFI).

Configure the mapping of the internal packet priority and color to outgoing packet priority and Canonical Format Indicator (CFI). This mapping is used only when bcmSwitchColorModeSelect is configure in BCM_COLOR_OUTER_CFI or BCM_COLOR_INNER_CFI mode.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port number
[in]internal_priPriority internal to device
[in]colorColor for the packet
[out]pkt_pri(for "_set") Priority in packet VLAN tag
(for "_get", OUT) Priority in packet VLAN tag
[out]cfi(for "_set") Canonical Format Indicator (CFI) in packet VLAN tag
(for "_get", OUT) Canonical Format Indicator (CFI) in packet VLAN tag

◆ bcm_port_vlan_priority_unmap_set()

int bcm_port_vlan_priority_unmap_set ( int  unit,
bcm_port_t  port,
int  internal_pri,
bcm_color_t  color,
int  pkt_pri,
int  cfi 
)

Map the internal priority and color to outgoing packet priority and Canonical Format Indicator (CFI).

Configure the mapping of the internal packet priority and color to outgoing packet priority and Canonical Format Indicator (CFI). This mapping is used only when bcmSwitchColorModeSelect is configure in BCM_COLOR_OUTER_CFI or BCM_COLOR_INNER_CFI mode.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]portDevice or logical port number
[in]internal_priPriority internal to device
[in]colorColor for the packet
[in]pkt_pri(for "_set") Priority in packet VLAN tag
(for "_get", OUT) Priority in packet VLAN tag
[in]cfi(for "_set") Canonical Format Indicator (CFI) in packet VLAN tag
(for "_get", OUT) Canonical Format Indicator (CFI) in packet VLAN tag

◆ bcm_port_vlan_vector_get()

int bcm_port_vlan_vector_get ( int  unit,
bcm_gport_t  port_id,
bcm_vlan_vector_t  vlan_vec 
)

Get the range(s) of VIDs for the specified logical port (GPORT).

Find/get the range(s) of VIDs that are allowed on a physical port or a GPORT. The port_id param can either be an MPLS gport or a logical layer 2 gport or simply a physical port.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]port_idGPORT identifier
[out]vlan_vecVLAN vector
Return values
BCM_E_XXX

◆ bcm_port_vlan_vector_set()

int bcm_port_vlan_vector_set ( int  unit,
bcm_gport_t  port_id,
bcm_vlan_vector_t  vlan_vec 
)

Update the specified logical port (GPORT) with the given range(s) of VIDs.

This API provides for allowing more than a single VID on a physical port. The port_id param can either be a MPLS gport or a logical layer 2 gport or simply a physical port. Updating a gport that was previously created with a match criteria of MATCH_PORT_VLAN_STACKED or MATCH_LABEL_* is not allowed.

Parameters
[in]unitUnit number.
[in]port_idGPORT identifier
[in]vlan_vecVLAN vector
Return values
BCM_E_XXX

uint64 *  data

Name Description

◆ bcm_priority_mapping_t_init()

void bcm_priority_mapping_t_init ( bcm_priority_mapping_t *  pri_map)

Initialize a Priority Mapping structure.

Initializes a priority mapping structure to default values. This function should be used to initialize any priority mapping structure prior to filling it out and passing it to an API function. This ensures that subsequent API releases may add new structure members to the bcm_priority_mapping_t structure, and bcm_priority_mapping_t_init will initialize the new members to correct default values.

Parameters
[in]pri_mapPointer to Priority Mapping structure to initialize.
Return values
NONE.
